Reviews.Title: “Great location/value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: moonstream11
Reviews.Content: We found this reasonably priced hotel right off Times Square to be clean and convenient. Room was a bit crowded for my husband plus our two teen girls, but we managed and expected as much in the city. With wi-fi and breakfast included & parking across the street, this was the best value I could find in this area. We frequented the little market around the corner & the small bar was just the place for my husband & I to escape one night to watch NCAA playoffs. I especially appreciated how quiet our room was. We'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: Jackie W
Reviews.Content: The Hotel @ Times Square is actually on W 46th Street but a 5 minute walk to Times Square. We found the hotel convenient for most sights and travel hubs. Central Park is about 15 minutes walk. Breakfast is complimentary and buffet style. You have free internet access in the lobby which is a good seating area and staff were attentive and helpful. There is a bar on the 2nd floor so avoid those rooms if you can. We were on the 10th and although there is no view the room was clean and quiet with adequate storage. The bathroom was always left clean with fresh towels if needed. A criticism would be that the rooms are quite dark. A good deli a few yards away and lots of restaurants close-by. If you are looking for value for money this hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Week-end stay”
Reviews.Author: Annick R
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 12 adult art students from Montreal who stayed march 23rd-25th 2012. Booking from a distance for a group is always tricky but this hotel made it easy. We were all pleased to see that what we were told was exactly what we got. The hotel is definately perfect in terms of location. The rooms had everything we needed cleanliness, comfy beds, quiet and an easy basic but fresh self-serve breakfast. We were busy all day and evenings touring galleries and museums. We did not need a bedroom view, large rooms or kitchenette so the rooms and smaller hotel was perfect for our group! I would never hesitate to stay here again with the same conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Stay”
Reviews.Author: George G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After reading of bed bugs, foul and noisy rooms, I looked forward to my stay in NY with fear and trepidation. Happily all these fears were unfounded in my stay at the Hotel at Times Square. The room though a bit small, was clean and recently renovated and well finished. The room was a high floor room and hence quiet. Breakfast was superb and of good quality and excellent service. Location is excellent just a block away from heart of colourful Times Square and theatre district. They say that NY is a city that never sleeps and I fully agree. We spent the wee hours of the night and morning, felt very secure and enjoyed the experience. Service at the hotel was overall excellent and found the lounge very welcoming and convenience bar thoughtful since we had to spend some time at the lounge before our departure to DC later in the evening. The hotel is a hive of activity with a high rate of turnover so book your rooms early. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: shoresh_10
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Good price, all include: basic breakfast, free drinks machine, free WiFi and telefon calls within US. Very clean. Importent to ask for good and quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: lych2012
Reviews.Content: Real value for money hotel stay! The main reason for choosing this hotel is the fantastic location with easy accessibility. A great plus too is the daily continental breakfast served. It might not be much but reasonable. The room is small though with 4 adults but still comfortable enough with clean facilities. Don't expect any nice views! Our request for early check in was accomodated when we arrived. The bellhop was very helpful during check out and helped us in hailing a cab to JFK. We managed to find a cab that was willing to take us to the airport at 4pm with 4 adults and 8 luggage, with reasonable rates! All in all, a great stay in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again when I return”
Reviews.Author: Audreyow
Reviews.Content: Price is superb for the location, service and overall you get. It's a short walk from Times Square so you aren't affected by too much hustle and bustle. There's decent and basic complimentary continental breakfast daily. There's a free drinks machine that has great hot chocolate at the lobby. The room may be a little small but it's comfortable and clean and toiletries provided, with ironing facilities too. Plus free wifi throughout the hotel! Next to the hotel, there are an Italian and Mexican restaurants. The food is great and the prices are reasonable too. I'll return when I return to NYC the next time :)

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel-Do Not Use Concierge”
Reviews.Author: jcharlop
Reviews.Content: I really adore this property. Have stayed here many times. The rooms are always clean -- especially by New York standard. Location is awesome -- 5 minute walk to Times Square. Most of the service personnel are efficient, responsive and pleasant. Most recent trip, the female desk clerk during the day was so rude it was almost comical. We asked for her assistance to help us call a cab as we had six people and needed a mini-van cab and she refused to help us in any way. Do not recommend using their concierge service at all. It's not directly affiliated with the hotel. They misrepresented the tickets sold and we had to repurchase to get reserved tickets for Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. Last time we found them to be rude as well. Buy online or from alternate vendor.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Contemporary, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JEBSV3
Reviews.Content: Great location on 46th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues, so convenient to Times Square, Grand Central, Theatre District, restaurants in Hells Kitchen, subways and buses, and the Lincoln Tunnel. Beautiful old building with contemporary, youthful rooms. Great staff - very friendly. They let us into our room at 11 rather than 3, and let us store a suitcase the final day after we checked out of our room but before we left NYC. Decent free continental breakfast - bagels, yogurt, etc. Certainly enough to keep you going until lunchtime. Coffee/hot chocolate, tea, water always available in the lobby. Highly discounted rate with a parking garage on the next block. We paid $52 to park from 11 am until 7 pm the next day. We had 2 double beds with 2 parents and 2 teens. Did NOT feel crowded in the room. You're in NYC - you shouldn't be spending much time in your room! Highly recommend this hotel and its friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest room I have ever stayed in,in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Sherrygg
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel!!! Will recommend to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Would definatly stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Topquailty
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel and was pleasantly surprised. The location, room size and service were all great. No complaints other than I wish the shower was a little but warmer. Apart from that it was all vey good. Would definately stay here again and would recommend it. Excellent value for money plus free WI-FI and complimentary breakfast is a bonus. Stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: SophiesMom1
Reviews.Content: This place has definite pluses and minuses. The most important issues are good: comfortable bed, clean linen, clean bathroom, reasonable sized room for NYC, good location (near Times Square), decent breakfast. My pet peeves include the following. 1 Lack of a fan in the bathroom so the mirror fogs up every time you shower and the place takes a while to air out after someone uses the facilities. 2 Difficult to regulate the temperature. We visited in early March when the temps outside were in the 40s, but we had to run the air-conditioning constantly to keep the room cool enough. 3 Breakfast was adequate but could use some variety beyond cold cereal, juice, coffee, toast and donuts. Yogurt would have been a nice addition. 4 Desk staff were very slow and it seemed to take forever to check in and check out. Meanwhile a good sized line was developing behind us. 5 Dreary view of a fire escape, but I guess that is par for the course in NYC. We didn't have the elevator problem reported by another reviewer. The elevators aren't terribly speedy, but we never waited more than 2 minutes for one to come. Another reviewer reported construction noise waking him/her each morning. The construction was still in full swing when we were there, but the noise never started until 7:30AM which is quite reasonable, in my mind. Overall, we were pleased and will stay here again our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location... Good Value for $$ and Great Hotel Staffs”
Reviews.Author: sbjohari
Reviews.Content: I am a Singaporean who has been to New York 3 times (Apr 2008, Apr 2010 and Feb 2012) as a tourist with my wife. My wife and i simply love New York and the current hotel we recently stayed at. We had stayed: 1st trip, 2008, at Sheraton Newark Airport (1 night), went on a tour package before ending up at Comfort Inn JFK Airport (1 night) after our tour package ends and the next day we transferred and stayed at New York City: Comfort Inn Midtown West Convention Center (5 nights) for a self tour, shopping and touristy adventures. 2nd trip, 2010, at Best Western Convention Center Hotel (11 nights) self tour & shopping. 3rd trip, 2012, at The Hotel @ Times Square (15 nights) self tour, shopping and eating.(10th February 2012 to 25th Feb 2012) The current hotel (The Hotel @ Times Square) we had stayed in Feb 2012, full review below: The Hotel @ Times Square (3rd trip to NY) was chosen as it was the cheapest and competently positively reviewed hotel to stay at in NYC in 2012 Tripadvisor reviews, we made a decision in mid Jan 2012 for our trip and arrival to NYC on the 10th Feb 2012 (such confidence we had on our familiarity to that place). Comfort Inn and Best Western which were our previous hotels cost more now in 2012, more expensive than The Hotel @ Times Square currently. Upon arrival to JFK airport, we again took the bus (www.nycairporter.com/) from JFK to Port Authority and walk from there to the hotel. We arrived in Port Authority before noon and walk to our hotel with our two 28" hard case luggage & one 14" canvass luggage through the packed and busy streets of Manhattan. Initial reaction we had was that the walk was long and hard especially under cold and windy conditions through packed crowds but during our 15 nights stay there, we realised the distance wasn't that bad, just that we shouldn't walk in noon time with our two 28" hard case luggage & one 14" canvass luggage through a packed and busy streets of Manhattan with jetlag dragging on our heels after an almost 24hrs flight journey from Singapore to NY .... 8) During reservation, we requested for a higher floor, street facing room. Upon arrival to our hotel, we requested for an early checkin but the check-in lady clerk informed that our rooms were not ready for early check in but if we want to we could get another non-street facing room else, we need to wait till after 2pm. We opted to wait for our rooms and had our bags kept in hotel storage while we walk around the nearby areas. (For the record among all the staffs we encountered during our stay there, this 1st person we had contact with in the hotel is the only person we very much dislike talking to with as she just mumbled and shows disinterest during our conversations. She was not doing anything at that time except talking to us hence we can't excuse her attitude as being stressed or busy entertaining other customers. Her forced/uninterested replies was tersed and short which only results in 2 unhappy customers who had just walked through 5 blocks of busy Manhattan streets with jetlag on their heels. We made sure to have no contact with her during our stay there but the rest of the hotel staffs were wonderful to talk and banter with) Upon return after 2pm, we checked in and got a 14th floor (the highest) but the room (room 1401) faced the hotel rear. Not much of a view except for dirty roof of another building. This was not the room that we requested and waited for. If we had known, we would had just opted for early check in instead of waiting. This is the 2nd bad impression we have within the few hours of arrival in this hotel now. But we let that slide because the room we got was big and spacious, better than all the previous rooms we had in our previous stay's (except for the room at Sheraton Newark Airport). We got a big closet and bathroom but we did pay more for it as compared to the prices we paid in 2008 and 2010. But the big room makes all the irritation we had up to that point go away forgotten and forgiven. I simply love the room spaciousness. The housekeeping staff doing the room service was competent but they can be better. Once they forgot to replenish the toilet roll, once forgot to replenish the emptied tissue box, a few times didn't take away the used towels (but they always ensured we get new towels daily) and forgot twice to take the $2 tips we left for them. In fact one of the cleaning lady (so far i see only the same two cleaning ladies intervally doing our rooms) tells us that we tip too much. On the tips, i rather err on the side of caution. Overall i have no complaints about them, they were constantly busy cleaning so many rooms in a hotel that has a high turnover with so many guest checking in and out and they were cleaning even after 2pm (we once leave the room late after 2pm). No complaints about them at all for me. On the 1st night there, we couldn't turn on the telly but a guy (i guess he was the hotel night security) settled that for us immediately. The bed is King Size, high and comfortable for me but wife think it's too soft. Pillow is comfortable to rest our head. There is a radio/iPod/iPad docking station which is great. The WiFi signal is strong and works fine up on the 14th floor as well as in the lobby and breakfast room. If you do not have a wireless card installed you can always bring along your UTP cable as each room has a UTP port as well. Hotel aircon/heater could have been better, the heater was not that great running under AUTO, the temperature settings need to be adjusted accordingly to warm up the room at 80 F and when it's too warm, we need to lower it down to 75 F before sleeping but when morning comes the room becomes cold instead. I had no issues with the temperature but my wife does feel cold in the mornings. The blanket is a thin sheet, on top is a wool blanket and then the bed cover. The wool and bed cover is not change daily during turning down of the bed, so we only use the wool blanket but not the bed cover to keep us warm at night. Somehow being hygiene freaks we are, we don't think the bed cover and wool blanket is clean and changed as it could be a leftover from previous guest stay. The hotel should made an effort to communicate to their guest that the wool blanket and bed cover are changed whenever a guest checks out. Breakfast room was big, can seat more than 30 people and it has 3 telly's. Serves yogurts, donuts of many flavors, croissants, bagels, slice bread, butter & jam, apple or orange juice, coffee, tea, cuppuccino and has bread toasters and slicers for the bagels too and apples+pears+bananas and 3 kinds of cereals and boiled eggs. Opens at 6.30am and ends at 10pm. Do always go there as early as possible before the crowd comes in, on my last morning there, there was a queue coming out from the breakfast room at 9.30am, the hotel is that crowded sometimes. Hotel has a gym in the basement which i never use, it looks competent enough. There is also a water machine, ice machine, coffee/hot chocolate/hot water machine at the lobby, open 24/7. Lobby is big and spacious with many seats and sofas for guest to relax in front of 2 telly's and a fake fireplace. It has 2 working PC's plus printers for surfing the internet but it's frequently being hogged by guests. They have 3 elevators there, 2 elevators at the lobby and another 1 further inside the hotel. I am only familiar with the lobby elevators, out of the 2, only one serves from basement to the 14th floor (basement is where the breakfast room and gym are located) and the other serves from the lobby till the 12th floor (they don't have a 13th floor). Hotel is centrally located, 1 block away from Times Square and it's near and pleasent enough to walk from to the United Nations building too. We feel this hotel is located nicely in the middle to where all the actions are in Manhattan, we do like it very much. We feel safe as there is security in the hotel. The areas we walked at night are bustling with people (especially towards Times Square). For food and drinks, there is Starbucks across the street a block away, they have 4 permanent street carts along the streets in the evenings within a block and more of that in the mornings and afternoons. There is a deli a few units away for breakfast, lunch and dinner (i think it's open 24/7) and a pizza joint 2 Bros Pizza for $1 per slice. There are two 24hrs Duane & Reade's covenience stores within a block walk on other side of the avenues, a Border's Bookstore 1 block away. Walking to Grand Central is much more nearer as compared to walking to Port Authority. Bryant Park aka Public Library is a walking distance away too or a subway station ride distance. Rockfeller Ctr is like 2 streets away. Magnolia Bakery is at the Rockefeller building vicinity. The famous all night halal food supper for the peckish (53rdand6th.com/) is 7 streets away along 6th Ave, a short distance walk really. There is a 24/7 Macdonalds within the same block also. For transportation, the 47-50 St Rockefeller subway station is a short 1 street away and bus stops are available nearby on both sides of the avenues. Sauntering walking down slowly to the subway stations at 42 St Times Square and Port Authority is also recommended for some needed exercise and access to other subway lines. On our journey back to JFK airport, we procure the service through a counter available at the hotel, we paid $60 (all inclusive) for a private car ride and the driver was conveniently waiting outside the hotel for an immediate ride. We had to do that as we by now had two 20-23kgs per bag heavy, 28" hard case luggage, one 20-23kgs heavy 28" canvass luggage (bought in NYC) and one 20-23kgs heavy 14" canvass luggage. Also we got 2 carryin backpacks fully loaded too. Overall this is the BEST hotel stay we had in our experience for New York and we will sure be going there again as long as the price doesn't jump much (fat hope!). We do recommend for others to stay there. Please come before word gets out on how great the hotel is as that can only mean one thing, HIGHER ROOM RATES!!!!! I am sorry for i did not make an effort to know the staffs names but the ones who were friendly and we like are all the watchmen serving in the morning till evening. (To the one coming to Singapore soon, we hope you enjoy your stay here) To the all counter staffs (except for the older lady working in the morning) who always smiles and greet customers walking through the lobby. Not forgetting the friendly old man who serves in the breakfast room and also to the 2 housekeeping ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Started good, had potential, but last day went down the drain.”
Reviews.Author: LineNoise
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business in December 2011. I was here during the tree lighting and the place was packed to the gills. The breakfast was a very good continental breakfast, the lobby was very nice. The room was a good size too for NYC. If you stay in the back of the hotel, there's 1 elevator that services about 14 floors if I remember correctly. Here's the problem; It's the slowest elevator in NYC. I worked walking high rises in the city and rode elevators for hours and this one was the most ridiculous POS ever. One morning I waited for 20 minutes while it skipped my floor and went back up (I think I was on 9) and by the time it came back down it was full. This went on over and over and over. I had a 90Lb equipment case with me so I couldn't exactly use the stairs. If you plan on staying here, plan on using the stairs! I went to concierge to get me a car to airport, when she called the car company they got into a verbal argument over the phone. After 5 minutes of bickering back and forth she finally got them to agree to send a car that would be there in "10 minutes". Well if anyone knows anything about NYC, NO car will arrive in 10 minutes. 25 minutes later the car arrives, the driver comes in and starts going at it with the concierge in spanish. With the the elevator that morning and now this BS I couldn't believe it. Turns out as the driver told me on the way to LGA is that the hotel takes awhile to cut them a check for the fee, so they want the customers to pay directly. I guess it was an ongoing issue that decided all to come out when I needed to get to the airport quickly.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST HOTEL IN NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Rosa Virginia G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd time in NYC and I have to say is the best hotel ever!, I recomend this hotel 100% the location is just perfect, you are in the center of the world, the rooms, are beautiful, and the breakfast its even better!

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic”
Reviews.Author: trisdmac
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a hotel like the Kardashians, then you will not like it here. But I loved the feel of this hotel. It was a little quirky! The rooms were pretty nice and the continental breakfast was good. If you want to see the sights and shop in New York, then this is the place to stay. It is right in between Times Square and 5th Avenue, and if you walk a little farther you are right at Grand Central Station. I saw almost everything I planned to see, just by walking outside the hotel (besides the MetMuseum and Ellis Island). Great value! Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Two stays and very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Silmz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in 2011, and we just returned from a 6-night stay. Both times the rooms were clean and spacious (for NY) with two queen size beds and walk-in closets. Both faced the back (the Diamond District on 47th Street) and were on the 4th and 6th floors, rooms 421 & 621, respectively. The area is quiet at night, so street noise was not a problem. We had smoking rooms and even though I dont smoke (my husband does) I did not find the rooms smelled bad like I have experienced in other hotels that allow smoking. As many have already said, the location of this hotel is great. You can walk every where, but public transportation is easily reacheable. Grand Central Station is also very close. Most Broadway theaters are within walking distance. Fifth Avenue with all major stores is at the end of the block. The free continental breakfast is adequate and plentiful and served from 6:30 to 10 am. There is complimentary coffee/capuccino/hot chocolate machine in the lobby. A soda machine is in the lower level at a cost of $1 per can. There is also a bottled water machine at $1.50, but it was out of order during our last stay. There is a huge range of restaurants and sandwich/deli shops all around - there are probably over 10 just on the same block. There is a deli called Jia a few steps from the hotel that's open 24 hours. A McDonalds is around the corner. Anyone expecting or used to staying in luxury hotels will be disappointed, but if you are looking for great value for your money you will find it at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: humboldtraveler
Reviews.Content: this was a great find. even breakfeast. The rooms were clean and by new york standards roomie. The location was the best could walk to times square or fifth ave shopping. Lots of restraunts around. The staff was the best, really helpfull. If I ever go back to New York I will be staying there. My conference was at the Marriot, an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL CHAIN IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: Tamyris R
Reviews.Content: During my stay a pipe has broken late night and all the room and my personal things turned wet. Nobody came to help me dragging my luggage off the room and I did it all by myself, wearing pajamas.Two cell phones that were recharging batteries suffered many damages and the hotel insurance never covered it. They didnt even give me an answer about this situation. I really dont recommend, unless you dont care about losing your personal stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Mchelle S
Reviews.Content: Flown flight attendant gor AA for 25 years have always stayed at Milford. This hotel way outdid Milford!!! Newly updated clean bright Location quiet yet couple blocks from times square!!! Price is crazy good!!! $160 night had two queen beds two desks tv closet full bathroom. Comfy beds and pillows Way bigger than usual for NYC Complimentary hot cocoa /coffee anytime in updated lobby. Full breakfast included!!! Hotel staff friendly efficient Stayed week before Christmas. My 17 yr olds daughter Christmas gift. Took her girlfriend and mom!!! Great trip Definitely be our NYC hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite At Time Square, But Close Enough”
Reviews.Author: bsnmsn
Reviews.Content: This is not the top of he line of NYC hotels, but if you want a little comfort and a great location, this will hit the spot. The rooms are small, but recently upgraded. Breakfast is free - not a huge choice, but enough to get you going. Wi-fi in the rooms helps alot.

Reviews.Title: “Most of this hotel is good, but... they put me in a room with mold”
Reviews.Author: lavperry
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and polite. They filled all of my requests. What I liked the least was the mold in the first room I was put it. The mold was so bad I found it a bit alarming that the front desk would eve put someone in that room. The second room I was put in smelled of very strong bleach. The third room I was in was next to a construction site in the back of the hotel and it also had a scent. I have stayed at the Hotel at Times square before but I might have to think twice before I stay at this hotel again. I can't believe that the first room I was put in on the 12th floor was still open to the public with the mold and the wall paper being thumb tacked to stay up. Mold is toxic and can be very dangerous and it is a law suit waiting to happen. As I moved from room to room the housekeeping staff mentioned that some of the rooms needed to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: aleeoops
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay and just as the first, it was great. Convenient, clean, quiet and good service. The little bar was great with friendly staff. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value Hotel.... we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: billybiker66
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on Friday to find our double standard room to be right opposite the bar on the first floor. Asked the guy on the front desk for a different room due to the noise from the bar and he explained that the only avaliable room at that time was in the 'Smoking' side of the hotel. Reluctantly we agreed to stay in it but found it to be clean and fresh (apart from the corridor outside). He said that tomorrow (Saturday) some guests were leaving and that he would move us to a non smoking room with a free King Size upgrade. The next day we went out early and upon our return found we had a front of hotel, first floor King Size bedded room and that our luggage had been transfered to the room too. Excellent service. Complimentary breakfast was great too. Cereal, bagels, fruit, yoghurt, cream cheese, toast, pastries and doughnuts in abundance with fresh coffee and juice. Will definetly return the next time we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: Hotel at Times Square was a little dated but clean. Breakfast was adequate. Front desk personnel was very pleasant, reasonable parking was available across the street. Everything was within walking distance/subway and bus stops close by. We definitely would stay there again. Good deal for the price compared to other rooms in area.

Reviews.Title: “Given the location this hotel was great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: marienzreview
Reviews.Content: The best thing is the location - just a block from Times Square, two blocks from the Rockefeller centre and around the corner from a subway stop. The hotel itself is nothing flash but that is reflected in the price. But the rooms were clean, and we had enough room to store our skis and luggage and still walk around the bed. There is a construction site right next door so no need to set the alarm for the morning - the jackhammers will wake you up at 7am. We didn't mind that though - it was good to get breakfast early before the queues and then head in before the crowds. The desk staff were not helpful or friendly and overall the hotel was rather shabby, but we would probably stay here again based on price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Zone”
Reviews.Author: HappyCampersNH
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights here. Very clean. Rooms were very small. Wifi was spotty on the 12th floor. Front rest was a bit hard to understand but very helpful. You can check out the leave you're stuff in secure storage to spend the rest of the day in the city. Only BIG problem is that there is a new building going up right next door. At 7:00 sharp the jack hammers start up right on the other side of the wall!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jandjtourists
Reviews.Content: We just returned from NYC on December 30. Hotel was great, clean and tidy, staff were great, we were able to check in early to avoid checking baggage and delaying the days adventure. Rooms are small but very functional, heated washroom floors were great. Continental breakfast was good variety and staff were attentive in keeping it supplied. Location was fabulous, three blocks to Rockefeller centre, Times Square and Bryant Park. I would recommend it for a couple or single any time.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit in 6 Months”
Reviews.Author: RabyFamily
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel in six months. My wife and I traveled this time with our sons for an after Christmas trip. We booked two rooms directly through the hotel and received lower than internet prices. Our sons (college age) had a king room and liked it. It does not have any view and is very dark and quiet and that is the way they liked it. My wife and I got a double room down the hall that faced the front of the building. She loved this room for the windows and natural lighting. I did too but it could be noisy with the traffic sounds early in the morning. The front desk service was very good. Helpful and courteous. We had mixed experiences with the concierge service. One staff person was very helpful while the other did not seem interested in helping us or finding alternatives to a situation. The rooms are very clean. Our bathroom was a little small but clean and functional. Breakfast is provided and we made the most of it daily. Not the most choice but bagels, donuts and beverages are all my group needed to get started. We may try another applecore hotel but you really can't beat this location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Lmc0402
Reviews.Content: Very convenient, because we're near times square & rockefeller. Staff were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Loveroadtrip
Reviews.Content: We spent a day during the holidays. The hotel rate was excellent considering the location. Few blocks from Time Square and Rockefeller Center. Steps from 5th Avenue. The room was small , clean but a little noisy. Well, but nothing is perfect. The breakfast was included, not too much variety but good to start the day. Staff was really friendly. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's it”
Reviews.Author: Ben N
Reviews.Content: The location is good and the price of the hotel is reasonable for Manhattan but you get what you pay for. The rooms are fine but small and noisy. I found the front desk staff to be rude and unhelpful and the customer service is non-existent. I had a number of issues when I stayed at the hotel (a fortnight ago) and am still waiting to be contacted by the manager, even though I was told on a daily basis during my visit that she would contact me. My colleague was awoken during the night by water pouring on to his bed and wasn't moved rooms or offered any sort of compensation. His bedroom floor was still wet when he checked out over 24 ours later.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and affordable stay a few steps away from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Up_In_The_Air_84
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this hotel with my brother during the first half of july 2011 we trusted the good reviews of trip advisor and I totally agree with the opinions of the other travellers, the hotel is small and cozy, we found a friendly environment and the concierge was really helpfull with all the bookings for the attractions and sightseeins of the city. Free breakfast is a plus, we normally have continental breakfast at home so what it is offered in the hotel suited us perfectly. Free wifi and excellent location made it the perfect stay! I would just give them a little advice about the decor, I know that the hotel has been recently refurbished but the green walls and greenish bed robe make it look a bit out of date, but a part from that I would definetly recomend this hotel for the location and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than reasonable for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CoolYule
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here quite a few times. Great staff, great hotel, always easy and effortless stay. Great bargain for Manhattan, hands down. The whole Applecore group is amazing, I've stayed at several locations. Very consistent, across the board. GREAT housekeeping. I always check their site before anything else. 99% of the time I go with an Applecore hotel, The Hotel @ Times Square out of them if their price is reasonably above the rest (they have the best location of all). Smoking rooms a great feature - they're isolated sufficiently so the non-smokers and ex-smokers don't whine that yet another hotel didn't kick us to the curb. They're very generous with upgrades, if they can - they will (you don't even have to ask for it).

Reviews.Title: “We paid them to insult us, and they thought it was a good idea.”
Reviews.Author: danietulia
Reviews.Content: The service here was awful. We were insulted by the housekeeping staff in the elevator. when I reported the incident to the manager the next day they asked why I didn't say anything sooner. I was so furious the day before when they had called me fat right to my face, that I had to spend 12 hours calming down about it, but their reaction made me even more upset. They did not accurately fix this wrong.

Reviews.Title: “WOW--- great location”
Reviews.Author: NJTravelingDuo
Reviews.Content: Read the many reviews on Tripadviser and decided to book for a 1 noght trip to the city. Price was right and were we surprised when we checked in. Room was a good size, two queen beds, very clean and fresh. Have to say it was one of the quietest rooms we have stayed in. Could not complain about 1 thing about the room . Location was great and we had a great stay in the city. They held our bags without any issue. Def will return tot his hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Suz603
Reviews.Content: Having selected the holiday season to come to the city I knew we would pay a higher price for our hotel. I was more than a little skeptical when I saw the lower rates The Hotel offered but took a chance. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. It is in a great location off the main drag, so if you are looking for something a little low key it is great. It is a few minutes’ walk to Times Square, 5th Avenue shops, the NY Public Library and Macy’s to name a few places. The hotel staff was pleasant, no complaints. Although they could not accommodate our request for early check-in, they did try, they held our bags in a secure location for us. There is a concierge in the lobby who was very nice and helpful. Having read other’s reviews I was expecting a small room. That was not the case at all. We had a spacious room with 2 Queen beds. There was a small walk-in closet, a desk area and the bathroom. Everything was in good condition and the beds were very comfy. There was a construction site next door that we could hear outside the window but it was nothing more than a minor annoyance. We did not take advantage of the breakfast. We did attempt to go down but it was extremely busy so we opted to go out and grab something. Overall there was nothing that we could complain about and I would definitely stay there again for any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: cliffy60
Reviews.Content: Location was OK, one and a half blocks from Times Square and half a block from 5th avenue shops, but still had an 'off the beaten track' feel to it. Breakfast was complimentary, but not very extensive, and quite chaotic. Next door is a building site, with lots of noise. Wi-fi was free, but very hit and miss (the router is in the downstairs lobby). Couple of PCs downstairs with free access, free coffee machines, fitness room. Smallest hotel bar I've ever seen, open 5.30 to 1am. Go for draft as bottles are pricey. Staff are efficient and friendly. Rooms smallish, but clean and really comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location !!!”
Reviews.Author: AdolfoB
Reviews.Content: This hotel has definitely a great location ! It is in a walking distance to the major sights of NYC. Rooms are small, but you have a clean and somehow comfortable stuff in it. There is a iron board, bathtub, radio with Ipod connection. In the first floor there is a bar, but nothing special. Breakfast is included but tends to be very crowded and you should be fast and lucky to get a seat. Both check in and check out were fast and easy. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good location in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeMoss1
Reviews.Content: Between Fifth and Sixth Avenue, and within easy walking distance of all the mid-town attractions, this place had the perfect location for the four of us. We shared a twin Queen smoking room, which we found spacious, quiet, comfortable, clean and well furnished. There were two walk-in wardrobes, a great bathroom, tea and coffee facilities and very effective air conditioning which meant the three non-smokers weren't at all bothered by the one smoker. The free breakfast was plentiful and varied, with cereals, pastries, boiled eggs, toast, various bread rolls, yoghurt, fresh fruit and endless tea, coffee and fruit juice. There's a friendly and reasonably priced bar on the second floor, a comfortable lounge with two PCs, and a drinks machine which dispenses hot tea, coffee and chocolate for free at any hour of the day or night. We found the service to be friendly, prompt and professional. All told, we'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an excellent hotel with very reasonable prices in a great location. Would be our first choice next time as we really couldn't fault a single thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: likestogo62
Reviews.Content: Location was great for all the walking one does in NYC. Breakfast included, good way to hit the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out really well”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy3434
Reviews.Content: Great location for the Thanksgiving parade - not far from Times Square. Close to the subway and Rockefeller Center. Room was good size, had two double beds for my adult daughter and I. Bathroom was nice too, had a heated floor. Price was definitely not bad for New York. Staff was good - no complaints. Breakfast was ok. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok, but some factors completely ruined it for us.”
Reviews.Author: Tiana B
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself was nice, for starters the location was amazing. But unfortunately there was certain things that the hotel did that completely ruined our holiday. The way we had booked the hotel was so that when we arrive, we would be paying off the full balance then. I tried to pay with my card but for some reason the card was not going through, so I said no worries tomorrow I will be withdrawing the money cash and giving it to you. I paid the majority of the reservation by cash and the remainder with card. The new person at the desk must have not told the person that was there the night before that we had already paid the full balance of the reservation and so this particular person decided to help themselves to using my card. I was completely oblivious to this, it only came to my attention when I went shopping and came to buy something and found that I did not have enough money. It was extremely embaressing. I went back to our room and had a look at my online banking and saw that the hotel had decided to put through 4 TRANSACTIONS WITHIN THE SPACE OF 4 MINUTES. The total amount was for $400 (which was the remaining amount of the hotel bill we decided to pay by card) I went downstairs and gave them a piece of my mind. To start with, the money which they had taken from us, we had already paid the day before. By the morning after the first night, we had paid off the whole bill in total how DARE they use my card and help themselves to money and what makes it worse is that it was FOUR TRANSACTIONS meaning they tried it the first time and saw it went through so continued to try and take some more out. on top of that. They had taken an extra $145 for absolutely no reason what so ever. Secondly, they had used my card WITHOUT CONSENT. These transactions had taken place 11:48pm I'm sure there is elements of legal issues that come into place, and as a hotel this is appalling behaviour. After a bit of a shouting match, they returned my money back to me in cash, but this completely ruined our holiday. To top things off we had a little friend visit us in our room which had nibbled a hole in my four year old daughter's coat to try and get to the hershey's kisses that was in there. They changed our room and upgraded us for free. It was a real shame because I couldn't enjoy it properly. It was our first time to the states and to be honest I could not wait to get back. One word of advise, MAKE SURE THEY DO NOT KEEP YOUR CARD DETAILS. Apart from that, the staff were quite nice apart from one lady who is the duty manager there. Her attitude absolutely stank. I think her name was Ella. The breakfast was really nice as well and the breakfast staff was an absolute gem, it really is a shame about the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first-time experience in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Pushkatrina
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Excellent location. Very comfortable, clean and convenient. We loved our stay in New York City ... the first time for my friend and I. When we come next time to NYC, we will definitely stay there again. The hotel was perfect for us. From its central location, we walked as far north as Central Park and to the Met and Guggenheim and as far south as the Empire State Building. It was easy to get to the theatre district for evening shows. Rockefeller Plaza and Fifth Avenue were close by. Excellent Wifi in the room. Didn't have time to care about the view, though our room was in front and looked out on a park. Very nice doorman helped us to get a ride to JFK Airport on a busy Friday night. Nice little bar on 2nd floor. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “New York experience”
Reviews.Author: Sandyidris
Reviews.Content: This was good value for a New York hotel. Still very expensive compared with London and more expensive than luxury hotel in Washington. Luxury could not describe this hotel but it was clean, large twin beds were very comfortable and had all amenities. Very good location near Times Square but in a quieter street. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good breakfast included and can help selves to hot drinks anytime. Our room had no daylight but was not too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Fafolguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a family trip with my mom, sister, and nephew. We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was great. Very spacious for the 4 of us and comfortable for the small amount of time we were there. No great view, it's not the biggest room I've ever stayed in, but its clean and the staff were helpful Continental breakfast was nothing special, but about the same quality as other free breakfasts. The best thing about this place was the location! Near Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Fifth Ave, and a short walk to subway stations made it convenient for almost everything we did on the trip. Great price for all that was included in this hotel. I will recommend it to friends and search there for future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and affordable rates”
Reviews.Author: TravelistaCA
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at The Hotel at Times Square and had a very positive experience. The room was a decent size, the staff was incredibly helpful, the free breakfast was a great way to start the day and location, location, location. I liked that it was near Times Square without being in Times Square. The only down side was something that was out of the control of the hotel. Construction! First I had a room at the back (supposedly quieter) but right out my window was a construction site. I got moved to the front (street noise doesn't really bother me) and there was more construction going on in the front. Once the construction is finished this will be a gem of a place to stay. With construction it is still has a great location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn D
Reviews.Content: Our room with two double beds was spacious and very comfortable. Although the breakfast room was crowded, the food was plentiful and nutritious. Between 5th and 6th Avenue, it was within easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, MOMA, and Times Square---our destinations on this trip. The staff were extremely helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: coconutgirlNewYork
Reviews.Content: We make an annual trip to NYC each year and stay at this hotel each year. It used to be the Super 8 hotel. Since Apple Core group bought the hotel they have done an amazing job remodeling the entire hotel. The staff is friendly, they remember us from year to year! The rooms are beautiful and clean. No bed bugs here. I highly recommend this hotel to families or anyone traveling to NYC. Its one of the more affordable hotels in mid town Manhattan. The complimentary breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “It works.”
Reviews.Author: 26Years-StillGoing
Reviews.Content: I wanted an inexpensive hotel for a business trip, but I wanted to be in the center of things, clean and quiet. The Hotel at Times Square worked well for all of those things. On the negative, the room was small and a bit dingy, and the mattresses were cheap feeling. The TV didn't turn on, but in fairness, I didn't ask them to fix it. I'm sure they would have. BUT, clean quiet, safe and central, with a decent price. Exactly what I asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. One way elevator. Average breakfast. Its like u dont have wondow in room. So dark.”
Reviews.Author: ArmenGrigoryan
Reviews.Content: Expensive neighbourhood. Loud reconstruction works outside start early. Clean. Small.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean, value”
Reviews.Author: roachcoachtravel
Reviews.Content: Value is not a good word to describe it because it usually associates with low quality, but not here. This hotel has very small rooms, but the attention to detail in the cleanliness was appreciated. Hotel bar is okay. Discounted parking was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything.”
Reviews.Author: Taisteal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Times Square is a bit closer to 5th Avenue and a great location for visiting New York. It is a very nice three star hotel, newly renovated and very clean. The rooms are comfortable, with good beds and nice quality furnishings. The windows open and there are cordless phones. The hotel does not charge for local calls and long distance is charged at a reasonable rate. Other hotels take note. One of the big advantages of the hotel is they supply a continental breakfast, which is very good. Nothing too fancy, but good coffee, a selection of cereals and fruit, doughnuts, bagels and toast. Ideal for starting the day. There is also a small bar on the second floor, that charges 3 dollars for a beer and 5 dollars for a glass of wine. The area around the hotel is known as Little Brazil and there are a good selection of Brazilian restaurants. If you are shopping for electronics in New York, Best Buy is at 44th and 5th Avenue and the service is good. Much better than trying to find what you want in the Apple Store at 59th and 5th, which was heaving when I was there. They also have wi fi for guests and two computers in the lobby for you to use. While I was there, it was mid term and there seemed to be a school group - well behaved children. Judging from accents there was also quite a few French and British guests. All in all, a good stay and a good value hotel I will recommend to everyone. It is part of the Apple Core group of five hotels in Mid Town Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ngblackpearl
Reviews.Content: Nice room,good atmosphere,free wi-fi,free internet at the reception ,free breakfst,free phone nation wide.You can also have a discount on several parking around the Hotel if you stamp the ticket at the reception. The location is great, Little Brasil of New York City walking distance to 5th avenue,Time Square.Subway just close by. The service is good and the staff very helpful.There is a small bar but friendly at the 2nd floor.Very affordable drink with happy hours.If you want to go for nice breakfast go to Le Pain Quotidien on West 40th street opposit Bryant Park ,fantastic place and concept .

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted from our hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane K
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as it was a reasonable price and was very well located by Times Square (but just far enough away you don't get too much noise), and near to the other central attractions. We had a twin room (me and my mum sharing) and really only used the room for sleeping. We had plenty of space, the room was clean and comfortable - lovely soft beds. No view to speak of as we were at the back so little natural light but to be honest, I really didn't care about that as we weren't spending loads of time in the room. The breakfast was basic, but just to get any breakfast in a New York hotel in this price range is a bonus. The bagels and cream cheese were yummy, and there's a variety of eating establishments just around the corner if you fancy something cooked. We managed to break our safe one evening, it got locked whilst open. We reported it on our way out for dinner and it was fixed when we got back. All staff were friendly and helpful whenever we needed to speak with them. All in all I would recommend this hotel, and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: skeen990
Reviews.Content: We couldn't find any hotels in the Times Square area for less than $400. This hotel was $280 (before taxes) and included free local/long distance calls, wi-fi and breakfast. Room was comfortable and reasonably quiet. The wi-fi didn't work very well-they said the booster wasn't working and had a service call scheduled, and they gave me an ethernet cable to use instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position & great value”
Reviews.Author: Jeanettesav
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located on W46 only a short walk to Times Square, this hotel is spotless.The decor is fresh and modern. Room we had was quite large and well appointed although there was no outlook but good lighting. Next time I will request a room facing the street to hopefully capture some natural light. Our friends were very also happy with their rooms. Free Wifi, room safe and a good continental breakfast included in reasonable tariff. No fridge in rooms but ice available. Quality toiletries and fluffy towels were left daily. Tea and coffee making facilities in rooms. There is a small and cosy bar on the second floor. Would definitely stay here again. The lobby has a spacious lounge area and a very helpful tour desk.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Architype84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not even near Times Square, so not sure where the name came from. But it is very conveniant to 5th and Madison Avenues and worked perfectly for the business meeting I had in that area. Nice rooms, nice ammenities, and reasonable price for mid-town Manhatten. Very helpful and friendly staff. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, but if you are looking for walking proximity to the theatre district this may not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice deal”
Reviews.Author: MarcioT
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and my daughter for her first visit to New York. We found this hotel very reasonable for the money we were expending. Good location, free continental breakfast, clean and charming. I would recommend if you are looking for a honest small hotel in NY and do not want to put your hand too hard in your wallet!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: no1oufan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took another couple to New York City recently. The other couple was visiting us from Brazil and this was their first visit to the United States. Imagine our surprise when we discovered the street on which the hotel is located (46th) is nicknamed Little Brazil. The street had several Brazilian restaurants on it and many Brazilians stay in the hotel. Needless to say, we felt right at home. First off, the name is a misnomer. The hotel isn't at Times Square, which is two blocks away. They don't normally allow you to let check in before 3 p.m., but they already had several rooms cleaned and allowed us to check in at 1:30. Our room was on the top floor, which meant a long, slow elevator ride up. There are two elevators, but only one that goes all the way up. The room was very nice and really clean. It was a little small, but very comfortable. It had a huge walk-in closet with a programmable safe for our valuables. There was also an extra pillow. The TV was a flat screen that telescoped out from the wall. The bed was extremely comfortable. The climate controls on the air conditioner kept our room the perfect temperature. The bathroom was a little cramped, but clean and adequate. Only one person at a time can really use it to get ready, so plan accordingly if you're on a schedule. One really nice feature is that the maid service doesn't come banging on the door at 9 a.m. like most places. We never saw them on our floor, but our room was always cleaned and the towels replaced. They left more than enough towels each day, so that was never a concern. There were two cordless phones in the room, with clear instructions on which numbers to dial for specific services. Now, when we wanted to go out, we had to wait for the elevator to come up to the 14th floor from the lobby, which was very time-consuming, especially if you're in a hurry. You could take the stairs if you don't mind descending 14 flights of stairs. One nice little unexpected bonus was the second-floor bar. Dubbed "the biggest little bar in NYC" by the management, it stays open late and offers just about any libation you could desire. The sign out front promised $3 drafts, $3 shots and $5 cocktails. We went two different nights. The first night they were out of draft beer. The shots were the smallest I've ever seen, but what do you expect for $3? The bartender was a friendly young American girl who kept our glasses filled. The place is tiny, with only enough room for six two-seat tables and three chairs at the bar, but has all of the high-dollar liquors. The second night couldn't have been more different than the first. A different bartender, who sounded like she might have come from Eastern Europe, never did get the prices right. She tried to charge me $6 for a shot and had no idea what the actual prices were when I questioned the prices. She was playing this Euro techno-pop music very loudly, so much so that it made it difficult for my wife and I to talk. She also had her boyfriend sitting at the bar, and between drinking shots with him she went downstairs and out front with him to smoke, leaving the bar completely unattended and several people's glasses empty for an extended period of time. The next day, even though we'd checked out, the hotel alowed us to leave our bags there while we explored New York City some more. They locked the bags in a secure room until we returned to pick them up up. It was extremely cordial of them to do that even though they were under no obligation to do so. I recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: rklinke808
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel at Times Square for four nights in early October and were very happy. We stayed on the 10th floor and our room was very clean - we immediately checked for any bugs or evidence of "yuck" and found none. The continental breakfast was decent and the staff was very helpful. Great location only two blocks off of Times Square so it was convenient for hopping on the subway or for seeing shows. Our only complaint was the extremely slow bath tub drain - we had to wait for the tub to drain before the next person could shower. But for the money and location, this place was great! Would rebook in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but very clean”
Reviews.Author: Kathie G
Reviews.Content: This older hotel has very small rooms, but they are very clean. Continental breakfast is pretty good. Cons: early noise from construction next door! Didn't bother us much, as we were up and gone pretty early. Our toilet backed up on the last day (stayed 11 nights), but they fixed it pretty fast. Front desk staff was very accommodating. Prices were reasonable, considering NYC prices are pretty expensive in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Durhamite
Reviews.Content: First time to NY, brought the family. Checked Trip Advisor often to find an affordable hotel in a good location that would accommodate all of us. An easy cab ride from LaGuardia, took about 20 minutes, and checked right in. Received a room on the 4th floor with a view of 46th St. Had I thought about it, I might have requested something towards the back of the hotel as the front seems a little noisy with the construction going on nearby. But we just kept the A/C on all night which covered some of the noise. Overall, a clean, comfortable room with two double beds and enough room for all of our luggage and souvenirs from the week. The bathroom was big enough and the shower was nice with a great showerhead and plenty of hot water. Flat screen tv and an iHome were just an added bonus. The free continental breakfast was a welcome addition, as eating out in NY adds up fast. Nothing spectacular about the choices, but enough variety so you should be able to find something worthwhile. Only a block away from Times Square made this an ideal location for us. Close enough to walk to Broadway, Rockefeller Center, MoMA, NY Public Library, Grand Central Station. If we make it back to NY we will definitely keep this on the short list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprising find!”
Reviews.Author: dmfavia
Reviews.Content: Found the price and location of the hotel most appealing when we decided to take a last minute trip into NYC. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. I booked a room with 2 queen beds. When we went into our room it had 2 double beds. I called the front desk explained the situation and they were so polite and quick in getting it corrected. I was prepared for the usual "sorry, we are out of rooms" excuse... nothing even close to that. Took advantage of the morning breakfast. The breakfast room is modern and the food well stocked and staffed. It's all about location and this hotel has it. Just a block away from Times Square. A 5 minute walk and you're in the busiest tourist attraction in the world! Parking is right across the street and the hotel has worked out a reduced rate ($30/day) with the parking company (normally $51/day).

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Sufficient....”
Reviews.Author: Blacki3
Reviews.Content: Decided on this hotel because of the price and location. Checked-in on 10th Sept before 2pm even though the official check-in time is after 3. Was told by the front office that my requested room was unavailable until tomorrow (Ask for room facing 46th street). No choice, stayed 1 night in a very small crampy room but was shifted to another one (Rm 502, facing 46th street) the next day and no complain for the next 5 nights. New room got ample space (toilet is bigger too) and clean. Internet connection though was unstable. Maybe the hotel can consider to put in mini fridge instead of ice cube dispenser machine on the ground floor. Yes, the elevator needs to improve on the speed. Breakfast is basic but enough for you to start the day (Starting to miss the bagel and cuppacino). You can try the bar on the second floor for really cold beers on those warm days. Hotel is within walking distance to Times Square, Rockerfella, Broadway etc. At least, the walking journey back to hotel with all the shopping bags isn't that unbearable. For those who wants a late night supper, try the pushcart's Chicken Briyani ('People's Choice' @ junction of 46th street and 6 Ave) for just US$6 per servicing, but watchout for the level of spicyness. Price wise, think it's a norm for hotels in NYC especially those close to Times Square (I could have get a 5-star hotel back at home for that premium). May try another hotel (under same management) for my next visit to see the diff. For those who are 1st time in NYC, you can try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: eyy
Reviews.Content: Reception area is not that big with couple of couches and pc with free internet for guest use. Front desk are helpful and allow us to check-in even before 3 pm. The room is average in size but clean. Hotel is not exactly located at Time Square. It is a couple bocks away but within walking distance. Broadway theathers is about 15 minutes walk and so was the main bus station. It's quite safe walking even at late night. Hotel Price is average and affordable which includes continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy because of construction site in the adjacent house (until summer 2012)”
Reviews.Author: netgift
Reviews.Content: In general the room (#1004) was quite large for what you expect in New York City. The bathroom was nice, with a window. In the room itself it was a bit dark because there were only 2 small (dirty) windows with a lot of curtains which blocked the light. It was not allowed to open the windows but you could open them. At night we used the air con which was quite noisy. We had the room directly beneath the next house which was under total construction. There was noise of heavy machinery all day starting in the early morning. In the evening demolition cars parked in the street and destroyed stuff which came out of the construction site. This noise was awful and definitely more than I expected even for a city like NYC. We couldn't change the room because the hotel was full and the only other room option faced the small courtyard with no light at all (that was what the lady at the reception told us). So we stayed at this room and suffered. Because of the incredible noise it was not worth the money (>300 USD). The breakfast room ist small and without windows. We often had to wait for a normal table with chairs because my mother could not sit on a bar stool. The breakfast itself is okay, they have fruits, yogurt, bagels, toast, hard boiled eggs (already peeled!!), etc. If there is normal city noise then you can expect a decent hotel in Midtown very close to the subway and to many attractions in this area. You can easily walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and 5th Ave. The construction site is to be scheduled until summer 2012. Please book directly on the website it has better prices than travel websites because they often don't include the taxes.

Reviews.Title: “...If only the rest of the city was awake!”
Reviews.Author: cordium23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of August, right around the time Hurricane Irene decided to pay a visit to NY. That was the real bummer of the trip, but no fault of anyone, nature is nature. We had spent a few days on the Jersey shore before heading up to NY. Since there were evacuations happening in that area, we left NJ pretty early in the morning. We got to the hotel about 7 am, WAY too early for check in. They were nice enough to put our luggage in a storage room so we didn't have to carry it around while we explored the city for a few hours. Even though check in was at 3, they told us to come back at noon. And to my pleasant surprise, they actually had a room ready for us at noon. It was great, as we were quite tired by this time. Our room was in the back section of the hotel on the 9th floor. The elevator was on the slow side, and it was very rare you wouldn't have a stop along the way (sometimes for no reason at all).The room was comfortable, clean and stylish. It was enough space for the two of us. It was right next to a construction site unfortunately, with some VERY loud angry workers, but we preferred to spend our days out of the room. I loved the proximity of the hotel to some of the sites we wanted to see. We were able to walk to Times Square, Rockefeller plaza, Grand Central Station, and plenty of other places. It was also close to the theater where we planned on seeing a Broadway play (which was unfortunately canceled due to the Hurricane precautions). I also enjoyed that the hotel had a complimentary breakfast room. It wasn't anything gourmet or super luxurious, but it was really nice to have a simple breakfast at the start of any busy day. The room can get a bit crowded, but it wasn't ever a big deal. If there weren't any seats, we just took breakfast up to our room. Another great perk was the Upstairs Bar, located on the second floor kinda tucked away. The night the storm moved in, there were a lot of people hanging out in there since there wasn't really anywhere else to go. Plus the ladies working the bar each night were very friendly and were able to give us a few tips about the city. We had no problems with the staff at the front desk. They were never rude to us. Actually they were pretty accommodating. Which was admirable, as the staff that arrived Saturday had to stay until Monday working. The whole storm thing was pretty crazy since nobody knew what to expect. With the whole worries of the hurricane, they let us opt to "reserve" an extra night in case we had to stay due to travel issues. Luckily we didn't have to, so we weren't charged. The hotel also offers a reduced rate parking in the garage across the street. I wouldn't recommend bringing a car if you don't have to... it's not difficult to get a cab at all and the hotel is close to so much. Our trip was pretty derailed by the storm, so we felt a little robbed of our NY experience. I would want to go back and see the rest of our "to do" list, plus some of the things that had been recommended to us, and when that happens, I would definitely stay at the Hotel @ Times Square again. I would recommend this hotel to others as well. It was a very comfortable stay (which says a lot since we had to stay indoors more than we'd planned). The rooms were great and the value was unbeatable! Glad we found such a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: twkozik
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in NYC and stayed at this hotel. It's on a cross street off of 7th St. and all the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Lobby is nice, spacious, friendly desk staff. The rooms are small, but not tiny, bed was decent. The room was clean but the comforter was old and it kind of creeped me out. The bathroom was clean, small, but cleanliness is more important than the size so I'm not complaining! The hotel was quiet, thankfully. We were a little concerned about noise due to proximity to Times Square, but it was totally fine. Breakfast was a ZOO. That's when you realize how many people are in the hotel and they are all trying to get the most out of their free breakfast. I've never seen anything like it, it was almost like a cafeteria set up, and just hoards of people, all jockeying to get their bagels and cereal. I mean, I get it, it's NY and everything is expensive so you should take advantage of a free meal, but I would have rather gone out to a diner or deli and gotten a nice breakfast where I wasn't being elbowed and had to stand up and eat because all the chairs were taken. So that's my bad, and my advice to you if you stay here -- don't bother with the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Totally positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Warmglo
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 6 nights at this hotel and were overall very pleased. Clean room, friendly staff, free breakfast and free WiFi, and the location was perfect. A special thanks to the staff member who saw the long line-up at the elevator and took us up the service elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: TessaJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were planning a long weekend in NYC, and while looking for a hotel to book, I settled on my short list of expectations: economical price, great location, and good service. The last time we stayed in NYC we had a hotel room with an excellent view, and though we certainly appreciated it, we spent very little time actually _in_ our room. This time around, a view was less important than being closer to the sights, and also, I wanted to spend a little less. The Hotel at Times Square seemed to meet my list of expectations. We just returned home from our long weekend, and I am happy to say that this hotel left us both fully satisfied. It's not a very large hotel, so there is not much in the way of a view. In fact, we were on the 2nd floor, overlooking the entrance. That's really the only downside of the experience, although, as I previously stated, I wasn't terribly interested in a view anyway. The inside of the hotel is very clean and modern, in greens and reds. The room was adequately spacious by NY standards. In fact, some of our friends staying in a shall-not-be-named more expensive hotel just a few blocks away visited our room and were amazed at how much more space we had as compared to theirs. The room and bathroom were very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel offers a continental breakfast, which I really don't care for, but there is a McDonald's right around the corner. And speaking of right around the corner...Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park, the subway...all are just a short walk away. You can't beat the location! Considering the time spent in our hotel room was sleeping and showering, it was perfect! I've seen comments about the hotel staff being rude, but we had nothing but positive experiences with the staff. They checked us in early, and they were very helpful in suggesting the best way to get us back to the airport for our departure...we saved money, in fact, thanks to their helpful suggestions. There are taxis that come by the hotel frequently, but there is also a concierge that can assist with any arrangements if necessary. I will also add that the 2nd floor hosts The Upstairs Lounge, a small-ish bar and lounge, which we patronized one evening. The bartender was very friendly, and we were able to enjoy a nightcap (or two) before heading to bed. We are planning to return to NYC in 2012, and we will definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable with great location”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty average - nothing great but not bad either. The location was great though, being very close to TImes Square, shopping and theaters. We were 3 girlfriends enjoying a long weekend in NYC and it suited our needs well enough. We had a 2 room suite with a King and a queen bed, clean but old and tired looking, especially the carpets. One small bathroom - a little tight for 3 women:) Breakfast was included but nothing special either - yogurt, cold cereal, toast or bagel, coffee. All in all, it was reasonable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SucatP
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 3 nights to see some shows and this location is great.The hotel is a wonderful place. It has perks most NY hotels don't. Free wireless internet. Free phone calls-local AND long distance(US only). Good continental breakfast. Meticulously clean room. No problems. Only wish they had a min-fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location; Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: SALfamily
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is clean, modern, and well maintained. We couldn't ask for a better location in midtown; steps from Times Square, theatres, public transit, restaurants, and numerous other attractions. Included breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: wheaty01
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you I was pleasantly suprised at this hotel. The price for the room I was expecting the worst in NYC. As suggested by previous reviews I asked for a renovated room and the front desk advised me they were all renovated. The room had 2 queen..very comfortable beds a walk in closet, where we could store our luggage and even get changed if you wanted to. The bathroom was very clean and modern and included a hair dryer and very nice soaps and lotions. The hotel does have free wifi though if you really need that I would request a room on a lower floor as we had trouble connecting at times, but it worked well on a lower floor. The continental breakfast offered coffee,breads,bagels, donuts, cereal and juices. Quite enough to get you started in NYC, The location was awesome!!! A block and a half from times square, and a block from 5th Avenue. We walked to our shows and also the empire state building and Grand Central. I didnt find the staff all that friendly as other reviewers had but they did answer questions if you had them. Parking across the street $30.00 with a validation from the hotel. And yes there is construction but the air conditioner in our room seemed to drown out the sounds. There is a lot of construction going on in NYC so certainly not hotels fault. I would definately recommend this hotel for the price I and my family thought it was GREAT!!!!!!! P>S There is a litle Italian restaurant next door-VIA ITalia..it's prices are good for NYC...apx $10-15 per plate and the food is very authentic Italian....ENJOY!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good position, good quality/price rate”
Reviews.Author: luca0060
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to Times Square, near all the most important and well known places of new York. The hotel is small and a little bit old. The rooms are good for two people, but we were 4 all adults and our room was small. The bathroom was very small. Room and bathroom were clean. Breakfast was good, the food choice more than sufficient, considering that breakfast is included in the price. The overall quality/price rate is very good. The only problem was noise coming from outside works to a new building just in front of our room from early morning to evening. Fortunately, we were walking in New York all day and went back to the hotel just at late evening.This thing was not mentioned at all in the hotel website at the moment of our booking. This is not correct, for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: russer
Reviews.Content: The location was great, between 5th and 6th on 46th street. A good breakfast with a nice eating area, parking discounts arranged with local garages. I felt that the value at this hotel was excellent for the area and I would definitly return, and highly recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Big Apple...Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: elenaAthens
Reviews.Content: Propably, If it was my second visit to New York, I would give a worse rate at this hotel!!!!But I was so excited with my trip so I didnt care of it so much!!!The only good thing of this hotel is its location and the friendly staff...just right in the heart of Manhattan!!!Next to Times Square...It's a budget hotel...dont look for luxury!!!!BED BUGS!!!On breakfast the only thing you will find is donuts and boiled eggs!!!On my second time on New York I'll try anonther hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Brock59
Reviews.Content: An absolute gem of a find! This location is great - close to the subway, theatres and other major attractions. The free breakfast was plentiful and of good quality. Rooms very clean and well air conditioned but quite dark as the windows are very small. Bed lovely and comfy. Staff not as friendly as reported in other reviews but helpful when asked. Will return at some point in the future (I hope)! Statue of Liberty - make sure to book on the internet before you go as we saw many disappointed people who thought they would be able to turn up on the day and walk around the statue. Pay for the crown ticket as you get to climb all 354 steps to the top of the statue's crown. A once in a lifetime opportunity. The Rock - another absolute must. Breathtaking views across the city. Theatre shows - hit the TXS booth in Times Square - best time we found was round about six o'clock and we managed to get tickets to the shows we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our (special) needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Mexi
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to NY from the UK with 3 other adults, 2 of whom have learning difficulties. I put a question on TA asking for hotel suggestions as we wanted a centrally located hotel that was a reasonable price and could accommodate us in a suite of 2 rooms. This hotel did the trick! The location is great, the beds comfy and the staff helpful. No view but we didn't expect one for the price. Breakfast was good and the guy who ran it did a superb job, clearing and replenishing. The location of the breakfast room (below street level) was a little gloomy but perfectly functional. The bagels were delicious. This hotel provided a comfortable and relaxing haven for our slightly vulnerable family - I would stay there again in a flash.
