Oh - the only weird thing - as other reviewers have said - is the very transparent bathroom door. We took to using the bathroom with the light off to avoid embarrassment!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: PaulCang
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel during Christmas time last November. I was looking for an overnight stay in NYC at an affordable price, and I stumbled across this hotel. Before booking, I read prior reviews and you are able to book a room, cancel your reservation, then book it again at a lower price, so I would make sure to keep checking the rates. I did this twice, and ended up saving $60. The hotel has great curb appeal, and is an ideal place to stay if you do not like dealing with crowds all the time. It is within walking distance to many restaurants as well Rockefeller Center. The lobby is modern and VERY clean, and the staff is super friendly. It leads directly into the breakfast area. The room itself was a bit small, but very clean, comfortable, and quiet. The only downside to the room was that the bathroom door is somewhat see through because they use a frosted glass on the door. The hotel also has a bar, which is very small. We did not go there, but from prior reviews, it seems like a good place to grab a quick drink at a reasonable price. The only other downfall to the hotel was that it only has 1 elevator which operates very slowly, and it is tiny, so it may take a while to get to your room. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, but they had great choices. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again, unless I wanted views of Times Square - then I would stay at the Marriott Marquis.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Loch Lomond and The Trossachs National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LornaBr
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the LOCATION and the price. Turn left outside the hotel and in two minutes you are on 5th Avenue. Turn right and 5 minutes you are in Times Square. Hotel is situated between 5th Avenue and Avenue of the Americas. The room we stayed in on the 9th floor was a good size, clean. Huge bed which was really comfortable. Didnt use the free breakfast. Did make plenty of use of the ice machine in the reception area. Walked to the Empire State Building - didnt take long at all & was a nice walk on a glorious day. Found a nice bar called TSQ right on times square, it has just opened when we were there in March/April 2011, so all drinks were half price, including cocktails!! A MUST DO is go for drinks at the Penninsula Hotel Roof Top terrace (think it was called "Salon Ming" or something like that).. It opens at 4pm & has the most amazing views right up and down 5th Avenue. Its pricey but worth it, especially of its a nice day (like we had).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for double beds and lots of other things too...”
Reviews.Author: volley1208
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to a variety of big cities and I know how hard it can be finding a good room with two beds at a decent price. So, after a lot of searching online, I found this hotel and I was so happy once I arrived. So, I am speaking to you, Mr./Ms. I-have-to-find-the-best-deal-for-a-safe-and-clean-and-great priced-hotel seeker. Look no further, this is a great deal and it includes everything you have been spending you late nights researching. Trust me, that was me as this was my first time in NYC. I am a huge breakfast person, so while my friend slept in, I enjoyed breakfast both days and was happily full. Soy milk would have been my only unmet need. The front desk staff are efficient, but probably wish they were vacationing somewhere on the Italian Rivera instead of working here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: dlv769
Reviews.Content: THis hotel was very clean and was very conveniently located. The breakfast included was quite plentiful and had many choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: FerdoBoffin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for my weekend trip to New York and I really have no complaints. Hotel is just few blocks from Times Square, rooms are nice and clean, beds are big and breakfast is really good as well. Hotel even has an info desk which provides information about lots of events in NYC. And one more thing, maybe the best concerning this hotel, it has its own bar with unbelievably cheap beer and shots. So be sure not to miss this before going out exploring the New York nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller201171
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in NY and we stayed at this hotel in a group with 6 adults and 3 older children and was nothing but very impressed. The service at the front desk was friendly and the luggage storage prior to check in was simple, secure and very convenient. Parking just across the street, past the hotel, if you're driving in - most reasonable rate around with voucher from hotel upon check out ($30 per 24 hours - begins at the time you drive in, not per day, so that gives you a full 24 hours based on when you arrive). Thought it was going to be difficult driving in NY, but getting to the hotel was very easy and only took about 10 minutes once we drove through the main tunnel into the city. We saved big bucks not having to fly in. The rooms were very, very clean, as was the hotel itself. Breakfast included yogurt, bagels, toast, cereal, donuts, juice, coffee, tea, and boiled eggs. Perfect way to begin each day! We had 3 rooms within our group and all were given on the same floor. Beds were very comfy and the room (we had one with 2 doubles) were a good size, even if you had 4 people). When one room had an issue with its air conditioner, service was not only prompt and with a smile, it was continued until the problem was solved. The couple was not only offered a new room, but 3 different options to choose from (higher floor with two doubles, higher floor with a king, lower floor with 2 doubles). Obviously, this won't always be the case when the hotel is booked, however the front desk did everything they could to help ensure that our stay would be comfortable. Everyone from the cleaning staff (who readily gave us extra towels), to the maintainence crew to the luggage valet, to the front desk staff were wonderful. Lobby was clean and attractive and the decor was perfect for a boutique hotel. Just far enough away (only 2 blocks) from the crazy hustle and bustle of the heart of the city, but close enough to the best shopping, stores, bus tour and subway access that NY has to offer. Dollar store just up the street, if you forget umbrellas and free WiFi in the hotel was a bonus. There is some construction going on next door, but it was great that it didn't begin until after 7 each morning - and of course, there is construction going on ALL over New York, so this is, by no means, any fault of the hotel. Just be aware that, depending on which way your room faces, you may hear some clanging in the morning. To be honest, our kids slept in until 9 am, even with the noise. The AC does help to drown it out and, in all honesty, you don't go to NY to sleep the day away. Truly one of the best deals in NY city - wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and space for the money.”
Reviews.Author: TheDomingiFamily
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. There were four of us (two adults and two teenage boys) in the two queen room. It was spacious, clean, and the location was good for us. We were in the addition of the hotel and there is one elevator in the back. There were many times the elevator didn't work. Luckily we were on the fourth floor so it wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and well priced accomodation”
Reviews.Author: boxela
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel at Times Square over Christmas period 2010. We have found the hotel to be very well located and close Times Square, subway, many restaurants and Broadway nightlife. We have landed in NYC on the night after a major blizzard and the whole City was covered in snow, nevertheless we walked everywhere and found that our hotel was really well placed. The rooms were nice and tidy. Not sure about almost see through door to the bathroom, but otherwise the hotel room had everything we needed. The hotel also provides breakfast for free which consists of bagels, apples, coffee and plenty of yoghurts. Very handy if you just want to be out of door in the morning and only have minutes to spare. Many great restaurant are nearby and the restaurant is located in so called Brazilian quarter. So many choices without having to venture out too far. We also got quite a few dinner meals from nearby diner/supermarket which was fantastic. We would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: juliebeluga
Reviews.Content: after trawling the internet looking for something that wasn't a large corporate hotel and was reasonably priced we came across this small hotel minutes from Times Square. it was perfect. our room had 2 queen size beds, aircon and a clean and well functioning bathroom. the staff were helpful, there were free computers to use in the reception area and a great breakfast included. the price was very reasonable. my sister and i were travelling with my 12 year old daughter....we all loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with The Hotel at Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: Rachelrosy
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here mid-July - three girl friends celebrating turning 40! We had room 721 with two Queen beds. It was nice to have the extra bed space rather than just two Double beds. Hotel rooms in NYC are known for being small, but the room here was plenty big for us, and we even had enough closet and drawer space for all our clothes/shoes. I was impressed with how CLEAN the rooms were - the bathroom especially. Always plenty of clean towels each day too. We liked having the bar on the second floor to grab a quick drink to take to our room while getting ready for dinner each night. The front desk was always friendly, and we only had to wait a few minutes to use the computer/printer in the lobby to print out our boarding passes. Was super convenient. We chose this hotel because it offered a continental breakfast for the same price as many other hotels that did not. Each day they had yogurt, bananas, apples, oranges, toast, bagels, cereal, oatmeal and doughnuts. Just a little something to get us started in the morning. Also, if you get a late start and miss breakfast, there is a pizza-by-the-slice store two doors down that has slices for a dollar! Location is perfect - a few blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza. Always felt safe walking on 46th street, even at night. Thumbs up on this hotel. It was perfect for our NYC girl's trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - service, accomodation and price all excellent.”
Reviews.Author: kinch1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times - in New York finding a good hotel at a decent price is not easy. This hotel is not fancy but has everything - it's clean, well serviced and very reasonably priced. In addition to excellent room prices the hotel has free continental breakfast form 6-10 a.m. It's a good full breakfast and not just croissants and coffee. There is also free WiFi throughout the hotel - a huge savings for most of us with iPads, smartphones and laptops. There are also 2 computers in the lobby with WiFi for guests to use free. I used this computer to print off my boarding passes for the return flight home. I have also been impressed by the service - the front desk and room staff are polite and friendly and very helpful. When we checked in I had a large group who arrived quite early. The front desk and management went out of their way to make checking in and paperwork quick and efficient. I will go to this hotel first to do my booking from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: RabyFamily
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two evenings on our first trip in many years to NYC. We mainly went to see several broadway shows and this hotel was a great location for the theater district. The location is wonderful for those who like to walk to most of the sites (Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Times Square). Good selection of food around the block. The free breakfast was limited but we enjoyed the selection and ate and ran. The room was a little dark and had no view but we did not stay in it much. The bathroom was very clean. I was impressed with the shower water pressure and the amount of hot water. The only negative that I would have was that there was only one elevator working (out of two) and sometimes took a while to use one. We would definitely visit this hotel again and plan on doing so in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy, cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Cheshie
Reviews.Content: Great value for money and superb location. Reception and concierge service was a bit shoddy but not rude. Rooms a bit old fashioned but, for the price, an excellent choice. Breakfast was a little limited but how many people really need a full fry up in the morning? There was cereals, bagels, pastries, fruit etc so plenty to fill you up. FOC wifi was a godsend, and available in the rooms as well. Surprisingly, wasn't too noisy either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JulieBA
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect and the rooms are confortable. They should improve the front desk and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay within a 3 month span!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaKathryn
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel in April for spring break, then came back for another stay july 3rd - 8th. It was another fantastic stay! We couldn't be more happier with this hotel. The location is superb and the rates are always great! We will never stay in another hotel while visiting NYC. This hotel is very pleasant, and I'm totally pleased to have found such a gem! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to many locations.”
Reviews.Author: princessoftravel
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be very accommodating. I asked for rooms on a high floor and we stayed on the top floor of the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 10:00 am and expected to leave our bags in a storage room, but to our surprise, our room was ready and we were able to check in. Check out went very smoothly and we did leave our bags in storage for the day at no charge. We walked to all the uptown locations we wanted to see, e.g., Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Empire State Building. There is a tiny bar on the 2nd floor which was very reasonable and the bartender was fun (she even took our picture for the wall of the bar!). Continental breakfast was your typical continental breakfast. The value for NYC was very good. The room was a little dated (and it needed a little spackling and paint on one area of the ceiling), but we were only here one night and didn't expect to spend a lot of time in the room anyway. We found the bathroom to be very clean and a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: SuggyS
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I went to this hotel in February for a school trip and it was a pretty good place. The bathroom was clean, it has a good gym and a nice breakfast buffet. We called room service to help us with our lock 3 times and each time they said they'd send someone up they didn't, but it didn't bother us too much. They however did not wash the sheets. It was pretty obvious, we slept with only thin sheets on every day, thank god for heating. But it was the perfect distance from everywhere you needed to go so it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: Von1287
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately no hotel in NYC can give you free parking so that was a bummer, but not the fault of the hotel. It was perfectly located in midtown so that we were close to all of the things we wanted to see. We walked everywhere! And it was nice to have our room close by if we needed a rest. We paid only $192 for one Wednesday night in July. It was our first over night stay in the city since we have been driving down for the past 6 hrs and we loved it! Yummy breakfast with some good options and definitely great to have the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Will never return. Corporate refuses to return my phone calls.”
Reviews.Author: fisch48
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel while in New York City with a group. The room was a nice size but we immediately found small black bugs in the bathroom. When notifying the front desk two gentlemen came up to inspect and said they were flies. When I told them they were not flies he tried to pass them off as fruit flies. These two men did nothing at all to solve the situation. The next day I reported the same problem to the desk clerk and the property manager and they said they would check it out. They too saw the bugs and said they would have housekeeping spray the bathroom. The smell of the bug spray lingered in the room all week as there are no exhaust fans in the bathroom plus the spray didn't do anything to the bugs. We continued to complain and were told they would adjust our room rate. When I went to check out I was told that the 5% rate reduction for AARP would not apply to me as I was not over 65. When I asked about the discount upon making the reservations, I was never told I had to be over 65. The woman checking me out was also there when the manager said she would reduce the rate but since the manager was off she would do nothing. I had to call the hotel on Monday despite leaving a message for the manager to call me only to find out we were to be given $30.00 off one night but a bug problem that we had to put up with all week. I explained that I took pictures of the bugs on the last night and would send the pictures to her. I also told her that not only were there bugs, when I moved the trash can there was dirt and hairs all over the floor as well. I said I didn't think the $30.00 was enough and told her about the 5% AARP rate. The manager said she would talk to her supervisor and call me back. Each time I had to call the manager but I was always the next person she was going to call. Bottom line is they gave the 5% and only $30.00. I have been trying to call the corporate office since last week and no one will call me back. I even left a message for Liz in Customer Service and she has not returned my call. I can't believe a corporation such as Apple Core would rather have the poor publicity than do what was promised to me. The manager said she also talked to housekeeping about the dirty bathroom as well. I was told that if I ever came back they would upgrade my room IF there was something available. No thanks to the upgrade ... more customer service would be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bar,Good Service, And Fabulous Time!”
Reviews.Author: Bhanderson
Reviews.Content: I travelled here for my birthday this year and it was fabulous!! The rooms were spacious especially the closets for 4 girls was superb! The hotel has a great bar and Kira was the best bartender ever! 5premium shots for 20$...can I say WTF!!! The service was nice we checked oyr bags n2 storage because we werent ready to leave...overall great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: jenslish
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a good value for midtown manhattan. It's just a few blocks from Rockefeller Center and Times Square, close to a Metro station, a few blocks from Bryant Square Park and the Theatre District. The check in was quick and easy, the hotel staff was helpful and kind. We had a room on the 11th floor, while the lift was a bit slow, the lack of street noise was a plus. Free breakfast consisted of apples, bananas, yogurt, oatmeal packets, bagels, toast, donuts and 3 kinds of cereal. Nothing special, but it was healthy and it was one less meal to buy! My only complaint was with the free wifi. It worked about 30% of the time. There are two computers in the lobby, but mostly they were occupied by teenagers playing online games. I'd like to see the hotel add a few more wireless hubs to keep users connected. However, we'll be back on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: marky415
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and will continue to do so.The feont desk was warm and friendly. Nary at front desk le nt me her own personnal phone charger. Its doesnt seem like a big deal but to me it was. And I apprwciated it very much. This hotel is worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, don't think I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sms4080
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week in June 2011. I took a group of students to NYC so we booked a total of 8 rooms. I really liked the location of the hotel, it was close to Times Square and the Theatre District. I think the rooms were decent sized and the room I stayed in was clean. The stay here was not without problems. When we checked in, three of our rooms had refrigerators in them (at our request). I asked about paying for the refrigerators and was told that we would pay at the end of the week (we checked in on Sunday evening). On Tuesday, we returned to our rooms to find we had been locked out of all three rooms with refrigerators. No one attempted to contact us, they just locked us out of the rooms. We all had to go to the lobby and wait in line for a front desk employee, who was not pleasant (it was a male employee, not sure of his name). As a result of having to wait to clear this up, part of the group was late to a Mets baseball game and the others were late to a Broadway show. This was frustrating since not only did I inquire about the refrigerator payment at check in, the other advisor asked about them on Monday since hers was not working properly. I did file a complaint with the manager and she responded very quickly and offered us an upgrade during our next stay. We continued to have issues throughout the week with members of our group being locked out of their rooms because of the key cards not working. In addition, one member of the group on the 8th floor had an issue with bugs in the bathtub. The night staff was once again rude and not helpful. She called again in the morning and reached the manager who dealt with the problem right away. They did send a company in to spray the room for bugs, however, this left an unpleasant smell in the room for the remainder of her stay. Most of the problems were with the adult chaperone rooms, so at least our students had an enjoyable stay. My only other complaint is that there is a lot of construction in the area and a movie crew down the street which caused a lot of noise at night while trying to sleep (we were on the 2nd floor).

Reviews.Title: “WILL STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: RMS4366
Reviews.Content: The Hotel@ Times Square was very convenient to every thing i planned to do and see while in New York. The help were friendly and helpful. The rooms were kept clean. I will be staying here on future visits to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “This is my fourth stay, love it, love the location.”
Reviews.Author: MHoffman51
Reviews.Content: This week will be our fourth trip coming into NYC on a group bus trip (46 this time). We have always stayed at the Hotel at Times Square. The remodel last time in 2009 was wonderful. We love the location. The rooms are a little small but most rooms in the city are small. The breakfast room could be a little bigger but we managed. Hoping for another nice experience this week.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel in this price category”
Reviews.Author: saxnsuch
Reviews.Content: Don't believe all those crap you hear about bed bugs and small rooms and such. This was my 3rd trip to NYC and this was the best hotel I have stayed in this price category. The rooms are clean. After all that shopping and endless walking, all you want is a well made up room. The room attendant is friendly. The reception desk staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: ShilotBot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of 5 "Apple Core" Hotels, all managed by the same group. We have also stayed at another of the hotels, the Ramada Inn East Side, and were very pleased with the value and cleanliness of both. If you are looking to be right in the thick of Broadway and Times Square, and a short walk to Rockefeller Plaza, this is a great reasonable option. Tastefully decorated and updated, it is an older hotel that does not offer a lot of perks, but for the money and location it cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: deb10pink
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with friendly staff and close to everything. We spent three days in NYC with teenagers, and this hotel was an excellent choice. Clean, accommodating with a huge walk-in closet -- perfect "dressing room" for our situation. Free continental breakfast. I would definitely book this hotel again for our next visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location however the drawbacks were many more. The room was noisy, we got charged when we checked in and it took them a week to release the money that they charged twice on our credit card!! And on top of one day before our last night at the hotel, we woke up full of spots to find out later on by consulting a pharmacist that this was caused by bed bugs!!! This is very serious!!!! Be aware......!!!! You don't want to go on a holiday and end up with dermatological problems!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: britlitteacher
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at this hotel. We were staying with a group of 40 students and adults. Hotel staff was overall friendly though we were relatively undemanding with one exception. I had requested--and had proof--no smoking rooms only. It took two nights before they were able to move our two smoking rooms to non-smoking rooms. The hotel, in fairness, seemed jam-packed and they told me they had nothing available. Very frustrating, however, since I had booked months before. Nice lobby area, mediocre breakfast, clean rooms and fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: 4newfie
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel ! My wife and I visited New York from May 28/11 to June 2nd/11 .We found the price excellent and the service even better . Free breakfast a plus and a great start to the day . Love Joe the bellman ! Always a smile and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Gillmore79
Reviews.Content: Reception very unfriendly. had a room without a window!!!!! at first. rooms are dirty(esp. Bathroom) and smell of urin. After we read all the good comments, we could not believe our eyes and were very disapointed. Incredible that there are people who wozld recommebd this hotel to friends!!! We left earlier than planed. had to find another hotel which took us almost one whole day away from our vacations...priceless!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Go Back - Beware of Room Theft”
Reviews.Author: Tourguide2011
Reviews.Content: My co-workers and I took 42 of our high school students to New York City for a field trip and we stayed at the Hotel at Time Square for 3 nights. On the first night of our stay, one of the rooms was entered from the fire escape outside through a window that had a broken lock. The following evening, we had 3 rooms in which the security was breached and money was taken from one of the rooms. The front desk informed us that there was no Manager on site and that they could not reach the manager until Monday (this was Friday!!!). It took us 3 hours to check all of the rooms and move our students to safe rooms that had proper locking windows. All of the windows have a sign that instructs you not to open it and therfore, you are unaware that the window does not lock properly. We found it very interesting that the rooms with windows that did not lock were the ones that were entered and the hotel tried to tell us that it was the girls fault for leaving the windows open even when they did not touch them. When we opened the windows to check if they locked we discovered garbage and cigarette butts on the fire escapes. A nice hangout to wait for people to leave the room? Our students (mostly teenage girls) did not feel safe in this hotel after this episode. We called the police and made a report and it was only after this that the front desk was will to accomodate our requests without difficulty. The rooms were very musty and smelly. I woke up each morning with a migraine from the air quality in this hotel. You can smell smoke in the rooms (even in the non-smoking rooms) and there were people smoking marijuna on one of the floors each night. Two of our rooms had bugs in them. Disgusting!!! Our experience was so bad at this hotel that we will never take our students there again nor would I recomment it to anyone travelling to New York. I have been to many hotels around the world and never experienced anything like this. We will spend the extra money and stay at a hotel that is safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “excellent delivered exactly what it promised.”
Reviews.Author: spour
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel because of the location and relatively low price. We certainly couldnt have been better placed for so many points of interest just minutes away from so many things yet in a relatively quiet road. The staff were friendly and efficient, the hotel in general and our room were very clean and tidy, the bar on the second floor was small but friendly and atmospheric and breakfast was adequate if a little unexciting. So long as you donot expect luxury you cannot go wrong with this hotel and we would happily recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice but would go back if I had to.”
Reviews.Author: Ellen8771
Reviews.Content: So I booked this room for myself and 2 other friend, I got a non-smoking & 2 Queen Beds. The lobby is very nice, and the staff are awesome! We checked in, in about 5 mins. Our room was 1126 on the 11th floor, which is the top floor. I was very shocked when I walked into the room, it was tiny! First thing we did was turn on the AC because it was about 32C that day. It would have been nice for the AC to already be on, but that was ok. The only way you could feel the AC was if you stood right over it, our room was VERY hot, and of course your not allowed to open the window. So we werent impressed about that. The beds were very comfy, sheets were clean. We had to ask for more towels and they came within 10 mins. Great Service. We did have an ant problem in the bathroom, which was gross, but being country girls just killed them. I still can't figure out what was outside our window, I went into the bathroom and saw people walking past our window, and the windows are tinted so you cant see out, but it was creepy. We also had this red light that would fash every few mintues. We found we couldnt close one set of curtians because they came down to far over the AC. We got a free breakfast, was pretty good. Bagels, tea/coffee, ceral, oatmeal packs, fruit, juice. Free wifi was awesome! And they have a room where you can keep your bags after you check out if you not leaving the city right away. That was A + All in all its not a bad place to stay for a night, I wouldnt stay more than one night, they need to update the AC and the rooms are way to small. I would give it a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT !”
Reviews.Author: Bridgetg52
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on May28-31st. I loved everything about it from the moment we walked in. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived at 1:00pm and were able to check in right away. The room was very clean, small but I didn't expect anything larger. The free breakfast was perfect and just enough to start the morning. The location couldn"t have been better. I like to stay close to Times Square/Theatre District and this was so nice because 6th Ave. was actually very quite. There is a very pretty little park right across the street that can be seen from the beautiful and comfortable lobby. Would reccomend this hotel and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Spot @ Times Square”
Reviews.Author: SujoyMumbai
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hotel @ Times Square in mid May for 3 nights in a 2 room suite with family. The rooms are small, but has adequate luggage space. Each room has an LCD TV. Single Bathroom. Wireless available and worked fine. Safe, Bottled water, coffee in room are available. Big plus is the Free calls in the USA, and a great breakfast served in the mornings that includes croissants, eggs, muffins, yoghurt, breads, fruits, bagels, juices. On the downside, rooms have no view, and are slightly small. Within walking distance of Times Square, Broadway, Rockerfeller, and Empire state building. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Nice Value”
Reviews.Author: Nunoc79
Reviews.Content: Well, this is a very nice hotel to stay in NYC. It's really close to times square, only a block away of the heart of new york, and there's subway station just around the corner. It's not a top hotel, but for the money you pay, you can't get anything better in midtown ... The rooms are spacious enough, especially considering you're in NYC, it's clean, and the service it's good too. I would recommend to everyone, and i'll stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, Reception staff not overly friendly”
Reviews.Author: eyeyore
Reviews.Content: Positives:- The hotel is in a fantastic convenient location to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, The subway etc. The bell boy and the maintenance guy were friendly and helpful. The Hotel has a cute little bar to enjoy a few drinks, that was a bonus. Negatives: Bedding was not so good, we had two saggy horrible pillows. The room was not the cleanest I have ever stayed in. We pulled the side table out to get to the power point and there was rubbish behind the table (yuck). The reception staff were not overly friendly (to the point of rude during some interactions). Don't look out the window as there are nets with rubbish on them. In a nutshell, Hotel is convenient and does the job. If you don't care about friendly reception staff and just want somewhere convenient to stay, then this Hotel is okay - But I would say bring your own pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: RTR2011
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at The Hotel at Times Square and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, convenient and affordable hotel. It's located in the heart of Manhattan in easy walking distance to Times Square. Rockefeller Center, and more Broadway theaters than you can possibly patronize. Recommend you check out the Irish and Scottish pubs just steps from the hotel. Great staff at both. Hotel has a bar that seats about 12, any more than that and, to paraphrase Dorothy Parker, it's adultery. Cozy and dark, really dark.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: Suz16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in April. It was fantastic. I could not speak highly enough of this hotel. Free wii fi is excellant! On arrival there is a Beautiful lobby with very helpful desk staff. we arrived early and our room was ready. I had a problem trying to work the phone to make calls and they were very prompt in assisting me. The staff at the ticket and information desk were wonderful and very helpful. Go here to get any attraction tickets as you can get some discounts. the room was big and confortable. The bathroom was clean and had lots of clean towels. The bar is small but cosy. The bar maid makes the best cosmo's i have ever had. I can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great and beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: EdRad
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent for check in, lobby clean and desk staff courteous and kmowledgable. Room was small, but big enough for the two of us - Tv, and other electronics worked fin though number of TV channels limited. Location excellent on 46th street between 5th and 6th puts in the middle of Times Square, theatre, shopping, transportation, and restaurant availability also Moma and Rockefellar center. Little bar on second floor was a good place to stop off for an night cap, travel desk was helpful in getting to airports and internet facilities worked with printer and paper supplied - liked the responsiveness of the staff

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pstacy
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is within easy walking distance of Times Square and the theaters. There is also a subway station just around the corner on 6th avenue. We stayed in a suite with one king and one queen bed. There was plenty of room for 4 "full size" adults. The only problem was that the bathroom door was much too transparent. It was slightly frosted, but not nearly enough. We also wished for a small refrigerator. Both of these were small aggravations. There was an in-room safe which we used. The breakfast was pretty standard - just continental style with no meat. If you want a cheap hot breakfast, there's a McDonalds just past the subway on 6th Avenue. The rate was very good for this size room in NYC. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel. If I ever come back to New York, I will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Avoidable place”
Reviews.Author: ZubinD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel with my wife and young child. The room was good in size compared to E.U. hotels. The breakfats was strictly OKAY but what shocked me was PLASTIC cutlery and PAPER plates ?! I mean for the price you charge for a room, you can't afford decent cutlery ? The staff was also not very friendly except for one Mr. Dutta who deserves special mention for being helpful. Nobody greets you in the morning during breakfast. Instead you see a grouchy Sardar who ONLY smiles at foreigners - NOT Indians ! Except for its excellent location, a strictly avoidable hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: budhakan
Reviews.Content: I was here flying in from an international location with a big suitcase. Regular check in is 3 pm while I landed at 7 am. They have a locker room which took my suitcase and left me without a worry. The lobby mgr promised me a room by noon and I did get it. Next morning i checked out at 10 am - but they were so nice to store my luggage until 6 pm! In New York this a big deal as you dont want to get stuck with a big bag and not be able to walk around. The room was small - about 10X10 but clean and efficient. Old East European immigrants are the backbone of the housekeeping staff and do a great job. net net a good experience

Reviews.Title: “If you only need a place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: dribs
Reviews.Content: This is no Taj Mahal but if you only need a place to sleep this is it. Excellent location, 2 blocks from times square, smallish but clean rooms, decent service, basic but fresh and filling breakfast and great value for the price. Especially appreciated the heated bathroom floors and computer center with printers. Excellent Brazilian steak house with live jazz across the street 'Brasilia'.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomend !!”
Reviews.Author: kapuchok
Reviews.Content: + Nice rooms. + Plenty of room. + Great cleaning service. + Location (Only 5min walk to Times Square or the opposite direction of 5th Avenue) + Free Internet. + Bar + Friendly staff - There was some construction activity near the hotel which made it noisy. - Could have more choice for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!”
Reviews.Author: vikinginvestor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. We made reservations in good time and had the printed confirmation with us. The guy at the desk did not only say they were fully booked but also lied about their overbooking situation. He was rude and the place was dirty, We decided to go to another hotel in thd same street. They gave us a better service and actually we saved a lot of money! I cant understand how this hotel has such good ratings! They must pay someone to do them!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BrendaKathryn
Reviews.Content: This was a very, VERY nice hotel! I was extremely pleased. The location was great, the room was beautiful and roomy for NYC, and the location was perfect! We had a very pleasant stay here. Everyone was super friendly! The room is sooo quiet. I can't believe how quiet it was and peaceful. The room was also very clean! I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone, and I'm super picky about hotels :)

Reviews.Title: “very good value,would highly recomend”
Reviews.Author: 1stimeturkey
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I found this hotel on Tripadvisor, I have nothing bad to say (...well..maybe just the slow and small elevator..but this is forgiven) In addition to all the good reveiws here-which I totaly agree with and will not repeat yet again- I will add and stress-free Internet, and in the lobby- free internet+ printer- so you can even rpint maps or details, or, like we did, do a pre check in for flights and save a couple of hours at the airport, also, free calls to anywhere within the USA- very useful for some placse we wanted to visit and had questions, and for calling friends,shows, restuarants etc. Another nice advantage was that we could store our baggage safely after check-out at no extra cost, and the lovely lady-Ella-at the desk didnt charge us extra for the room even though we only checked out at almost 2pm (check out is till 12 and you can request "late check out" at 3pm for an additional 75$) So- we recommend!! (the Israeli flag over the door outside alongside the American one was also very nice for us as Israelis :) Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great choice”
Reviews.Author: malter2010
Reviews.Content: After exactly 1 year, we went back to this hotel. Still worths every penny!! Rooms are great, free wifi, complimentary breakfast and the BEST location in NY, just blocks away from times square, but without all the trouble of being right in times square. Will be our next choice over and over!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: BriannaY
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, conveniently located to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel 1 minute walk from the heart of NY”
Reviews.Author: NigelGTaylor
Reviews.Content: Before I went on my trip to NY i read loads of reviews on the many different hotels in and around Times Square NY. I really had no idea which hotel to choose as they all had good reviews and bad reviews. I then read about the bed bug infestation in NY and i was completely freaking out about what to expect when I got there. Well I decided to go with this hotel as the photos of the hotel and rooms looked nice, the hotel even included breakfast which many of the more higher rated ones did not and this hotel seemed to be near the shops and tourist area. Well we arrived and the lady was checking in another couple before me and asked them for a reservation voucher which they or i did not have,, apparently opodo are supposed to have given this. anyway she noted that we didnt have vouchers and said she would pass it on to her manager... but we were checked in anyway and everything was ok. our room was lovely,, it had nice beds, a great bathroom an lcd tv and even free wireless, this was great after a busy days shopping and allowed us to unwind with some mtv. the hotel is honestly 2 minutes walk from times square,, 1 minute if you walk fast like me and it is 5 minutes from the big stores on 5th avenue... flip sakes we walked 5 minutes and found holister, h&m, sephora, tiffanys and some other shops my daughter wanted to spend hours in... while she did that i was able to walk around the rockerfella centre and st pats. breakfast was free and flip it was great,, cereal, toast, fruit, coffee, yogurt and donuts. anyway if i goto NY again i will definately be staying at this hotel. i know there were negative reviews about this place but the only negative thing i had to say was the lady at the start asking me for some reservation voucher which i did not have. i thought the other staff were friendly and helpfull and the cleaning staff did an amazing job,,, believe me our room was left in a tip with all the new shopping and when i only asked for fresh towels the wee lady had been in and completely tidied our room. so a big thanks to them. well thats it, i hope this has helped you decicde a bit.... oh and i never spotted any insect or bugs or the sorts and i had a frikkin good look around me too.

Reviews.Title: “More than you can ask for!”
Reviews.Author: Emroo92
Reviews.Content: I just returned from NYC and stayed 3 night here. We have absolutely no complaints about the hotel. It was centrally located to everything we wanted. The beds were comfortable, and breakfast was plentiful . The rooms were cozy and very clean. The host in the breakfast room kept the tables clean and the food stocked. I never had to wait for the free internet in the lobby, and the elevators were never a problem like some stated. Overall, I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT !!”
Reviews.Author: Donluiseduardo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (35 and 39 years) stayed at the midlle of March 2011. If you are in NY for the 1st time been in Times Square it is an excellent choice, Service, rooms and locationas are really good for USD$200.00 a day. 5th av 1/2 a block, times squae 1 1 /2 block. Delis open 24 hrs 1/2 a block rockefeller center 2 blocks away, Intrepide museum 5 block away. Bed, bath and closet excellent. Im from Guadalajara, Mexico

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: outplayin
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NYC for spring break. My 72 yr old mother hadn't been there in many years and my 18 yr old daughter had never been. We chose this hotel on a recommendation from two others who had been there before. It was a good recommendation. The hotel is in a great location. We found that in the 5 days we stayed, we only needed to use public transportation a couple of times. We could walk to many, many areas of interest...Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, The United Nations, The MoMA, Grand Central Terminal, NYC Public Library, etc. The room we chose was a 2 room suite. For just a few dollars more, we had two nice sized bedrooms each with its own tv, king or queen sized bed, and comfy chair. We shared a closet, bathroom, and desk. It was so worth the extra money. I felt that the rooms were a nice size for NYC and the entire hotel is updated and pleasant. I did like the mattress, although the one we had had a definate indentation on the side closest to the bathroom. If there is a way to turn the mattress, that would be advised. We had one problem, but it was a non-issue because they management was so quick to respond. Our toilet started overflowing, but I turned off the water and called the front desk. There was a maintanance man there in a couple of minutes. He repaired the problem, cleaned up the mess and returned will new towels all within 15-20 minutes. As I said, what could have been a huge mess turned out to be a non-issue. I read some of the previous reviews for this hotel and I must comment on one of them. The person stated that their room was unclean and mentioned all sorts of horrific things that they found in the room. As I thought about that, I realized that it is a false review. If anyone opens a door to an uncleaned room, they don't go in looking at the mess. They close the door, go back downstairs and ask for a new room. I am surprised that Trip Advisor posted that review as it is clearly made up and false. We found the hotel to be reasonably priced, a great location, a decent breakfast (and we appreciated the savings) and the staff pleasant. I would recommend and would return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Kezmat
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel i went with my boyfriend and our friends who r also a couple!! we got a 'family' room which was 2 rooms joined with a door!! the rooms were spacious the beds wer comfy they all have flat screen tv's!! the hotel includes a lovely brekkie!! big tasty bagles yummy fresh donuts toast tea juice!! its location was unbeatable 2 min walk to time square you can see it from the entrance of the hotel!! the staff r lovely and friendly and helpfull!! it has a lovely lobby and an atm and travel guide store!!! I reccomend this hotel to everyone its wonderful and sooooo cheap for its location!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's not four star, but it is fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: jinjawitch
Reviews.Content: It's hard to fault this hotel when you consider how cheap it was to stay there. We had a hassle free cheerful greeting at front desk on our arrival and booked into room 915, which was okay but a little dingy. We asked to change after spotting that room 917 was brighter and had a better aspect. The room was lovely. The breakfast is served on paper plates and plastic cups, but it didn't matter. You could fill up on bagels and hit the streets happy. However, as stated, if we'd have paid more we would not have been impressed. The location is perfect. The cleaning staff are friendly. We felt well-rested.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in an AMAZING Location”
Reviews.Author: HayleySmith_11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel the weekend before Christmas. It was our first trip to New York and we wanted to stay right in the heart of Manhattan. However, the reason why we picked this hotel was because of the low rates and the free brekkie (most NY hotels only offer room only) but when we got there we realised how lucky we were! Fifth Ave was under a minute stroll, Rockefeller Center two mins, Times Square two minutes. We were able to spend the whole weekend walking to the city's main attractions which was fantastic. The room was large with a very comfy bed, flat screen tv and free wifi! We were expecting a UK chain hotel style room but were very pleasantly surprised. The breakfast was self service buffet which was made up of cereals, breads, bagels, etc (and of course, doughnuts!). All in all, one of the best value hotels we've chosen without having to sacrifice on location or facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: BCMusignac
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got a fantastic location, awesome rooms, good service and everything for a low and convenient price. I would have paid more for my stay and i sure will return. The 2nd floor bar is simple yet really good and the service there is excellent, the russian/jewish girl working there is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for location and a real bargain”
Reviews.Author: highplainsprincess
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Times Square is an excellent value! Rooms are large and the recent renovations have improved the overall hotel (it use to be a Super 8). A good breakfast is included with the room - cereals, yogurt, fruit, bagels, toast, hard boiled eggs, donuts, juice, coffee). Everything about the hotel is immaculate! Flat screen TVs but who watches TV while in NYC? One block off Times Square and convenient to everything including the subway. We paid $149 a night with our AAA card and everything was wonderful. There were some noisy guests just one night but that isn't the hotel's fault - just rude drunks. I have stayed at this hotel for years and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: czilbo
Reviews.Content: A very nice place with everything you need in a city like NYC. A quiet place, cozy with nice bed and a good breakfast. Very comfortable indeed I really recomend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit-Excellent Location/Service”
Reviews.Author: 0u812Glasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights.Great Hotel for the price.The property is seconds away from subway/5th ave and 1 minute from Times Square.Room sizes are ok by New York standards and have flat screen TV,Free Wifi,in room safe and free calls anywhere within US.There is basic buffet breakfast provided Free which includes Toast ,cereal,fruit and yogurt which sets you up for the day.There are 2 computers in reception with printer and there is also a great little bar on the 2nd Floor.The hotel is very clean and quiet considering its great central location.The staff are very helpfull and polite with nothing too much trouble.I was stranded in manhattan for 48 hours due to the bad weather and the reception staff went above the call of duty to help me rebook my flights and room.A big thumbs up to all the hotel this was my second stay at the hotel and will definately return on my next visit to new york.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs .”
Reviews.Author: alex223
Reviews.Content: Had planned my trip weeks in advance . Its was a mess the bed in the room was not good co-dom in the bed , blo-d in the towel , s-it in the toilet as if not cleaned for days . Went to reception asked the person if this is what i paid for . She changed my room . Went to other room on the bed Bed Bugs . I just wanted to leave they said they will charge me for it . Spoke to manager . She said no refund talking as if i was lying . She was extremely rude does not know what she is doing . Be careful ..

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location, etc.”
Reviews.Author: sharon02tn
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NYC in December 2010 for 5 days and stayed at Hotel Times Square. Our experience was wonderful. Rooms a little small but such a charming hotel in a great location! We walked everywhere; theatre, Times Square, restaurants, NBC. Breakfast was very good also. Great little Italian restaurant next door; added even more charm to our experience. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Staff at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: gareth_999
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days during january 2011 and really enjoyed our trip, the hotel is located on 46th between 5th and 6th in Little Brazil and it has everything you need just on the doorstep. We had a twin queen room, non-smoking room and this was very nice size and cleaned daily by friendly house keeping staff. The staff are very friendly and make sure you vist the bar on the 2nd floor, my only negative statement is the wifi signal on 7th floor was quite weak and would mean a few connectivity issues and as this can be easily resolved by the hotel. I would recommend friends and family staying at this hotel and myself will consider it when we next take a trip to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Clean...”
Reviews.Author: 3miamigirls
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 2 teenage daughters. We loved the location, room was very clean and spacious for a room in NYC (2 queen beds). Great front desk service, speedy check out. Parking garage just accross the street. The breakfast was basic/simple continental breakfast but it was all we needed - and it was fresh (capuccino machine was surprisingly good). Staff was very knowledgable in helping us get around, even helped arrange our transportation back to the hotel. I will come back and stay at this hotel, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cubbyster
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. It was clean, quiet, comfortable and convenient to all the New York has to offer. I plan on staying there every time I am in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Feel that their customer service is terrible in light of the Blizzard 2010”
Reviews.Author: Fishes424
Reviews.Content: I would have loved to try this hotel - but due to the Blizzard, my boyfriend was not able to make it into town, and I was without power for many hours, and when I went to cancel it was a few hours after the cancellation cutoff and they wouldn't make any exceptions. I wasn't even looking for a refund, I would have accepted a voucher for another time -- but they don't do vouchers! I do not find this to be good customer service at all! It wasn't that I was canceling to stay at another hotel -- I truly wanted to be able to stay with them - but couldn't get there! I stay in NYC several times per year -- I was excited to try this new place - it looked great -- but I guess I will just go back to my regular places that have been very accomodating over the years. Disappointed with service from a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: OolieJay
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based largely on the great reviews it received here on Trip Advisor. I couldn't believe the great price I received when I booked our 2QB room for July, 2010 just a few months in advance. I was nervous and expected a "get what you pay for" experience when we arrived, but that was not the case at all. The front desk staff was pleasant and check-in went smoothly. The bellman took our luggage to our room for us, which we weren't expecting but appreciated nonetheless after having dragged the luggage a few blocks from the parking deck to the hotel. The free continental breakfast looked adequate and tasty, however we chose to eat at some of the local diners/coffee shops as my husband prefers a heavier breakfast. The hotel is in a GREAT location, just a few blocks from Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Broadway Theaters, restaurants, and subway stations that will get you anywhere you need to go. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Daytonagatorgirl
Reviews.Content: My best friend, teenage daughter and myself stayed here for a long girls weekend in the City. What a great hotel! It's clean, decorated nice, offered a great continental breakfast in the morning (cereals, bagels, toast, yogurt, fruit, coffee and juices) and was located in the heart of midtown. We were located close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. I saw a comment about noise at night. It's the City! You are going to hear honking. However, it does tend to die down around midnight and we slept well the entire time. We were even on streetside. This is a good hotel for a great price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure in the middle of NY”
Reviews.Author: Miskels
Reviews.Content: I must have researched hotels to stay at for a couple of weeks, looking at location, amenities, reviews, photos etc and this was the winner. This Hotel is a hidden treasure. We arrived 5 hrs prior to check in and our room was ready for us. Dropped off our bags and headed out to see the city. The location could not be any better, being in the middle but on a side street so not to loud. The hotel was very clean, quite and i felt plenty of room for NY, also felt very safe. Our room was just down the hall from the 2nd floor bar and it was not to noisy at all. Sure you could hear some people, but you you have to remember that you are in the middle of New York and thats to be expected. The bed was very comfortable and clean. We checked out at 9am an they held our luggage until 10pm after our show that night. We will be back and i certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Bargain for a First Class Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yolos
Reviews.Content: Located right off Times Square, this hotel had everything we could possibly have asked for, at a very reasonable rate. We enjoy boutique hotels but sometimes the prices don't fit our budget, especially for last minute get aways. The Hotel was clean with spacious rooms, nice amenities and a complimentary continental breakfast that offered everything we wanted in the morning. There were two computers with free internet access located in a very nice lobby complete with a television. There is a privately owned and very cozy bar on the second floor that was opened until 1:00am and served $3.00 drafts. Where do you find that in NYC? I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great Location, Big Rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Cweis
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at this hotel twice, once in early November 2010 and this past week in Dec 2010. I chose to come back to the hotel because of the incredible value that it offers, considering the price and location. I've stayed in several other hotels in the Times Square area - and in the past had to choose between a large room with updated furnishings and a reasonable rate. This hotel claims to offer stylish accomodations at a reasonable price - and they deliver. Both times, my room was like the picture in terms of the decor. The first room was larger than the second, but I think this is because it's an old building that has some odd corners and angles. Your room size will depend upon where exactly in the hotel you are staying. Free wifi, free breakfast. Small fitness center with two treadmills. Very comfortable - and only a few blocks from Time Square, Fifth Avenue, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center. Easy walk to Grand Central Station or a bit longer to Penn Station. I stayed here on business as this was close to my clients, but it would also be a good spot for tourists. I will go back to NYC again for business in the coming months, and intend to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card when checking in”
Reviews.Author: Kartum99
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights there and the hotel was fine - great location. However, they did not give me my credit card back after checking in. I realized I did not have it about 1/2 hour later and went down to the front desk and did get my card. (I did not receive a call from the font desk telling me that they had my credit card.) About 3 weeks later I had 3 charges on my Visa that were not mine (totalled over $1,000.00 and included a small charge first, followed by one over $600 in China, and the final one was a money wire to England). My credit card company said whoever used it knew the 3 numbers on the reverse side of my card.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: kknack
Reviews.Content: This is NYC - so one can expect smaller rooms, but this place makes up for it in location. It's on a quieter side street just a short walk from times square. There weren't many services available from the hotel, and the "bar" was tiny to say the least. But for a smaller hotel, this is to be expected. The room itself was on the smaller side for the city but at the price we paid (20% lower than the usual rate), it was one of the better values in the area. There were a few internet attached PCs in the lobby that rarely worked, and I don't recall any wifi, so this may be a pass for business travelers who don't bring their own.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not very silent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: UlisesLleida
Reviews.Content: Well, just let me explain. The hotel is quite fine. Very nice location, everything looks almost new and it provides continental breakfast. Rooms are quite clean, and free WiFi service. But don't pretend to sleep if you are normally affected by noises (inside and outside noises). We had to change twice of room, and in al of them, the outsde noise was outstanding. A/C machines are workig on high level, and the buzz is continuous all the night long. I would not repeat. Nice location is fine, but for me is more important to rest well and sleep comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Saved the day!!”
Reviews.Author: skippy46
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel at Times Square ready for a great two days with friends, only to find that I had inadvertantly come one day early! I was pretty sure all was lost due to the busyness of the Christmas holiday. I was sure we would not have a room and we had traveled from Philadelphia. but soon enough, the desk clerk found one for us we were able to check in before check-in time as well. He truly 'saved the day' for us. Hotel is immaculate and perfectly central to Bryant Park, and 42nd Street. Breakfast free in the AM....we couldn't have been more pleased. This is my 3rd time staying at this hotel and I have never been disappointed. Parking almost directly across the street in a lot. Madeline

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here everytime we visit NYC”
Reviews.Author: 5preciousjewels
Reviews.Content: My friend and I brought our young daughters to NYC to go to the American Girl Place and to see Mary Poppins. This hotel was the only one that had a room available with two queen size beds. The price was very reasonable, especially considering it included free wi-fi and a delicious continental breakfast!!! They also held our luggage after we checked out so we could continue to tour the city until that evening!! The employees were friendly and very helpful. If we ever get back to NYC I will definitely be making my reservation here!! BTW it was also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: llhayes
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced, this hotel has everything you need and is in an excellent location. The staff is so nice and helpful. We arrived at 7am and they had our room ready and let us check in. They are extremely good about storing your luggage, lots of storage space and an efficient system in place. The hotel is clean and well maintained, and they offer free breakfast in a large breakfast room. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: YYZer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days by myself in a king room and then for 4 more days with friends in the 2 bedroom suite. The hotel is probably the best deal in NYC! The king room was great. The bathroom in the suite was a bit small (smaller than the one in the king room) and the suite only has a closet in one of the rooms but it was spacious enough for all of us to share. One suggestion I have is to add a full length mirror to the second bedroom in the suite. I will definitely be returning to this hotel on my next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JohnInVirginia
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience here. The location really couldn't be much better - a couple of blocks from Times Square and a couple of blocks from Rockefeller Center. Close enough for a REALLY easy walk, but far enough to be away from the noise and crowds. We found the hotel to be extremely clean and well-kept and quiet at night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is nice (especially since it's free), and the bag-check service is really helpful for travellers. Great value too - hard to find anything close in this location and with this level of service. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Virginia007
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel at Times Square in November, 2010 with our 13 year old daughter. This was our 3rd or 4th stay - dating back to when it was the Super 8 Hotel. Relax, hotel has been remodled since then and is actually very nice. Location is good, few blocks down from Radio City and a few blocks over from madness of Times Square. Grand Central is a 5 minute walk - over a couple streets and down a few blocks. We made reservations on-line through applecorehotels.com. We were able to reserve a 2 room suite for less than what other similar hotels charged for 1 room. Upon check in we received a AAA discount of about $15 per night, so it was worth inquiring. Also, good thing is cancellation policy is hassle free up tp day before check-in. We actually cancelled first reservation and made another when we saw price on web site had dropped close to time for trip. The room and bathroom were very, very clean and seemed to have been recently redone. Furnishings were all clean and new. Breakfast was basic but good. We prefer to go grab a bagel out, but what the hotel offers- donuts, bagels, coffee, cereal - is not bad at all (and free). Little bar on 2nd floor was a new addition. It is tiny, but I did have a couple drinks there one night before heading out to a restaurant. Has to be only $3 beer in NYC! Was clean and waitress was friendly. Fine place to grab a quick drink while waiting for others in your party to get ready to go out. On day of check out, we stored bags in lobby while sight seeing until late afternoon- was a nice service by hotel. Only negatives are that (1) elevators do run slow, but we just took stais a couple times. Small inconvenience and waiting on the elevators would not have been a big deal. (2) catching a cab is a little difficult b/c 46th street is not that busy with cabs on the hotel's block and there is no cab stand in front of the hotel. Unless you are really good at hailing cabs, plan to take the subway or to get the concierge to arrange for a car service - or simply walk like we did most of the time. Read review below saying had bedbugs but we saw absolutely no trace and we were looking for them! Bed bug registry (google it) said hotel was not infested. Bottom line, this is actually a perfectly good (bordering on kinda nice) moderately priced hotel in a great location. I felt very safe and my wife and daughter were quite pleased - and they can be much more picky than me! You will be out and about all the time anyway, so why blow the budget on a four or five star place. I would give this a very solid 3.5 stars. We will be back - soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: chrisj28
Reviews.Content: My daughter was badly bitten by bed bugs. Even the doctor at NY hospital was amazed at the size of the bites. Although the hotel changed our room, we had to request to get medical attention. We had to get to the hospital ourself. It spoilt my daughter's plans. She was going around in clothes that fully covered her upper body due to embarrassment on the awful bites on her body. Management made no attempts to apologize.

Reviews.Title: “Girl's Weekend- nice hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Dabra21
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for Colombus day weekend. The hotel was very close to Times Square and all of the sights! The room was smallish, but you are really only in the room to sleep right? The continental breakfast was, fruit, toast and bagels. Tiny room with all lot of people and few seats. We grabbed some fruit and went back to our room to get ready for our day.It's a plus for people who want a little something in the morning. We found the hotel suitable for our needs, clean, prompt service and definitly close to Times square. I will say we asked the girl at the information desk a few questions and she seemed preoccupied and not that interested in helping us. A little young for that job I think. Otherwise we had no issues and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: MaryfromNevada
Reviews.Content: I was with a friend before our cruise and spent 4 days here. This was a great find. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Also very quite. The breakfast was very adequate and offered a much bigger selection than expected. All the staff was friendly and very helpful. All in all this was a very pleasant stay. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hugely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: iceward
Reviews.Content: Our 3 day stay in NYC was the hardest to book. I couldn't believe the price of Hotels in the city and it was with some degree of resignation that I booked this hotel. The location was superb, 2 blocks from the heart of Times Square and getting around was easy. The hotel itself has a nice reception area with a TV, sofas and 2 internet PC's. There are 2 different lifts which service different areas of the hotel. We were at the back and our lift was very heavily used. Our room was adequate. It was quite small, compared to other hotels we had stayed at in other cities, but had a comfortable bed, working TV and an OK bathroom. Our 'view' was of fire escapes for other buildings and the air con was a little noisy. The included breakfast was basic, with toast, yoghurts, cereals and donuts!. It was also very busy and finding somewhere to sit was difficult. We did like the small bar on the 2nd floor, with friendly, helpful bar staff and cheepish beer. At check out I asked the lady at the information desk if she would book us a taxi to the airport. She did this and took a $10 deposit. I enquired what this was for and she said it would be given to the driver and taken off our bill. However it was not given to the driver, so it was basically a booking fee. My advice: Don't get ripped off by the hotel, hail a cab from the street We really liked New York and just wished that the hotels were cheaper. Certainly the most expensive city to stay in that I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Does Exactly What You Expect and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nellym
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel@Times Square for 4 days in mid - late October. We were impressed with the excellent standard of service, general cleanliness and room facilities. The continental breakfast included in the price is also a big plus and pretty good! Free wifi is something even the big hotels don't provide so it was good that this was provided, both in the lobby and in your room. For us though we found the location perfect. We went with my 6 year old son who isn't really up for spending the whole day walking. To be fair he didn't need to with the hotel being 1 block from Times Square and literally a 2 min walk from the 47-50th St Rockefeller Center subway station. There were many eating options, mostly fast food, nearby. A few very minor drawbacks - firstly the cost but that is standard in Manhattan so you'll have to come to terms with that. Otherwise, some of the hallways could do with a refurb and breakfast can get busy between 8.30 - 10.00 but no other problems. We recommend it. Give it a try and you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value & Convenience”
Reviews.Author: BBTUTU
Reviews.Content: As a single traveler trying a hotel for the first time, you're never sure what to expect but I was very pleased with my hotel room, the hotel's location, and how perfectly comfortable and relaxing it was to stay there. Stayed for 4 nights and would definitely stay again. The location could not be better. Very close to Rockefeller Centre, Saks Fifth Avenue, Times Square and the Theatre District. Interesting that it is located in Little Brazil, filled with little cafes and restaurants offering South American cuisine - I considered this to be a surprise bonus and something I otherwise would not have checked out. The staff and also the guests were quite friendly and chatty. I felt safe. I slept well. And while this is not a luxury hotel with lots of amenities, the hotel met my needs full at a price that did not break my budget.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! Very Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: assunta99
Reviews.Content: Booking online sometimes what you see is not what you get. With The Hotel @ Times Square, it gave me even more! From the minute we walked in, the hotel is beautifully decorated. Everyone is friendly and willing to please! Our room was not a small as I thought! It was pretty spacious, even the bathroom. The included breakfast was delicious :) Quiet, but convenient to everything! We will be staying here whenever in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PeachSangria
Reviews.Content: When researching hotels this one came up as a great deal so I turned to TripAdvisor (not expecting much due to the price) and was pleasantly suprised that it appeared to be a good deal AND a good hotel in a good location. So we picked it based solely on Tripadvisor reviews and as usual were not disappointed. We didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room but when we were there, it was comfortable and quiet. We checked in and out with no wait. Rooms were very clean and larger than I expected. Water pressure and temperature in the shower were excellent. The concierge was helpful with directions and suggestions. Minor issues: The elevators are so slow that we would get frustrated and end up taking the stairs. We drove into the city and when we went to the parking garage the hotel says to park at, they said our Ford truck was too large to park there. Luckily we found another garage right down the street that could accomodate us. Asked front desk for a wine bottle opener and they did not have one. If you are looking for an affordable, clean and comfortable place to stay just a few blocks from Times Square, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: sun n' surf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights in September prior to going on our cruise. We found the hotel to be clean and quite. Yes the rooms were on the small size but compared to the prices right on Times Square this was a bargain! The continental breakfast was was good, a bit busy but still manageable. The concierge desk was very helpful in securing transportation for us to the cruise pier. During our stay, my husband lost his wallet and the staff was able to locate it and MAIL it to us in California! We are extremely grateful to the staff for their assistance with this. Good hotel would stay their again :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotelStayMatters
Reviews.Content: The majority of the reviews I read on tripadvisor for this hotel are true. Yes, the room is small (we stayed in a double room), yes the bathroom door is a mix of frosted and clear glass so you have to put a towel over the door so you can't see through (and yes you can see through), yes the elevator is small and occasionally you have a small wait time, and yes the staff aren't overly friendly, and yes the bathroom has a slight odor HOWEVER... I would stay in this hotel again if I was only staying for 1or 2 nights. We only stayed for one night and didn't spend much time in the room. The room was clean, the bathroom was clean and neat. I only had to deal with the staff twice (during check-in and check-out) and they were cordial. Although the bathroom had a slight odor, I don't think it was due to uncleanliness. I had heard this was formerly a Super8 motel so maybe it was due to some old pipes (who knows). I like the double room because I was with a young male teenager and didn't want to purchase 2 separate rooms but the double gave us each our privacy (there is a door separating us). The bathroom is located on one side of the room so that was a little inconvenient but not enough to complain. Overall, good stay for the price. Don't forget to ask for your AAA or AARP discount upon arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat This Value Right at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: TO_Trips
Reviews.Content: OK, all you're doing is sleeping there! Hate paying those crazy prices for a room in the heart of the action around Times Square and Broadway? This is the place for you! Clean, up-to-date. Based on the room we had, nicely refurbished. We had a king bed ... furniture virtually new. Sure, the rooms aren't huge but lots of room for 5 days of clothes and all the stuff we bought. Private bathroom, all redone. Everything worked. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Discounted parking right across the street. Basic continental breakfast could use a bit more fruit (in MHO) but coffee, cappuccino, juices, yoghurt, bagels, cereal, toast, donuts, apples and bananas -- it certainly gets you going in the a.m. We found it quiet for sleeping (though we always put the fan on low and running continuously to mask the sound any time we are in a hotel).
