Two computers/printers in the lobby. Wireless internet everywhere. Tiny bar on the second floor was actually very, very nice! Concierge - excellent! Cleaning staff very accommodating. You can walk anywhere around Times Square and Broadway. Couple with transit Metropass, a couple of taxis ... and you're good to go. No surprises with the bill at checkout ... exactly as promised.

Reviews.Title: “Classic NYC hotel: pack 'em in, take their money, treat 'em like $#1t”
Reviews.Author: yobyot
Reviews.Content: Let me ask you this: if you made a reservation for a room that, with tax and parking, costs nearly $375 and you a) noted in the reservation that you wanted a room away from the elevator, b) called the day of arrival to repeat the request and c) asked one more time at the front desk, would you be pleased if you were given a room DIRECTLY ACROSS FROM THE ELEVATOR? This hotel has just the veneer of quality -- the rooms are tiny, the "flat screen" TVs have no hi-def, the wireless Internet is weak and if you are unlucky enough to get a room in the back part of the hotel, rest assured that the front desk staff is too rude to bother pointing out that you have to take the single, slow, smelly elevator in the back to get to your room. Everything about this hotel screams cheap: skimpy toiletries in the bathroom, dirty covering filthy windows. Carpet with enough "deodorizer" embedded in it to almost cover the fact that mold is growing underneath the carpet. Shall I go on? Take the Kafkaesque conversation I had with the manager on discovering we had paid to listen to elevator doors and bells ring all night long: "Can you please move us?" "I am here to help -- no, I can't move you.." "Are you the manager?" "Yes" "Can you offer us something else to compensate us for the inconvenience?" "I am here to help you -- no." Bottom line tripadvisor.com readers: stay away. You will get an overpriced, noisy, dirty room, presented by a rude, disinterested staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: wabeach
Reviews.Content: I was visiting with a friend before we left on a cruise. What a wonderful find. Great rooms and service. Very quite and comfortable rooms. The beds were so comfortable. This hotel is close to Time Square and lots of New York sights. We walked to everything. Restaurants in the area were great. The Continental breakfast is awesome. A very added value. A little hard to find a place to sit because everyone is enjoying their breakfast. Definetly would stay here again. y

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Gae51
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very very comfortable. Although the rooms are small they were clean and the beds very comfortable. The breakfast was good with lots of variety. The hotel staff were pleasant and the concierge was very patient and helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel to any of my friends that were going to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: momdey1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 double bed room. The bed was real comfortable. The room was quiet, clean and the service was good. The continental breakfast was great. In our section of the hotel we had 1 elevator. It was a little slow but nothing to complain about. Location was great, just 2 blocks from Time Square. Theaters,shopping and restaurants close by. All in all we had a great time. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: JLK092610
Reviews.Content: My 3 girlfriends & I from Vancouver, BC Canada, checked into The Hotel at Times Square on Sat. Sept. 18-10 until Fri. Sept. 25-10 after returning from a 7 day Canada New England cruise in & out of New York. We were given 2 rooms on the 4th floor with 2 double beds each. The room & the bathroom were very clean. This is my 4th visit to New York & the size of the room for a New York hotel was very spacious having 2 windows & a window in the bathroom. We were concerned when we looked out our bedroom window to discover a construction site next door. The front desk told us it was quiet & if there was a problem on Monday the hotel would deal with it. Due to the economy & recession the construction on the site has stopped so it was quiet the whole week we were there. The room we booked was a smoking room as it was $100.00 less a night compared to a non-smoking room. My girlfriend & I are not smokers and we could not smell smoke in our room. I remember reading some other reviews of the hotel & comments about the bathroom door having a frosted glass insert in it. Yes it's different but we didn't find it a problem & you can't really see anything. The rippled glass adds character to the room. The air condioner in the room worked great keeping us cool. The beds were most comfortable & clean. The housekeeping staff was most friendly & helpful. The free continental breakfast was great with fresh fruit, instant oatmeal, asstd. yogurts, bagels & cream cheese, toast & jams, asstd cereals, asstd. yogurts, orange & apple juice, coffee/tea, fresh doughnuts. We found it just enough to get your morning going & we agreed that we're sure it's a savings of $20.00 for breakfast. The elevators are slow but people this is an old New York building so you have to have patience & not expect speeding bullet elevators. If you can't wait & your in a hurry for the elevator - then take the steps & get some good added exercise. The internet is free with 2 monitors, keyboards & printers with a time allowance of 15 min. per person which was great. The Concierge was most helpful esp. connecting me with a resident Doctor in the area as I needed antibiotics. Ella & those at the frontdesk check-in were most helpful. Check out is at Noon which is also great. The hotel will hold your luggage if you have a later flight that day or evening. Lastly, location, location, location. The hotel is located 2 blocks from Times Square. There is a HSBC bank 1/2 block away as is a MacDonald's. Ladies for shopping the Dress Barn is located right next door to the hotel. The hotel is located in the area of Little Brazil with several restaurants, a church, comedy club along the streets before hitting Times Square & we all felt very safe walking the streets at night coming back to the hotel. The decor in the hotel is very nice with a great lobby for guests to sit & watch t.v. or sit around a table. I would definitely return to The Hotel at Times Square & refer all my family & friends. Tks for making our trip a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service - Lost Credit Card Information”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgent155004
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent, recently I booked a client a room at The Hotel at Times Square. Unfortunately, due to circumstances beyond her control, she had to cancel. She was travelling to New York on Greyhound and found out the night before her departure that there was a high possibility that Greyhound would lockout it's employees leaving her, her 2 children, and her mother stranded in New York City. I contacted Applecore Hotels at 8:00pm the night before her arrival to cancel and was told that because they have a 24 hour cancellation policy I would have to contact the hotel manager, that she was the only person who could cancel a reservation due to special circumstances, which I felt this was so I thought there would be no problem, I couldn't have been more wrong. I then left a message for the hotel manager indicating the situation and asked that she call me back to discuss. When I didn't hear from her the next morning, I left another message at 9:30am. Because the reservation was that evening, I was in a bit of a panic to make sure it was cancelled, so I contacted the front desk ,who spoke to the hotel manager and passed along a message indicating that the client would be billed for one night. I asked to speak directly to the hotel manager, but was put through to the reservation manager who couldn't do anything, but said he would if he could. I then tried talking to the reservation company again, but they couldn't do anything either. I understand the 24 hour cancellation policy, but I also know that exceptions are made every day for special circumstances. At 11:00am I called the front desk again and strongly requested that I be put through to the hotel manager. She was very rude and would not listen to anything I had to say. When I asked if she "couldn't" or "wouldn't" change the reservation, she said she "wouldn't"! She informed me again that she would be billing the client for one nights stay, but if the client visited the hotel in the next month she would refund this payment. I told her that wasn't possible as the trip was a gift for one of her travel companions who would be leaving the country. I have emailed the hotel manager and Apple Core's general manager multiple times and left voice messages. I also sent a message via the hotel's website, mostly I have had notreplies. I've sent in my credit card information to have the room rate applied to my card, rather than my clients, as I do not feel that my client should suffer because of this situation. They "lost" my credit card information. They will not contact me to tell me how this could have happened. They are now asking for me to send it again, which I refuse to do. I believe that the client is due a 100% refund from this hotel. I have been trying to contact the general manager but she will not respond. I have read other reviews where similar situations have occurred. Do not expect to receive any kind of understanding or help from the staff at this hotel. They take your money and run!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: washntrot
Reviews.Content: Room nicely appointed and clean, small, but this is NYC. Had problem with phone and safe, they fixed right away. Great rate for NY although this was Feb. Bellboy very helpful and nice. Walked to theater district. Enjoyed Patzeria pizza.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY! Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: nic-tb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from NYC and stayed at The Hotel @ Times Square and couldn't have been happier! Very nice two room suite. The bathroom was a bit small but other than that it was clean comfortable and perfect for us. The elevator was not a big problem like some people have said, (and we were on the 12th floor) and the location was PERFECT, especially for the price! I would highly recommend this hotel. The breakfast was ok and the service was good. No great complaints here. I am giving the room 4 stars just for the small bath.

Reviews.Title: “be careful! misconduct in pricing”
Reviews.Author: carmelo82
Reviews.Content: last july I booked a room for one person for 5 days in september (from 5 to 10 september), 270 $ at day (tax inclused). the price was high but I hope the hotel was good. The night of 9 september two friends came in new york and stayed at the hotel @ times square, but they paid 200 $ for a room for two people, without reservation. 70 $ less the price I paid. Totaly I paid 350 $ more in 5 days. It's not correct. anyway the hotel has good location but it is nothing of special. With 270 $ you can find a lot of better solutions. The room are noisy and small. The breakfast bad.

Reviews.Title: “A surprising delight”
Reviews.Author: Chozz
Reviews.Content: You will quickly realise just how expensive NY hotels are when you begin your search for a place to stay in the big apple. We tried every website, looked up recommendations from friends and family and even considered apartments for short term stays. But thankfully we came across this hidden gem. Booked it through GTA, after reading relatively positive reviews on tripadvisor and the fact that it was cheaper than most hotels, even 1 and 2 star places! We paid approx $165 per night plus tax, which is a steal for a place so centrally located. The name suggests its slap bang in the middle of times square, when its actually a couple of blocks away, but thats fine I have legs and can walk. Also the street itself is reasonably quiet, little brasil its signposted as, didn't cause much concern for noise at night. There are also nearby subway stations at 42nd st near times square, the corner of 6th ave & 47th st and also another up on 50/49th st, so easy access to the rest of the city. We arrived early at 2pm and were allowed to check-in without any hassle. I expected a small room but was pleasantly surprised with the space, comfort and facilities of our room 709. The corridors are narrow, but we didn't experience any trouble with noise from other rooms, bar the odd slamming door. Free wi-fi and breakfast are always a treat and much appreciated. Staff were polite and helpful. There is also a bar on the second floor which offers $3 draught beers, which in manhattan is not a common occurrance - expect to pay anywhere from $6-9 for a bottle of beer. The hotel in general was honestly well above my expectations and would be somewhere I would strongly consider staying again if and when I return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Visa fraud??? See what u think”
Reviews.Author: munchyDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1.5 years ago with family and had a great time, I booked 2 queen rooms for July 14 for 1 night after a few weeks I cancelled for another hotel. No problems at all, untill I get home and in one if the visa cards I was using to book flight hotels for our trip etc it showed charges for thus hotel 2 rooms but for July 7, I ring e mail etc sunnie days firstly it's prob input mistake they see I cancelled the July 14 booking and have no reference for July 7 then after a few days it's because I rang this supposed booking not online, any hotels I booked was online best rates etc, they say I booked so I'm charged I told them I'd booking for other hotels at this time and could give them names of these places but their still saying I booked these rooms . I DID NOT . I'm in the process of having a visa card put a barr in any charges that are applecore hotels as I feel information is unsafe and in my case misused I suggest other people do the same as I'm now down 300 euro over this, I have e mails from hotel for anyone to read if needed and would show invoices for other hotel to show I'm not lying. Do not stay here full stop I'm sure someone from the hotel will try defend what iv said here but don't be fooled I liked the hotel and area it was in but this is truly awfull. We are on to visa to see what steps we can take, shame in the hotel @ times sq and all who" work" in it

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and Wow'd”
Reviews.Author: JohnPippy
Reviews.Content: Second time to NYC, first time was Econolodge (small but very clean and friendly staff) There was no availability on our return trip. So we booked The Hotel. At first I was hesitant, but when we arrived we were provided with exceptional service. We checked in early and they immediately had a room for us. It was very clean and larger than we expected, the concierge was very nice, informative and helpful. The complimentary breakfast included was good for what it was a morning snack, there was cereal, donuts, juice, coffee and bagels and yogurt as well. There was also a fresh water machine, where we filled up our water bottles on a regular basis during our stay. When we were leaving (flight was at 8 pm, we were provided a place to store our luggage and the concierge booked a cab for us. (Not only a regular yellow cab, but a SUV Lincoln Navigator, we were impressed. Overall we would recommend this place to anyone, good value and good service. I just hope that the positive reviews this place gets won't result in higher accommodation fees.

Reviews.Title: “from terrible to average, depends on room”
Reviews.Author: GoAround7
Reviews.Content: we choose the hotel based on tripadvisor reviews, arrived around 11pm and were sent to the DIRTIEST room we have ever seen, somewhere on the 1st floor (133?). We asked for a different room and were told that there's no other availability until the following morning. It was a horrible experience. Everything from the stench in the room, to the dirty doors, dirty shower, slimy carpet, stained torn towels, stained sheets, old furniture, loud neighbors.. SLIMY!! We asked for new towels at least. They were sent up after 2 calls and those two were torn and grayish.. The following morning we were given a room on the 5th floor. This one was decently clean and we spent the 3 remaining nights there. Location is good. Don't expect smiles, apologies, politeness. Customer service is apparently not included. Be ready for anything and hope for a decent room. Or just pay a bit more and choose a place that can offer you a clean bed.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fate06
Reviews.Content: I booked for 3 nights, before flying back to Europe. As the previous review, I too requested a non-smoking and didn't notice it was confirmed "on request". When I arrived I was given a SMELLY smoking room and when I complained the girl at the front desk was very unfriendly and unpleasant and told me I got what I reserved: a smoking room. I sent a complaint to easyToBook, online agency that merged with Booking.com, and the following day I received a reply apologizing for the inconvenience. Casually, the same day I was given a NON SMOKING room ... A pity the air condition didn't work properly, suddenly made a lot of noise, and it woke me up at 4 am. The following morning I told the same girl at the front desk to advise maintenance ... when I came back at 5 pm nothing had been done. Called again the front desk, there was another receptionist who sent immediately somebody to look at the problem. I was told that the machine was broken and should be replaced with a new one. Asked to do so after I went out at 6.30 pm. Don't know what they did ... when I came back at midnight the noise was continuous. That's why I had to change room twice in 2 days. I was really looking forward to leave this awful hotel, a former SUPER 8 motel remodeled (???) 2 years ago. Although it is very central and convenient, it is not worth the money it cost (nearly 200$ per night) considering the bad service and the rude attitude of some front desk employees. Besides there are only 2 lifts for the two 12 floors towers (one for each), the breakfast is served in a messy room in the basement (no lift will take you there, must go down the stairs) and need some fantasy to call it "continental breakfast". If you can, STAY AWAY FROM IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this NOISY hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melL2904
Reviews.Content: I was very very disappointed with this hotel. We stayed 3 days at this hotel, the FIRST NIGHT we couldn't sleep AT ALL, there was a demolition truck across the street that did their job in the middle of the night (until around 3 AM in the morning). I spoke to the front desk the next morning, requesting to change the room, they said that there was no other room, the hotel was full booked. I told the front desk that if you have empty room, please call me. In the afternoon I again called the front desk, and they keep saying there was no other room available, so we ended up sleeping at the same room. It was horrible!. The SECOND NIGHT, we barely can sleep again. The next morning, I again spoke to the front desk, and one of the customer asked if I already packed my stuff. I said to him that I haven't packed my stuff because we were ready to start out tour, and they didn't even bothered to call me and let me know in advance if there was an empty room (It was around 10 AM and we are ready to start our tour ( Me and my husband brought our 2 year old daughter)), I didn't want to go upstairs again and wasting our time, so I told them that I will speak to the manager later on. I called the manager around 5 pm explaining all the situation asking her to adjust the price because we couldn't even have any other room beside the noisy room for 2 days. She said that the noise is out of her control,and she blamed me that I didn't packed my stuff this morning and moved to another room. Furthermore she told me that noisy is very common in NY and it is very different to where I live in country side (PLS NOTE THAT I LIVE IN L.A. and MY HOUSE IS AT THE INTERSECTION OF MAJOR CROSS STREET). PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!, POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE, ABSOLUTELY NOT A HOTEL FOR SINGLE, FAMILY OR EVERYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Clean at a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: texascindy333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to New York for the second time in one year. We love this city so much so we want to make sure everything is perfect. After going thru tripadvisor for the perfect hotel because the previous one was not available I stumbled upon this hotel and I read just about every review. Every employee that we encountered was very nice and helpful and greeted us with a smile. The room was very nice and clean and the size was a surprise because remember we are in New York and most hotel rooms are so tiny. They also have continental breakfast downstairs and you need to go early because it does fill up fast. Another great service this hotel has is that even though check-in is at 3:00 you can book an early flight and they will hold your bags for you in a safe place at no extra charge ( we did tip the concirege) so that you can hurry and spend more time enjoying the city and you can book a very late flight to leave so you can get alot out of that day and they will hold your bags then too. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “reservation cancelled upon arrival”
Reviews.Author: Gid76
Reviews.Content: On July 9th I book a room for 3 nights at The Hotel at Times Square. The booking was placed through hotel web site and I receive the email "CONFIRMING MY RESERVATION". On August 10th at 1am upon arrival I was told that my reservation was cancelled due to problems with my credit card. The hotel was full so, at 1am I had to find another place to stay. They had all my data and nobody warned me about any problem. Cancelling a reservation without contacting the client is something unheard even for a one star lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our next stay”
Reviews.Author: Lilaxi
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location-less than 2 blocks from Times Square and Broadway, short walk (less than 10 min) to Rockefeller Center. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Recently renovated- everything was bright and clean. Nicely decorated room with modern furnishings. Definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lmh718
Reviews.Content: My daughter (age 20) and I travel to NYC for a girls weekend every summer. This was our first stay here but definitely will not be our last. You can't beat the price, the location, the service. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Scott8459
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Hotel in Times Square was great. This was our first stay in New York City and we thought about staying outside of New York and riding the train in each day. We were so glad we didn't. This hotel is located just blocks from Times Square and 5th Ave. We were only minutes away from the subway and used to go to Yankee Stadium and also to Battery Park. We had a rental car and parked it up the block never used it the two days were were there. So as expected the rooms were standard size for the area. Our room had two beds in two separate rooms each with their own television and a shared bathroom that was small; however, the shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. The were doing construction next door but I hardly heard a thing. Maybe the sound of the air conditioner shut out the noise or I was just too tired to care. The free breakfast was okay. No hot items unless you consider toast or bagel a hot item. But the breakfast area was nice and always stocked from 7 - 10. The concierge was very helpful and was able to answer all my many questions concerning transportation. Overall a very good stay at a clean hotel. Only bad thing was that one of the two elevators was out of service the day we left which was troublesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value- loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtlawmom
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at this hotel and highly recommend it. I had a queen bedded room with more than ample space, although not huge.. The bathroom was nicely furnished with nice toiletries and a hair dryer. There was a good flat screen TV, a dresser with 3 drawers, a desk and office chair along with another padded chair as well. The furnishings were modern and colorful and the room on the 11th floor was quiet. Free internet was reasonably fast and there was a safe in the closet. Location was excellent, outside of Times Square proper and not far from the NBC studios and 5th Ave. The breakfast was pretty basic and got backed up when it was crowded and the ice machines are in the lobby so quite a hike if you are in an upper floor. Staff was very friendly and made every effort to make my stay pleasant. Great halal food cart on the corner with very reasonable prices. I spent the 4 nights before at the Westin at Times Square and even though my conference had a great rate- I felt the Hotel at Times Square had it beat in terms of value for the money. I think the Apple Core group is on to something special.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the big city”
Reviews.Author: twhengineer
Reviews.Content: My wife and i travelled to USA for first time in july and stayed at this smashing little hotel. The staff were very courteous and efficiecent particularly the day staff. Romm was a good size and on the 10th floor. Great location to visit all attractions most withion a 5 min walk. Buffet continental Breakfast was perfect and well organised. Would stay here again without hesitation. The only down point was the street noise not from below but at high level but that would occur anywhere in new york i guess. i can reccommnend the brasilian restaurant acrosss the street for great value food and atmosphere we shared with a 18 strong wedding party and service was still execellent

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: janjanmmm
Reviews.Content: While the Hotel itself has comfortable and well appointed rooms with nice bathrooms there were some issues with our stay. First, it is worth mentioning that it is not actually ON Times square, but couple of blocks away, although close enough to still be a good location. Second, more importantly, some of the rooms are located on the same floor as the very noisy bar and if you arrive late enough (as we did) you are going to get one of them with plenty of noise till midnight. Why they have rooms right next to a bar (literally- two feet away) is beyond me. Next day they will probably move you to a different room, but it is still a pain, as not only you will get one noisy night but you will have to pack and unpack one more time, and we were not the only unlucky ones, for sure, - just as we checked out they were moving someone else's stuff from room to room. Stuff - male stuff is grumpy and not especially helpful, female is better, but only marginally so. Overall it is a fair deal for the price, but try not to arrive to late if you want a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but beware of the bathroom smells!”
Reviews.Author: selfun2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at The Hotel @ Times Square. The hotel was very well kept in a great location. Everyone from the hotel that we came into contact with were very friendly and helpful. The only complaint that I would have it that the bathrooms smelled terrible. We bought air freshner and it did not help. Not sure what the problem was but it was impossible to ignore. Because of this I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great value”
Reviews.Author: Kitten63
Reviews.Content: Loved the stay. Breakfast great staff very helpful Elevators long queue in morning

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel @Times Square was a great deal and in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: valdawwg
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC many times before but have never spent a night and I had a friend coming into town who had never been so I wanted us to have a great experience. NYC can be very pricy so I searched for a great deal and came across The Hotel @Times Square for a very reasonable $203 for the night! I am a bit hesitant when I see such a good deal in a pricey area so I checked out TripAdvisor for the reviews and most were very good! When we arrived they were very friendly and were able to accomodate us with 2 standard beds instead of 1 king bed. There was a 'concierge' desk with a woman who had a lot of information on local attractions and helped us 2 or 3 times to find our way around the city. The room itsself is small but we weren't there to spend much time in the room anyway so that didn't bother us. There is a large flat screen TV and a pretty modern looking bathroom and everything was very clean. In the morning there was a continental breakfast which was pretty good and checking out was a breeze. I would say the only bad thing about the room is that you can hear a lot of the outside noise, but it wasn't too bothersome and with the AC or the TV on, you could easily drown it out. The location of the hotel was great! It's on 46th street between 5th and 6th and is less than 3 blocks to the center of Times Square! We were about 6 blocks to a major subway which could take us anywhere in Manhattan for very cheap. All in all this was a GREAT hotel at a GREAT price and in a GREAT location. I would definitely reccommend it and/or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay but a bit of noise due to Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: squiggles1118
Reviews.Content: We were in New York for 6 days and stayed here. Everything was really great except we had "spring break" college students making A LOT (party) of noise on the floor. Not too soundproof as the building is older but in pristine shape. That said, I made a phone call to the front desk at 2am. The noise complaint was handled immediately. Students were great and apologized the next day. All in all, I would recommend this hotel and stay here again. Great location, close to subway and Times Square. Breakfast included which was a plus for a busy day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: B265
Reviews.Content: was in NY week of july 11, 2020. Hotel location ideal; hotel renovated hence all is new in rooms; good service from desk and concierge; good breakfast in morning; merits its 3 stars; would recommend at anytime; moreover prices are much affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great stay”
Reviews.Author: para522
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The rooms are clean and spacious (for New York City). The staff was great. The breakfast is okay. Just cereal, bagels, toast, yogurt. Nothing hot. The only complaint I had was that there was no wi-fi connectivity in the room. Everything else was great! We stayed three nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. This hotel is convient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: yacov_e
Reviews.Content: The location is the biggest advantage. The room we stay was big and clean. The breakfast was OK. The only complain we may have is the Wi-Fi. Almost no connectivity in the room. Most of the time the only place where you can connect is the lobby... Other then that, we spent a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: sparker84
Reviews.Content: On the first night the hotel staff gave us a double room room because the single room we reserved was not available. They were great at accomodating us. My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights and the hotel is AMAZING! It is VERY close to Times Square. The rooms are clean and modern. For the price you pay it is well worth it. Tip: Don't get a room facing the street it can get very loud at night.

Reviews.Title: “Tried it and Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephka
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms, fantastic location, surprisingly quiet. Staff was helpful and the little bar upstairs a convenient way to end a great stay. Terrific value for the price. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingcanuck_10
Reviews.Content: my partner and i just recently came from a two night stay here and were extremely satisfied. The staff and conceirge were what made the stay so pleasant, very helpful, friendly and went out of their way to help us. The location is superb with the parking garage right near the hotel which was also conveinant. The rooms were a bit smaller but who is going to stay in their room while on vacation to times square? Rooms were clean and bed comfortable. The area was good and i never once was scared or nervous about anything. This is our third stay at nyc and our past two stays were at a more 'poshy' expensive hotel and it didn't compare to hotel 41. Staff make this hotel. I am coming back next summer and this is where i will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: cavertoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near several restaurants/pubs and short walk to Times Square and Theater District. The beds are comfortable and my daughter liked the IHome player in the room. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. We used the in-room safe to lock valuables. Very reasonably priced. I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: amarillobulldog
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with two teenage girls. Rooms are a little tight for family of four but the room and location were definitely worth the price. Free Internet and free breakfast were great. We were on the sixth floor and in the back part of the building and had no noise, excpet for noisy children. Don't be afraid of lack of brand name. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: TKF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel @Times Square June 17 -20 based on reviews from Trip Advisor.. We are a family of four with 2 teenagers. We found the hotel clean and comfortable with a friendly staff and great location to Times Square. We thought we got a good price on the internet then they gave us an additional 10% with our AAA card on check-in. We were on the 11th floor and used the back elevator which was a little slow but nothing too bad. The breakfast was a great way to start the day, coffee, cereal, fruit, donuts, bagels and yogurt. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: hmanshor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of the subway and that made it so convenient to see all the attractions in NY. Because of religious reasons, we needed to find halal food and there was a halal food cart just steps from the hotel... perfect! We booked a room for 4 pple and it was spacious enough for us to move around when we put our bags against the wall. The breakfast provided was a plus and we ate our fill before we ventured out for the day. However, the coffee machine in the room smelled of plastic when it was switched on to make coffee. We didn't use it again after the first time. I would definitely return to this hotel because of the great location. We walked to Times Sq and there were plenty of shops around so everything we needed were within reach.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel worth re-visiting”
Reviews.Author: ritatravels
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights. Pros: Good value for the price. Accepts AAA and AARP. Room with 2 queens large enough for 3 of us (could accomodate 4). Beds very comfotable. Sufficient space to store clothing, Bathroom good size. Updated decorating. Generous continental breakfast was included. All staff responsive to our needs. Room smelled clean. AC was not noisy. Gernerally, we did not hear noise outside. 10 minutes from Times Square. Close to many theatres. Cons: Slight smell of smoke in halls, but not in room. TP not "charmin"- a little scratchy. Towels a little scratchy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherylnwayne1
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to The Hotel @ Times Square. It seems each time I visit, the hotel gets better. The first two times I visited, the hotel was under renovation. If you are looking for a hotel that offers a great location for travellers on a budget, this is your hotel. Nothing fancy, but it is clean and comfortable. The rooms are small, but I think that is the norm for NYC hotels. The beds are comfortable. I stayed in room 414 on this trip and my room was at the rear of the hotel, so there was very little noise from the street. The windows were covered with something which made the room very dark - even when the sun was shining. This makes for a good sleep! Highly recommend to the traveller on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Beling
Reviews.Content: I was staying at The Hotel At Times Square for one week in April 2010. It is a very comfortable hotel, excellent located (5 minute walking from Times Square and the 5th Ave), and surprinsingly very quiet so you can rest and sleep having no problems. The staff is very kind, they give good indications, maps, and so on. The hotel is very clean, and you have breakfast included within the reservation, which is quite strange bearing in mind it is NY city (the mast vajority of hotels don't include breakfast wihtin the reservation). However, the breakfast is quite repetitive and after a week you get tired of eating every day the same. You can find a metro stop at the corner, 2 minute walking. Somre rooms are quite small, so make sure you ask for a bigger room when you make your reservation. I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More then what was expected”
Reviews.Author: bltb
Reviews.Content: 14 of us traved to NY for a week of theater and fun. We booked the hotel because of the reviews and the price. We were more then happy with the hotel. The location was great as Times Square and the Theater District are within a couple of blocks. The hotel was clean, the beds were very comfortable, breakfast was simple (toast, cereal, fruit) and the staff was helpfull. We will stay here again. Our only complaint was with 14 of us checking in to 7 rooms, in did take a while to get all ckecked in. The rooms are small, but you are in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PeteandMandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2010 and i can't fault anything....i got a room on a high floor and it was perfect...will def. stay here again. I travelled on my own to meet up with the rest of my family who also stayed in the same hotel....they also totally enjoyed the stay at the hotel well done!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Single Lady Traveling Solo”
Reviews.Author: eslywi
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 6-day theater & museum trip in NYC and stayed at this hotel. It was the perfect location for a single woman traveling alone. It was close to the theaters, and I felt safe each night walking back to the hotel from the theater after the performance. Sunday night's rate was 139.00 and the subsequent nights were 199.00 each, Compared to other hotels this was a great deal. The rooms were clean although the space was limited, but how much hotel space does one person need in NYC if you're there to see the city?The pictures on this website are very accurate. The subway was just around the corner and restaurants and shopping were within easy walking distance, Can't beat the price. I'll be returning to New York in the fall and plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a single traveler who just needs a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: AriadneK
Reviews.Content: Due to the fact that I had two events occurring in Manhattan in quick succession (the first on a Thursday night, the next early on Friday morning), I needed a place to stay overnight. The Hotel at Times Square seemed to fit the bill, and really I just wanted a clean, reasonably priced place to sleep. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of this hotel: the room and hallways were in good repair; the bathroom was immaculate and equipped with nice basics. Service was prompt and courteous, and the continental breakfast was basic but certainly sufficient for a quick meal. There are two guest-accessible computers in the lobby, and the hotel does not charge extra. My room was very warm when I arrived, but the in-room air conditioner cooled it down nicely. I happened to be on the 10th floor and between that and the air conditioner, the worst of the street noise was drowned out and I slept like a baby. Closing the bathroom door also reduced the noise significantly. The rooms are quite small. I was assigned a room with two double beds. For one person there was more than enough space, but I can easily see multiple guests getting very cramped very quickly. The desk chair was the only non-bed seating space. One nitpick: I couldn't get the alarm clock to work properly; I think the "set alarm" button was broken.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice for a NYC stay.”
Reviews.Author: ownit
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC and I could not have been any more pleased with my hotel choice. On my second night, the people across the hall from me were very loud in the hallway. I called the front desk and the matter was resolved within 5 minutes. The room was small but very well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. On repeat visits to NYC I will be making reservations at The Hotel @Times Square again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the single traveller”
Reviews.Author: Sev_Canada
Reviews.Content: Good basic, clean hotel with the perks of a free simple breakfast, security box, and access to a computer if you didn't travel with one. European style building, narrow, small hallways and elevator. Everything seemed clean to me. Double lock on door. I felt safe alone in the hotel. Friendly service. 10 min walk with luggage to NY Airport Shuttle. Close to Times Square and Theatre District. Been to NYC many times. Found it a bit nicer than the Miford Plaza -Howard Johnston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: zw2l
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Memorial Day weekend, and it was easily the cheapest quality hotel available in the area. Location is great, two blocks from Times Square. Rooms are a good size for NYC, and were well maintained and clean. We had a comfortable king size bed. There is free breakfast and internet, although the breakfast can get pretty busy. The Hotel was probably at least 50$ a night cheaper than any other hotel in the area that I would consider staying at. Downsides: there are only two elevators, so if for some reason you can't take the stairs, it can sometimes take a while to get one. The air conditioner wasn't great, but it didn't affect us too much, might be more of a problem in summer. We walked by one room with the door open, and it appeared that there were no windows, which seemed odd (but maybe we just could see them. Overall, for what you get in this location at this price, I think this hotel is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: NSDee
Reviews.Content: Great location and price. Not a big room but the bathroom was ample. Very slow elevators so walking down always was quicker. Front desk staff and housekeeping were great other than the woman who works the tourist info desk. She doesn't seem to enjoy her job very much, very unfriendly with aburpt answers and not helpful at all as it appeared that we were interupting her plans for her day. Got more info from the vendors outside of the front door than from her! Considering the area, it was very quite and restful after very busy, busy days! Would certainly stay here again if travelling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Vikrant
Reviews.Content: Its barely a block away from Times Square - which makes it amazing - from a location perspective. For that kind of location, its about 100$ per day cheaper than any other hotel around. That's it's USP The rooms are decent for NYC- the bathrooms surprisingly roomy However the infrastructure is falling apart a bit. The heating wasn't working - in January. It took us about an hour for someone to come up and give us an oil heater- since they couldn't fix the thing up - and it got quite cold. Also no in room dining to speak off - they are happy to give you menus though of the restaurants around - like Pizza places etc- so maybe we should call it a motel. But that would be unfair- its primarily positioned as an affordable location near Times Square - which it is. The other great thing was the free long distance calls in the USA and free internet- but when it didn't work you had to call the internet provider.But to be fair that wasn't much of a hassle- but then why not call this a serviced apartment The free continental breakfast- was ok - and kept you going till you could step out and have a decent meal The staff are friendly - but not always helpful. For eg. they charged me 13 $ per day extra from the rate I had booked them on one of the websites - they said they only recognize the rates on their own websites. Also when we were leaving - they said they couldn't call a cab - but we could go outside and hail one. They didn't have a doorman u see - and there was only one person manning the reception Overall - if I have to do a touristy trip to NYC where Times Square is important and I need 2-3 rooms - I might consider it. And would recommend it for those who don't want to pay a fortune to stay so close to Times square

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: SuziQ10566
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! The Hotel at Times Square was conveniently located to all of the Times Square activities. It was safe, clean, and quiet - which you don't always find in NYC. The Staff was very friendly and always accommodating. Registration was quick ,as was the check out. If you are looking to stay in NYC, this is definitely a hotel to choose. As I read some of the negative reviews, I really wondered if we stayed at the same place! All I can say is that you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tideronthehooch
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, which were spot on. Hotel was in a great location as advertised. Room was comfortable if not spacious. Best thing is that the room was also VERY clean. The bar on the second floor was a nice touch with reasonably priced beverages and a friendly bar tender. The continental breakfast was also adequate and the server kept the breakfast area clean and well stocked. Overall, I don't know that my wife and I could have been much more pleased for the price. We would definitely consider this hotel again if we came back to the City and were going to stay in the Times Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Sucked! STAY AWAY...far away!”
Reviews.Author: jharvey22
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, I've seen a number of bad hotels but never found one bad enough on which to write a review....until now. The following says it all: - I had a confirmed reservation that they did not find; they told me they were full and almost kicked me to the curb to find another hotel; unfortunately, they gave me a room - The room had a hint of urine and 409 - The TV AND the wireless connection were not working - The filth in the bathroom is indescribable; hairs in the bathtub, what looked like blood on the ceiling and grime in the corners of near the ceiling Luckily, I was only there for a night...

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel near Time Square”
Reviews.Author: waterdog9119
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in May, 2010. Room was not big, but who wants to stay indoor anyway. Room was very clean and comfortable. Only 2 blocks from Time Square and was very quiet. Will certainly stay there again. Love New York, wish we could have stayed longer. Always felt safe on the street even after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: sudhir_al
Reviews.Content: Their cancellation policy states: "You may cancel your reservation anytime up to 24 hours before arrival which is 3PM EST one day before your scheduled date of arrival. If you do not cancel before this time, your credit card will be charged for one night's stay." They do not seem to make any exception to this policy. My situation was that my daughter started a high temperature on the night before my stay at this hotel. Due to this, I had to reschedule my trip, so that we skip New York, and travel to my relative's home near Boston, where my daughter could rest. I called the hotel reservations desk around midnight, requesting them to make an exception to their cancellation policy. I was asked to speak to the manager the next day. The manager was not able to help us, and charged for one night's stay. All this took a couple of calls, and a few emails. What I found strange was that this was probably the first establishment in my experience which did not offer flexibility with cancellation. I was able to easily cancel my other arrangements in New York - the car rental, and Statue Cruises (which had an even stricter cancellation policy, but were very accommodating when they heard about my daughter's illness).

Reviews.Title: “Absoulely fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: wawa11
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel on May 8-9 2010 with daughter and teenage grandaughter. I have to say that hotel is absolutely fantastic, beds are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in for hotel beds, most of the time they are hard and uncomfortable, these were very comfortable, the room was very very clean. Staff was friendly, we asked for extra ammenties and were given right away. If you go to this hotel, park across the street at Central Park, the hotel will validate your ticket and you will only pay 30.00 per day, this is so convenient to the hotel. If you are looking for a place to eat, right next door is the best Italian restaurant, homemade pasta cooked perfect, great staff. They sang happy birthday to my daughter which she will never forget. The location is fantastic, Times Square is right up the street within walking distance from the hotel. I will be going back to New York and will definetly stay again the THATS

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: AFrial13
Reviews.Content: I chose this place because it had good reviews here and I was not disappointed. My boyfriend and I stayed in a single room. The room and bathroom was clean and although it looks small in the picture, there was a walk-in closet where we put our luggage in. The room looks exactly like the picture and I think considering the location of the hotel (about 2 blocks from Times Square), it's is still cheaper than the surrounding hotels I looked at. The only drawback was the view from our window was not really nice, but it's not like we spent a lot of time looking out! We were out most of the day enjoying the city. I also loved the complimentary breakfast each morning (i.e., bagel, donuts, OJ, coffee, cereal, fruit)! That definitely saves more money for a young couple! Staff was friendly and there was an informational booth in the lobby to help out tourists with tickets and sightseeing tours. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - Great value!”
Reviews.Author: TESS1936
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel in Times Square for the weekend of February 19-21, 2010. For the location of the hotel ( few blocks from Times Square) I couldn't believe the price (should of been double!). Check-in was smooth and employees were very friendly throughout our stay. Rooms were nice but not much of a view but we didn't care as we only wanted the room to sleep. I really enjoyed the heated bathroom floor which turned on when you walk in the bathroom. Free breakfast was awesome and we didn't walk away hungry at all. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel now!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura1004
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my friend, having been to NYC once before was a bit wary of staying in a different hotel but so glad we chose this one, we were on the 10th floor with no noise whatsoever coming in from outside which is unbelievable for NYC! Beds so comfortable exactly what you need after all the shopping and sightseeing. Loved the free breakfast with plenty for everyone and with English teabags too. The location is absolutley spot on literally a 5 min walk to Times Square and Broadway with Central Park, and 5th Avenue also easy walking distance. Can't speak highly enough of this hotel,have already recommended it to others, book your stay now you won't be disappointed can't wait to return here one day!!!

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel near times square”
Reviews.Author: kaz188
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here for 3 nights in mid-April. We requested a room with 2 queen beds and were allocated one on the 11th floor on the back of the hotel so it was quiet at night. However, the room is really only designed for 1 bed so it was very squashy and hard to move around. The windows were opaque so you couldn't see outside to even check if it was raining. Check-in was slow and service was average. We slept in on our first night and we asked the maids to clean our room after we had left but when we came back that night, it wasn't made. It was cleaned half-heartedly on the second and third nights. We saw towels and other litter on the floor even after the room had been "made up". Location-wise, it's 2 blocks away from Times Square and 2 blocks the other way to restaurant row. Free wi fi was handy and there are 2 computers in the lobby you could use for free for 15 minutes if you need to check in and print out boarding passes. Free breakfast was handy and plentiful. Get there before 8-8:30am to avoid the rush. We were satisfied with the hotel as we really only needed a place to rest our weary heads after walking around NY. However, I will probably stay elsewhere next time I'm in NY.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CHOICE!!”
Reviews.Author: malter2010
Reviews.Content: I've been at this hotel for 8 nights, and let me tell you that, having the chance in the past of visiting the city sleeping in other hotels, you can's get a better deal than this one. The hotel is perfect, modern and still gives you that feeling of being home, great breakfast included in the price. The rooms are huge compared to NY standards and soooo clean that you will love it. I even left some stuff by mistake out of my bags a couple of days and nothing happened...just perfect The only thing to point, not to call it a negative thing, is that the staff at the hotel, even though they are polite, they are not AS friendly as one would like, but they do their job pretty nicely, that only thing would do the full experience a 100/100 Don't spend another minute looking, this is your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice! Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyRob2006
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to find a hotel in a good location that was clean and affordable. Hotel at Times Square surpassed our expectations in all areas! What a great place to stay! My friend and I stayed there for three nights last week and we were really pleased with our choice. The hotel is in a great location- just a few minutes away from Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, etc. Our room was extremely clean and was much bigger than I had expected it to be (we had a room with two double beds and we had plenty of space). The complimentary breakfast was a nice bonus- bagels, toast, fruits, etc. We only were able to have breakfast one morning because we were out and about by 7 am for all but one day. We parked our car at Central Parking across the street for $30/day (we saved abuot $60 by staying at HATS- they validated our ticket) and the bellman was nice enough to wheel our luggage right across the street when we were leaving. They accept AAA which was a nice little discount. I would highly recommend this hotel to someone that is looking for a clean and affordable hotel in a great location. In fact, I'm already thinking of coming back in the fall and will be booking at HATS.

Reviews.Title: “great little gem”
Reviews.Author: dixiehellcat
Reviews.Content: My cousin & I went to NY for a girls getaway, & booked Hotel @ Times Square for the price, location, & reviews. It was a wonderful decision! The staff were pleasant and knowledgeable, the free breakfast was tasty, the rooms were the biggest I've seen in a NY hotel, clean, neat and well kept up, nice & quiet for sleeping. Only small negative--the cordless phone handset battery was dead, but we used our cells anyhow. Wifi was slow but worked fine when given a minute or 2. On the whole, a great experience, and we hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: CarolRoyalOak
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a group of five including two children ages 13 and 10. This hotel offered a fantastic location, simple breakfast, clean spacious rooms (by New York standards) and an excellent value. We would rather put our dollars into food, sightseeing, shopping excursions and theatre. When in New York, most of our time is spent exploring the city. This hotel offers a comfortable bed in a very pleasant atmosphere with a congenial staff. I would recommend The Hotel at Times Square to all who are looking for a great place for an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel w/free breakfast and free internet!”
Reviews.Author: Paislylover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with daughter who interviewed for internship. Central location and access to several subways and buses made for ease in travel, while at same time walking distance to theater at night. Room was modern, clean, and comfortable. Lighting was good, which some places you don't get. I asked for a quiet room and it was provided. The staff was friendly, helpful and they even have a concierge who was fantastic. The breakfast was all you could hope for - continental, but included yogurt, bagels and cream cheese, cereal and fruit. Large sitting area for breakfast and a roomy and comfortable lobby with free internet at two computers as well. I have stayed in NYC three times in the past year, all in this price range and given the free breakfast, I think this one is the best value and the nicest I stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dated furnishings, worn linens, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: MitchellSeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for theater going. Easy walk to Times Square and all theaters, restaurants, and Rockefeller Center. Staff however are not friendly with the exception of the bar tender in the 2nd floor bar (very small bar). She was great. Front desk and breakfast room staff were somewhat put out and bothered by the large number of teens there for spring break. The furnishings in the rooms were dated and worn. The bathroom is very small and the door has glass in it limiting privacy. Shower pressure is good and plenty of hot water. Linens were thin, worn, and rough. Breakfast was moderate in quality and the buffet area was not clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: traveling4some
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel, primarily after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. Not having been to NYC before, we weren't sure what to compare it to, but we were quite satisfied. The good points: Friendly enough staff, very clean, nice design and decor, good enough breakfast, great baggage holding area (very nice bellman), great location. Bad points: Our room was on the 11th floor and unfortunately faced the main road, so it was quite noisy at times, but after the first night, we seemed to adapt to this. The room was a little small for the 4 of us, but again we got used to it. Unfortunately , we seemed unable to control the temp. of the room, so we found it quite hot most of the time (even with the windows open). Also, the elevator was a little annoying as it was busy and we didn't always want to walk up the 11 flights, although we did quite often.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: hicksynh
Reviews.Content: Looking at this hotels website I would not have booked it. I am a firm believer in Trip Advisor and after reading lots of great reviews I booked this hotel. I am glad I did. It was clean, safe and worth the money. It was cheaper than most hotels in the Times Square area and it was an easy walk to everywhere. Free breakfast was more than enough to choose from and my friend and I both agree we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills Gem in N.Y!!”
Reviews.Author: nbutler4
Reviews.Content: If like me you read the reviews on Tripadvisor before you book a hotel, the reviews on this one were spot on. It's a budget hotel and the price should tell you that. But what you get is an exceptionally clean, comfortable hotel in what is arguably one of the best locations in N.Y. Literally 3 minutes walk from Times Square, the room we had had 2 queen beds on the 13th floor. Nice extras like free wi-fi in the room and free calls within the U.S are unusual in this price range. Continental breakfast is thrown in which is basic (cereal, toast your own bagel etc) but adequate. My only gripe is that the staff weren't overtly friendly and the female concierge had to be interrupted twice from her personal phone calls to provide service! Other than that if you can get the room at a decent rate (we paid $130 per night for the room) you won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere wonderfully affordable in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: girlonabudget3232
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel to stay is usually the Crowne Plaza in Times Square, so I was somewhat leary to stay here. However, I was so pleasantly surprised and would stay here again and again. Two blocks over from Times Square and two blocks down from Rockefeller Plaza. I also stumbled on Times Square Hot Bagels, West 44th ST., the side street next to Hard Rock Cafe, the bagels are amazing there. Right next to the bagel shop is Starlite Deli, the sandwiches are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: kas926
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel At Times Square from 3/25-3/28. We came to see the sights and celebrate our daughter's birthday. The hotel was excellent! The check in took about 5 minutes and the hotel staff was very nice. One of the hotel workers named Ramsford (I think!) was extremely helpful and personable. Our hotel room was on the 12th floor and was extremely quiet. Everything was modern and new. The queen beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was spotless! I can't tell you how convenient this hotel was to everything! It was 2 blocks to the American Girl Store, 2 blocks to Times Square and 3 blocks to Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral. We were able to walk everywhere! Now on to the breakfast. It was great too! We are not huge breakfast people but needed something to start our day. There were bagels, doughnuts, juice, coffee, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal and cold cereal. It was so nice to have this included in the price of our room and not have to travel outside of our hotel to get something to eat. We ate at around 8:30-9:00 am and never had a problem finding a spot to eat in the breakfast room. The free wi-fi was an added bonus. We were able to look up restaurants online and then call for reservations/wait times. We have stayed in other NYC hotels before, but for the price and ammenties as well as the location, this was so much better! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great prices”
Reviews.Author: BoingyBaxter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel @ Times Square this weekend (March 19-22, 2010). The hotel has been completely remodeled last year. Here's what I liked: Newly re-modeled clean rooms, large plasma TV, clean new bathroom, free local calls anywhere in the USA, free wi-fi in rooms. The lobby is a nice place to meet friends and has two free internet computers for your use. Breakfast from 7 to 10 am is free and has a nice selection of yogurt, bagels with cream cheese, coffee, orange juice, apples, bananas, cerials, etc. Eat in the breakfast room or load up a plate and take it to your room. With AAA card expect to pay less than $125. per night. Friendly staff etc. However, double confirm your reservation. They have a problem with confirming reservations. My business associate had a reservation and arrived late and they gave his room away. Also I had a reservation at another hotel in the same chain (Apple Core Hotels) and wanted to cancel that reservation and re-confirm my reservation at the Hotel @ TImes Square. I phoned the 800 number and of course they cancelled both reservations - not what I wanted. All's well that ends well, as the reservation at Hotel @ Times Square was finally OK. But I called the hotel directly to make sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: rosebud4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well located. The room and the bathroom were a little small but the price and the location made up for it. The breakfast was OK. However about 3 doors down (away from time square) is a great little resturant. The food was excellent and the price was inexpensive...not something that you can always say in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Times Square/Broadway gem”
Reviews.Author: Rob Mossack
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe...only about 5 blocks from Times Square for LESS than $125/night (included AAA discount)!! This is a great little hotel with fine service, convenient location, clean rooms, and more than adequate amenities for the price! A continental breakfast (fruit, bagels, juice, coffee, donuts, cereal--- all of the regulars) is included--served until 10 am, and a small workout room (4 treadmills, a bike, and a stairstepper) is downstairs. The staff was extremely helpful--- were most accommodating when it came to keeping our room for the final night . I had originally booked 3 nights, and when I decided to book a fourth, they were sold out on the queen rooms, and I had to book a double/double for the fourth night. But when I asked about just being able to stay in our original room, they very cordially worked it out for us (the rate was a little higher for the last night, because I booked it at a later date). The rooms are small, but it's NYC...and that's the way things are. The room was immaculately cleaned each day, and was very comfortable. Great water pressure in the shower, too! The free wireless internet access is a nice bonus! Along with that, they have a couple of desktops set up downstairs w/printers that allow you to print your boarding passes before heading to the airport. No doubt, we will plan to stay here on return visits!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice place, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: ashez_ap
Reviews.Content: We had the BEST visit to New York. This Hotel is in an incredible location for its price. We paid roughly $135 a night and were two blocks from rockefeller center and around two blocks from all the hub bub of times square and the theatre district. I searched and searched and couldn't find anything mildly comparable to this anywhere else in Manhattan. The staff while not overly friendly is still easy to deal with and will answer your questions and concerns to the best of their ability. The lady who works at the concierge desk was sweet and very helpful. What is so great about this hotel is that it is a really nice place in an incredible and safe location. Everything is very accessible from this area of midtown and the theatres were only aquick walk away which made a quick stop at the hotel to freshen up before a show very easy. The room was a little small but much nicer than I expected... very classy upscale look but a tiny fraction of the price. My only compaint is that there are not many high quality restraunts very close. Take my advice and walk the four or five blocks past the theatre district and into hells kitchen/restaurant row and you will find tons of excellent places that are not too high in price. Also, the put a holding charge on your card when you arrive. when you check out the price is refunded to you card and then recharged... it has taken several days to go back to the card so just be prepared for that! .... I found that a little annoying. Overall I hada great stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh, don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: i_love_cupcakes
Reviews.Content: I have never had an experience so horrible that I have had to write a review! Upon arriving they lost my reservation and after showing the confirmation email they still did not believe me. After they made a call they "found" my reservation. Since we were early we asked to hold our bags but they said that the room would be ready shortly so wait in the reception and they would come get us. They never did so a half hour later I inquired and our room was ready. Upon getting into the room the bathroom smelled horrible, reeking of urine! We figured it was the alley way that the window was opened to so we closed the window and went out for the afternoon. Upon arriving home the stench was still there...so bad that when I got up to use the bathroom at night I would gag. We checked out the next morning a I proceeded to file a complaint since I felt the service was horrible and the condition of the room was horrible. In the response email I was insulted, called a man (I don't have a unisex name) and told I shouldn't have tried to check in early - which I did not - I wanted to hold my bags, a service the hotel says they have. So, unless you want to sleep in a closet that smells like a college frat house the morning after a frat party where everyone urinated all over everything, don't do it. I booked through AAA so I thought I would have been fine, I guess I learned my lesson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jacqui83Leeds
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on it's price and the previous guests' reviews. It's always a risk picking a hotel in such a big city but this one proved to be a good bet. Despite being called The Hotel @ Times Square it's not actually located on Times Square - this however was not a problem as it was only about two blocks from Broadway (it seems to be common practice to name things like this in NYC). The hotel was really easy to find when we got off the Subway and the walk from Broadway to the hotel felt safe (as far as possible in such a large city!) The hotel staff were helpful and check-in was quick and easy. The hotel were also able to store our luggage on check-out until we were due to go to the airport. Our room was on the 3rd floor which meant we had a lovely view of an outside stairwell and the side of the building next door which was a bit dispointing but to be honest we didn't spend enough time in the room for it be a problem. The room was a good size considering it was right in the heart of the city. It was nicely decorated and had a big flat screen TV and plenty of space for our luggage (a walk in wardrobe). The bathroom was a bit small (but not to the point of inconvenience) and the only strange thing was that the bathroom door was made of frosted glass! Not a problem if you're with your partner or very close firend but may be an issue for some people. The room came with breakfast which is unusual in NYC hotels (from what we found during booking) and so we weren't expecting much. We were therefore surprised to find a very generous spread of toast, a variety of bagels, cereals, doughnuts (god bless America!) and plenty of fruit juice, tea and coffee. The breakfast room was large and spacious and you could either watch the local news on TV or read a complimentary copy of USA Today. There is also a directory in the room that has plenty of suggestions for diners for breakfast if you want more of a typical American breakfast - we recomend the Red Flame Diner round the corner for pancakes! The reception area of the hotel was very well presented and there appeared to be computers availbale for guests to use however we did not make use of these facilities. There is also a fitness centre in the hotel which we didn't use either. My only negative comment about this hotel is that my GHD straighteners didn't work! I think this may be to do with the electricity supply in America in general and the hotel obviously has restrictions in place to stop fuses blowing etc. They did however provide a reasonably powerful hairdryer in the bathroom and other electrical apliances worked fine (ie phone/camera charger, own hairdryer). Overall we would recomend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC for a short sight-seeing trip as it has everything you would need and is in a brilliant location and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: evertonian7
Reviews.Content: my wife and end stayed at the hotel for 5 nights at the end of february.On check in staff were efficient but could do with being more friendly although given welcome pack of toothpaste,razor and headache tablets.our room was on the 6th floor whilst it did not have any views the room was ample in size and had all that you need,wel stocked with towels and soap and shower gels.only thing that let room down was it gets hot due to pipes in the walls able to cool it down with the air con,although being hot allowed wet clothing from the snow and rain to dry quite quickly in the bathroom.breakfast was good a good selection of baggels,donuts,cereals,yoghuts and fruit plus daily newspaper to start your day. the hotel and the room were very clean and whilst not on times square was only a short walk away.on checking out staff efficent but need to be a bit more people friendly.ordered a taxi via the hotel back to airport only $5 dollars more than yellow cab thought we were getting a town car what we got was a stretch limo which was a nice end to our trip.would definitely stay there again.only gripe was noisy guests who come back late at night and choose to wake those sleeping up,but you get that were ever you go

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Valquiria
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights. The location is great. It is near Times Square and Rockfeller center. The price/ quality is very good. The rooms are small, but very clean and they have everthinfg you need. The breakfast was ok, but the dishes and cutlery not. They were plastic which is not practical to cut the food. The staff was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: frequent-flyer76
Reviews.Content: Only stayed in this hotel for one night unfortunately. Its a lovely hotel, very clean, great decor. Really friendly staff. Comfortable rooms. Free internet access for guests. On West 46th St., great location for Times Square and Fifth Avenue. Would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, fantastic location, pity about Ashok on reception”
Reviews.Author: innes77
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night trip to New York with my parents and a stay at the 'hotel at times square'. Having read the reviews on tripadviser I chose this hotel as the reviews were generally good and the price we found on hotels.com was very good for New York. First impressions were very good, a nice lobby area and a fairly seemless check in process. I had previously contacted the hotel to request adjacent rooms and this was granted, we were located on the 12th floor. Both rooms were a good size and contained a nice big comfortable bed, plasma TV, Radio Alarm which you could dock an Ipod into and a clean bathroom, I could have no complaints about the bedrooms. My parents had a small problem with the bath plug which they reported to reception in the morning, the plug was replaced and fixed by the time they returned later in the day. The only negative point of the whole visit to the hotel at times square was the checkout process, as mentioned previously we booked via hotels.com at a nightly rate of $123, when we checked out the guy behind reception tried to charge us $135 and told us that this was the correct rate (this is despite showing him a copy of the confirmation from hotels.com). After about 20 mins of discussion and phone calls our bill was amended. Throughtout the whole process the guy (his name was Ashok) showed no commen sense or customer service and was quite frankly not interested in helping us, we appeared to be a problem rather than a guest at the hotel. I noticed a another guest earlier checking out who appeared to have a similar problem, I would incourage future guests to check the nightly tariff when you check in to avoid any problems when checking out. To summarise this is a nice little hotel in a fantastic location, nice clean rooms and a bar where you can grab a beer for $3! Only negative thing I can comment on is the dreadful service that Ashok provided during checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service i've ever had anywhere”
Reviews.Author: mkokai
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews i was quite excited about staying at this hotel. It looked clean (which it was) and the free breakfast and wi-fi was a plus. But that's where it ended. The room was on the 10th floor right outside an elevator, and right next to a door in the corridor that separated the rooms and the staircase. This door was supposed to be on a spring but it obviously wasn't working so the door would slam LOUDLY every time someone entered or exited. As soon as i walked into the room it was boiling hot so i opened the 2 windows and turned the heat off (at about 6pm). It never got any cooler in the room, so at 5am we called reception to tell them about the problem. They said they would send someone up. Half an hour later we get a call with them telling us there's no one able to come up, so we ask if we can change to a different room and were told there were no more rooms. So after having a sleepless nights sleep we go downstairs at 10am and ask again for a different room. We are shown a room on the 12th floor and that was fine except we had somewhere to be that morning and couldn't move our luggage then, and told them we'd be back later to move our things. When we arrived back a few hours later they had given away the room and only had rooms in the smoking wing which smelt awful, and we refused. The only thing they could offer us is to pay $50 extra per night for a suite, which was ridiculous! Throughout this whole experience not one staff member apologized or tried to rectify the situation with any sort of caring or empathy. We stayed 1 more night in that room (which also had terrible street noise even 10 floors up!) and checked out after only 2 nights. DO NOT let them give you room 1007!!!! We moved a few blocks away to the brand new Distrikt Hotel on 40th and the service here is amazing! They even called about 5 minutes after arriving in the room to make sure everything was okay. We are paying the same amount ($150 per night) for a hotel that actually offers service along with the room!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: gyan2004
Reviews.Content: The hotel at times square is a no frills place and we loved it because of its location, just two blocks away from times square. The hotel didnt even have a restaurant as one has all the eating joints around it .It serves you a complimentary continental breakfast :)
