Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: etiquettediva
Reviews.Content: I use to live in NYC; now travel there frequently with groups of teens and moms. This time I traveled with 11 in our party. From check in to check out, this staff accommodated us. We were given rooms next to each other, which never happens! Two of our rooms were very spacious. I couldn't believe it. Ask for rooms in the halls, not back in the alcoves; although, they aren't terrible, just small. The rate was shockingly low for the city. It is in walking distance to both Grand Central and Times Square and many tourist attractions. For those looking for a great restaurant near by, dine at Ruby Foos, Chinese/Japanese Fusion! So good. Unless you are set on luxury, I highly recommend this hotel when visiting the greatest city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: 0u812Glasgow
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and location.Rooms clean,flat screen TV and in room safe and bigger than expected.We stayed in 1 queen bed room and there was plenty of room for 2 people.All staff were friendly and more than willing to help and are a credit to the hotel.Continental breakfast is included in the price from a self service buffet area on the ground floor which sets you up for the day.There is a fantastic little bar on the 2nd floor which must have the cheapest prices in NYC($3 for drafts) and very welcoming staff.We loved it here and will definately return on our next visit.We loved the location,very clean and felt very safe during our stay.Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.A big thanks to all at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBackpack
Reviews.Content: Been there during New Year's Eve (2009 - 2010).The Hotel is very clean and has a great location. The heater worked adequately. Safe and minifridge in the room. The room itself is not very spacious (well, this is NYC !). Wireless connection very efficient. Check in and out was very fast, no hassles. Overall, very recommended if you want a clean, mid-range hotel near Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BAYOGM
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when we arrive to the Hotel@Times Square, it was much better than we expected. Nice rooms, clean, spacious, a confortable bed. The bathroom was also clean. Bfrakefast was OK, baggels, donuts, fruit, cereal, etc. WI-FI not to good. A PERFECT UBICATION: 1/2 block to 5th Ave., 1 1/2 block to Times Square, 4 blocks to the ROCK. In a few words, YOU'LL RECIVE MORE THAN WHAT YOU PAY FOR.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDJ99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights over new years eve and really enjoyed our stay. At first we were allocated a room at the front of the hotel but could tell it was going to be noisy as soon as we walked in with cars beeping their horns from the street below. So we went back down to the lobby and changed to a room at the back of the hotel. This room was maybe a bit smaller and had no natural light but was super quiet. We only got woken up once by some rude person continually banging their door opposite ours early one morning. The location is great and the breakfast was ok - it consisted of bagels, bread, cereal, oats, yoghurt as well as apples and bananas. We got sick of it after 8 days though! Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really, Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: ncguys
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent four nights at The Hotel at Times Square around the weekend before Christmas. We're used to doing Priceline and staying in 4-star hotels when we go to the City but wanted to try this Hotel after reading so many good things about it and be able to cancel if we needed to. It was a really good experience. The room was huge (for New York), the breakfast was just fine, the free wi-fi was perfectly serviceable and the big bathroom had a window with natural light! Excellent location for the theatre, shopping on Fifth Avenue and for dining (ate at two restaurants right on 46th-both just steps away). The difference between a 4-star and this hotel was that the windows were dirty on the outside. For the price difference I could live with that. We got the AAA discount which put it at under $150 a night for a king size bed. Not sure how the price is other times of year but this was well below what we were finding elsewhere for that weekend. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: juicee1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel @ times square for a 4 day break with my partner and couldn't say a bad word about the place. after reading some of the comments on tripadvisor i wasn't expecting much but i was hughly suprised. our room was HUGH everything we could have asked for. the room was so clean and really new. it was cleaned everyday new towels etc. also the continential breakfast was amazing all we need to start the day. yogurts, fresh fruit, bagels donuts, tea, coffee etc. all together i would recommend this hotel to anyone. also it is only 1 block from times square walking distance to everything

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: shivymc1
Reviews.Content: This is definatly a great hotel,perfect location right next to everything,would definatly recommend it to everyone....we were there for new years eve and the price for the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! Could not have been more satisfied”
Reviews.Author: kjn197
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. The location was great, just a block away from times square, close to radio city music hall, top of the rock, etc... I was concerned about cleanliness and size of rooms in manhatten but the room was plenty big enough, the bed was soooo comfortable and the housekeeping was great. The staff is so friendly and helpful -check in staff (I wish I could remember the young guy's name - so helpful), the breakfast is fine for continential breakfast - large room, juice, yogurt, coffee, bagels, donuts, oatmeal, cereal.....not too busy at 7:30-8am. The lobby is great with 2 computers with internet access that were usually available when we needed them and a lot of space to lounge or sit at the table. Fitness center is small - only a couple machines but certainly acceptable. We were able to leave all of our bags locked up after checking out of the hotel for the remainder of the day which was great. great mp3 alarm clock. Some travel tips - the wait for the empire state building and sky ride was ridiculous - Top of the rock was much quicker with just as good a view. Cool restruant for the kids called mars 2112 - simulation space ride which opens up to "mars like" dining area with aliens, game room, etc...lots of fun with the kids. Recommend getting the New York pass which gets you into alot of attractions (can also reserve tickets to attractions like the NBC studio tour , radio city a day ahead to use once the pass has expired to take advantage of an extra days worth of attractions) easy subway directions to area attractions on www.hopstop.com. I will definetly return to this hotel when I get back to NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Found a Gem”
Reviews.Author: GeauxSam
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was good. NYC rooms are notorious for being small and while this one wasn't huge, it is fine for 3-4 people. the bar on the second floor was a great convenience. The free breakfast was good and the dining room is very large. This hotel is so convenient and you could tell that is had just been renovated. The staff mentioned that they are about to implement a guest services card so that you can earn points at the owners have 5-6 hotels in the NYC area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location. I will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jiminlsewi
Reviews.Content: This is a very convienient hotel to the theatre district and around the corner from Radio City. This is an older hotel that has been completely refurbished to a great hotel. The room was bigger than expected for a New York Hotel. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The furnishings are all new and tastefully done. This hotel also has a continental breakfast which is unusual in New York. It was the usual bread, cereal, bagels, juice, Yougart, and coffee but was more than adaquate. Easy walk to most of the Theatres. Free internet in the room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: j_kis
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel over the weekend with 3 girl friends. The hotel is in an amazing location. Subway is around the corner, Time Square is one block up and Rockefeller Center is a few of blocks away. I booked my room directly through the hotel websit and got a double room for 4 people for less than $200 per night. You can't beat that price in Midtown. The hotel is clean and the staff is kind and courteous. We didn't know that you had to request a fridge prior to check-in if you wanted one in your room and we hadn't. We called the front desk and in less than 10 minutes the fridge was brought up. We had an issue with the toilet too and again in less than 5 minutes, the maintenance man was in our room with the plunger and the problem was solved. The free breakfast was nothing spectacular but good, fresh and basic enough to satisfy you; donuts, bagels, cereal, yogurt and toast. Although the coffee was a little weak. But it was free so no complaints. You also get free internet in your room and discount parking with a parking lot one block away. Our SUV only cost $26 per day instead of $45 per day. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kknack
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice since it was remodeled recently. Rooms were good size for NY, although some barely have a window (ours faced an enclosed area). We got an excellent rate online for two weekend nights, and for the price couldn't have been better. The front desk is slow, they only seem to ever have one person there even during checkout time daily. No frills (on-site parking, bellhop, etc), but they do have free PCs in the lobby with laser printers, and a very cheap (and small) bar on the second floor. Overall considering some of the unique challenges with hotels in NY, it was a tremendous value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Great location...Great Value....Clean Modern Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTravelerZ
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough nice things about this hotel. This is the first time I've ever left a review and we used Trip Advisor to rate this hotel. Everything was great here. The staff, the room, the location. There was a bar in the hotel. I would highly recommend this place...especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get room 210”
Reviews.Author: jonnypez
Reviews.Content: The damn bar is right next to room 210 (which is the room I was given). It is a horrible design and they leave the door open at night and the noise echoes in the room. I requested a different room and they rudely informed me that there were no other rooms available. I asked multiple times for them to tell the bar to close their door and turn down the music...which they didn't do. It was two nights of disappointment. I will never stay at this hotel again! If they give you room 210, then tell them to change your room to a different floor...better yet, avoid this hotel altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, good value”
Reviews.Author: MQ007
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 10th floor, facing 46th St which allowed us to see other buildings at night. There were some rooms that faced inward to a courtyard (and other rooms on the other side of the courtyard) and we spied one without a window (walking past when the maid was cleaning it) and that would have been a bit unappealing so you might like to do as we did and ask for a room for a view when you make your booking. Our view was nothing special - just looking at other buildings, as you do in a big city - but it was more interesting to spy on people in their offices than stare at other tourists staring at you... ;-) Breakfast was very filling - three types of cereal + oatmeal, plain and fruit bagels, yoghurt, and donuts. Yum, donuts. I love donuts. I recommend not staying there at the same time as me or you might miss out on donuts because I love 'em! Actually, nobody ever missed out on donuts (that I saw) because when the tray of donuts was empty, the guy would just bring out a new tray of donuts! The business centre consists of two computers, each with a printer. They were free to use but quite popular and I often saw people waiting to use them. If you've got your own laptop and don't need to print, take it and use the free wifi in your room. There was only one issue we had with the room which was easily fixed - it was too hot. There's a heater in each room but we never turned ours on because the hot water pipes in the wall threw out enough heat anyway. It seemed to be related to whether the people above us were using their heater, we think. Sometimes the pipes were filled with hot water and it heated up our heater unit as a result. We just opened the window (which have stickers saying "don't open the window" but we didn't care. We didn't bother telling management about it but might have if we'd been in a room without a window to regulate the temperature. The hotel is less than 40 seconds walk to the subway station which has the B, D, F, and V lines running through it. We arrived from JFK and took the AirTrain to Howard Beach Station, then the subway to W 4th St and changed to an uptown D train and emerged from the subway station virtually at the hotel so it was quite easy to manage. The street has a number of restaurants of varying international flavour (Brazilian, Italian, Mexican, etc). The Italian restaurant beside the hotel (just on the other side of the construction zone) was reasonably priced with good food and worth a look. We were able to walk to anything easily - Times Square, Empire State Building, etc. Originally we were tossing up between this hotel and one in the United Nations building. The latter offered views of the city and that did sound appealing. In hindsight, we chose the better hotel because we were then *in* the city where the action was, rather than just looking at lights. If you're going to stay in Manhattan, you might as well try to get nice and close to the action and that's all focussed around Times Square in the evenings (~2 mins walk)

Reviews.Title: “noisy heaters, not clean, very no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: rexwilson
Reviews.Content: i suppose if you are only interested in saving money, this place is adequate, and probably a step above some of the really sleazy hotels in NY. It did the job and the bed was comfortable, the furnishings and fixtures in the room and bathroom were in good shape, and i always enjoy free wifi, but the pipes clanked in the heater all night, and the place wasn't all that clean, especially in the hallways and elevators. The building feels dingy, feels like it's in an old warehouse, cramped corridors, no lobby to speak of, not much service of any kind. The "fitness center" is 3 pieces of old cardio equipment crammed into a basement closet with no windows and poor ventilation. I asked at the front desk if there was a nearby full service gym that guests had access to, and they didn't have a clue (and referred me to two other people at the hotel who also had no idea... didn't seem like that obscure a question).

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased! Very Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: CAW2008
Reviews.Content: Just went with my husband for the weekend! Hotel is conveniently located just around the corner from the Subway station! and two blocks from Rockefeller Center. ROOM: Small But very comfortable Cordless Phone, Desk, Nice size flat screen tv, nice furniture, Cool Bedside Lamps AND an IHOME docking station (just like being at home) ---- THE BED--- was soooo comfortable - After a long day of experiencing the city you get to enjoy nice comfy bed. We had a king size == Bathroom- Small - No fan, and the tub is really small, wasn't cleaned to my standards but this is the only complaint that I have. You also have to step up into the bathroom which is odd.. We had no interaction with the staff outside of checking in and that was pleasant (they let us check in early) I would stay there again - close to everything, but not the noise of the main drag...

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant Thanksgiving surprise!”
Reviews.Author: 1nailtech
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the Thanksgiving holiday and was not only very surprised but very pleased! All hotel accomodations were great. My room had a very comfortable king bed & I slept like a baby! Continental breakfast was great! Hotel bar was great! I'll be staying at this hotel again! Location! ws fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smaudrey
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Macy's Parade and selected this hotel based on the fact that it was the best deal we could find. That should be your selection criteria too. If you are looking for a clean, simple room, this is it. My husband and I have have stayed in every hotel price range imaginable, but for this trip, we were trying to stay on the cheap, as we knew we would never be in the room. The room was clean and small. All NYC hotels are small, so brace yourself. Beds were comfy and bathrooms clean. Lobby area was nice and they provide a complimentary breakfast of coffee, juice, bagels, and do-nuts. The location is great for exploring and the subway is around the corner and down one block. My only complaint is that our AC banged and roared all night (EVEN WHEN OFF, yes, I know, but it's true). I did let the front desk know, and while he was polite, nothing was fixed. Other than the strange window unti banging, we never heard our neighbors or the street. The staff was polite, but older and not exactly "hip" on cool places to eat or have a drink. You are on your own for that advice. I would probably not stay here again, only because I am personally not a fan of the neighborhood or being that close to Times Square, but for many visitors, the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: traveler1ct42
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick trip to NYC to see the Macy's parade. The Hotel at Times Square was clean, quiet, nicely furnished, and so convenient to Grand Central and many sites. We stayed in the family suite on the 12th floor and it was spacious, clean, and quiet. We booked through AAA and the price was right. We would definitely stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: RobertaL
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat, walking distance to Times Square/theatre district. The hotel was clean and room was nicely furnished. Staff at front desk are professional and accommodating (Geovanna is especially informative and friendly). Definitely will stay there again! A moderately priced hotel in the middle of Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: tcar1865
Reviews.Content: Stayed in The Hotel at Times Square fo 8 nights with my wife, we found it to be excellent value for money, room was large and with huge bed. There was some traffic noise from street at night but this New York, room was on 7th floor and overlooked a small memorial garden. The Hotel has been renovated recently and certainly looks clean and modern, Breakfast was included and this consisted of cereals, bagels and bread to toast with fruit and yoghurt a fine start to day. The area around Hotel has loads of Restauants and Bars and is only 200yards from center of Times Square. Would recomend this Hotel and would Stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, moderate price, best for family trips”
Reviews.Author: DominiqueBelgium
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in this Hotel on our (re-)discovery trip to NYC. Appreciated the location, the service, the business centre, friendliness of the staff. All this for a moderate price, so you can .... spend your dollars elsewhere. Best proof : a full house! Recommend it for tourism and private/family trips.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LisaSAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days while holidaying for 4 weeks around the US. We stayed here last when it was the super 8. There have been a few upgrades since then and the price is still around the same. I think it may be due to the construction next door. The noise from this starts at 7am every week day so be prepared to wake up early! Other than the noise which will finish one day the hotel is great. It is in a great location and although the rooms are small they have everything you need. We weren't there to sit in our room so it was more than adequate and the bed was quite comfy. I found the free wi-fi a bit patchy but we were on the top floor so this may have had something to do with it. The breakfast room has been extended since our last stay and there was plenty of room for everyone to sit and eat. You can't beat this place for its location, between 5th and 6th Ave and so close to Times Square and a short walk to Central Park. It was a great base for us to explore the city from.

Reviews.Title: “great location and price, shame the reception desk staff were surly”
Reviews.Author: mickysydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by friends and is in a great location, easy walking distance to Times Square and the upper east side. The continental breakfast was fine and the man working in the breakfast room was very pleasant and helpful. We booked a king size room and it was large (not small at all). Be careful if booking via their website - there is a system glitch that books 2 rooms when you book a room. When we arrived at the hotel the front desk man was quite rude about it and made us feel very uncomfortable and that we were at fault. We know that this also happened to at least one other couple while we were there - so it appears that it is their website. If they don't fix their website I recommend that you confirm your booking prior to arrival rather than suffer the grief when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Location for a Deal”
Reviews.Author: LittleRaven
Reviews.Content: Not right on Times Square but very close. Between 6th and 5th Avenue (Times Square is where Broadway crosses 7th Avenue). I was in Nw York for three days to see four plays. Three of the theaters were only an easy 15 minute walk from the hotel. The fourth was a 20 block walk up Broadway to Lincoln Center. This is the first time I was ever in New York without using the subway. The real surprise was the quality of the hotel for the price. I paid $189 a night, which included AARP discount and all the taxes ($27.40). All of the pictures on their web site are accurate. I had a single room which was large with plenty of closet and drawer space and a desk and two chairs. I was on the 9th floor and could even look out half of my window and see the street below and the sky above. Wallpaper and drapes looked new. Bathroom was large and bright and new-looking

Reviews.Title: “Although room was small met all our needs and can't beat location for the price.”
Reviews.Author: ac13Toronto
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect. Couldn't believe my eyes when I realized that we were only 1 block away from Times Square. Although hotel is not fancy, it met all our needs. It was clean and beds were comfortable. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Even the breakfast was adequate to get our day started. Can't beat the price for where the hotel is located. I was there with my 2 adult daughters and never feared walking alone at night. My daughters are planning to go back with their families around Christmas. Was even able to print my boarding passes in the business centre. Usually there is no paper available for printing.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible: No refund even after explaining my son was discovered a terminal disease”
Reviews.Author: RockyRacoon1
Reviews.Content: Not 24 hours before, as their policy states, but 20 hours before, we called to cancel a reservation, because our child had been diagnosed a terminal disease just hours before, on that same Friday. We had a reservation for Saturday. This was the answer from the manager, when I requested a refund, with a doctor's letter: ------------- Dear Mr. , I am very sorry for the delay on the request below but we can not credit the no-show charges because our room was left vacant & clean as we had held the room in good faith. Sorry again ------------- I will not only never go there, but make every effort possible to damage their image, because they don't deserve to be in business. I'm a frequent traveller and have cancelled reservations before, with less important excuses, and never had a response like this. If you want to give these kind of people a job, know what business you're throwing your money into.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: lockie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start and end of our trip to NYC, New England and Canada and decided on this hotel based on good TA reviews. Well I can confirm the positive reviews. This hotel is all that you need for NYC. It's very well located being close to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre and the subway. The first room we had was at the back of the hotel and had no view but it was quiet. The room was small and it was difficult to open all our suitcases - wifey has a suitcase that is in two halves so it needs the floor space of an average billard table to be able to open it. If you stand the suitcase up it doubles as a walk-in-robe! The decor is very tastefully done as was pointed out by wifey who knows about these things. I just wanted to know how many cable channels there were. The tariff is very reasonable (for NYC) and is value for money. I knew I had done well when the rest of the the people staying there were modest tourist types like ourselves with not a business man to be seen - not even one trying to save on his travel allowance. Also not much English was being spoken and it sounded like some Eastern European languages which had me wondering how they got the word about this hotel. The breakfast is included and is well run. On return to NYC we stayed in the front of the hotel in a much larger room and it had a good view of the small park opposite. Make sure you ask for a non-smoking room as they have both. My only gripe. The lift (elevator) at the back makes a pinging noise on every floor and in the lift (elevator) you feel like you are in a German U-Boat being pinged by a Royal Navy destroyer. How about killing that pinger?

Reviews.Title: “Super stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: sfgc
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using Tripadvisor due to location and good reviews. In a city of spectacularly rude people this hotel has miraculously found a set of very friendly, efficient, eager to please staff. Rooms were good sized and clean, breakfast was fine and started the day off well. Great location, only a couple of minutes walk to Times Square but in a (relatively) quiet street. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Third time's the charm!”
Reviews.Author: Julie237
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at this hotel since 2006. It is no longer the Super 8, and I was pleasantly surprised and delighted to see the extensive renovations the new management has accomplished. Our room was very nice and sufficient for its purpose. All staff were kind and considerate. I wish the continental breakfast area (updated decor with plenty of space) was open earlier than 7 am, but aside from that, it is a great value!!!! Very good bagels :) I gladly tipped the attendant as he is the hardest working guy in that breakfast room, as well as courteous. I definitely will book this hotel again. Location is a plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: kjmmhuff
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at the Hotel at Times Square again. I loved the location. It was a very nice room for the price. The room was nicely decorated and was very clean. You can't beat the price. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to be in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: Lovediscounts
Reviews.Content: On-line booking and fearing the unknown is quite stressful when it comes to spending money these days. We went to this place on a recommendation based on its prior name and location. It's been newly renovated. WE WERE PLEASANTLY SURPRISED! What a great place! We booked a 2-room family suite on the 10th floor. Perfect location with all of the basic needs. What a great time we had on the long weekend. We saws the sites and walked almost 9 miles in total that weekend. It was a great time had by all of us. Staff was friendly, continental breakfast was sufficient, and seeing the glow of Time Square steps away was just far enough to sleep peacefully at night. Look no further in the haystack of hotels. This was a great little place to stay. AAA discount, as well. Discount parking available just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dookie10
Reviews.Content: We cannot recommend anyone stays at this hotel, unless you want to wake up in the middle of the night to find a large rat rummaging through your luggage and then chasing you round the room as it tried to escape. The good news is though that the hotel advise they have now employed an exterminator service to help try and control the situation. Happy hunting, we shall not be back to check on the progress.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel! Book It Now!”
Reviews.Author: Trevvyj
Reviews.Content: After Months of Searching for a reasonably priced Hotel near Times Square we settled for this one. Very good Price - Easy to Book online even got emailed reminders before our trip. We arrived via Carmel Cars (Highly recommended) [--] or book online - $57 from Newark. Arriving at 1pm we were given the Cards to our room staright away on the 3rd floor. The room was a KING room and the Bed was massive - The room was absolutely spotless it had a desk with 40" Plasma with many channels to choose from - There was a safe which was at no extra charge and an Iron and ironing board. Bathroom was great - Shower was Super - also had an alarm clock in the bedroom with an ipod dock. turning left out of the Hotel it was just a 3 minute walk to 5th Avenue Turning right it was 5 minute (if that) walk to Times Square. Very Safe at night to walk all the street round here. Breakfast was from 7.30am - 10am was never completely full and got seats no problem - Breakfast consisted of Yoghurts, Doughnuts (Great selection) Cornflakes, Frosties, Bran Flakes, Bread & Bagels (Toaster was there for these) Jam, Cheese, Butter, Bananas, Apples, Orange Juice, tea, Coffee - was an excellent start for your day. There was free use of the 2 computers in the Reception Lounge Printeres were available next to them too. Also free wi-fi throughout the Building so bring your laptop - its good to book Broadway shows via Broadwaybox.xom via the internet and collect ticket at the theatre saving upto 50% - you could queue at TKTS in time square but you'll be there for ages!. We checked out of the Hotel at 12 o,clock and our bags were stored without problem until later in the afternoon. I searched for ages for a decent Hotel and I am very fussy - Here you will get Great value for money and a super Base for staying in the Heart of New York.!! Book it now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: awBelgium
Reviews.Content: My daughter (24) and I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel on Oct. 7, 2009 and were very pleased. Nice lobby, very clean room with VERY good mattresses, bathroom well equipped. Very adequate breakfast. Location is just perfect - very centrally and not too noisy (which is hard to find in NYC). Can certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and nice people.”
Reviews.Author: Miguel C
Reviews.Content: The location is really excelent, even if you hanven´t been to New York before. Just 2 minute walk to Times Square and one minute walk to Fifth Avenue. The rooms are smal, especially the double, but have good TV, clean bathroom and great bed. The people at the hotel are very nice and honest. Great stay - if I return to NY I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good value”
Reviews.Author: junebug768
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were just staying one night in New York while we went to the US Open. The hotel was convenient to the subway, which took us directly to Flushing Meadows. It seems to be pretty well located if going to Broadway or other sight seeing adventures. There was only one reception clerk at check in time and there was a line. It went slowly, primarily because one of the guests had a problem. The clerk seemed a little flustered, but remained professional. The room was clean and newly remodeled. It was very loud outside, starting at 5am. The shower head was heavenly. Very adequate continental breakfast provided. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, highly reccommended!”
Reviews.Author: PR4
Reviews.Content: We had great service the whole 2 days we were there. Front desk people were very nice. We were able to buy tour bus tickets at hotel from very helpful and patient lady at service desk. Included basic breakfast of bagels, cereal and doughnuts. We had two rooms and both were very clean and not as small as I had expected. There were some spots in the hotel that needed minor repair or touch-ups, but overall it was nice and was very clean. The location was great. Two short blocks from Times Square and 1 block from 5th Ave. I thought it was noisy at night (although my husband didn't notice), might be better to have a room that didn't overlook the street. We had a great experience and it was the best price we found in that area for that weekend. Would definitely reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaWB
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I've stayed at this hotel and it was definitely the best visit as the renovations are finally finished. We had a room on the 9th floor; the room was decorated very nicely and quite large - it could have accommodated 2 cots in addition to the 2 queen beds. Room was very quiet (until at the dot of 7:00 a.m. each morning the construction outside began); bed was comfortable; housekeeping did a great job. The breakfast room has been enlarged and is organized much better than in the past. The breakfast offered is basic: bagels, toast, yoghurt, fruit and oatmeal, but a nice extra included in the price. The foyer and lobby have been updated and there are lots of couches and flat screens around, in addition to 2 computers and free internet access. The young lady who organizes tickets, etc. is most helpful in the lobby. The elevators can be slow, particularly at peak times, but no big deal. You can't beat the location of this hotel and we received a very reasonable rate. I will definitely continue to book this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mayumi007
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here and have to say we couldn't have been happier. The twin queen bed rooms are spacious and well maintained. House keeping service was excellent and friendly. The breakfast downstairs was vey good,nice fresh doughnuts and bagels,butter kept in a mini fridge[great touch].Somebody has thought out customer service.My only mild negative was the in room coffee very weak needed two packs to make one good cup and please let's have china cups and saucers instead of styrotex. This will be my future base anytime I'm in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: QBGAP
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel. The service was great 24/7. We arrived early and couldn't go to our room but they let us check in and took all our baggage for us and stored it until we came back. The front desk and concierge were always very friendly and always went out of their way to help any way they could. The lobby of the hotel was very updated and modern. It had two computers that could be used by the guests at any time and lots of seating area. There was a fitness room and a HUGE breakfast room downstairs - the continental breakfast was really well done and a nice inclusion to an already affordable hotel. Compared to other hotels in this class/price range, the rooms were huge - ours had two double beds, a desk w/ chair, a flat screen TV perched on a fair sized chest of drawers, an arm chair, a full sized closet, air conditioning and a four piece private bath. I read that some people complained that the bathroom door was frosted glass. I went with a girlfriend and we tested it - you couldn't see through the glass unless you were leaned up against it and trying!! It also had free local calling and an alarm with MP3/iPod compatibility, which was nice when getting ready to go out and hit the town! Everything was so new and SO CLEAN!! Our rooms were done everyday and we received full linen change and fresh towels. There were four pillows on each bed and extra blankets in the closet. The location was awesome. It's between 5th and 6th, but a little closer to 6th. It took us less than 5 minutes to walk to the middle of Times Square. Because we were one block from the busiest part, I didn't find it very loud at all (mind you, we were on the 10th floor). There is a little bar in the hotel that is super small, but has great service, atmosphere, and super cheap martinis! Definitely worth stopping there for a drink or two before heading elsewhere. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I have been recommending it to anyone who will listen. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - great location”
Reviews.Author: mh24
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for a 5 day vacation in early September. The hallways are tiny, but the rooms were spacious for NY standards, comfortable and, most importanly, clean. Good (FREE) continental breakfast and friendly staff. Great location...easy walking distance to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station and other major attractions and close to major subway lines. For two friends travelling on a limited budget, this was an excellent hotel...highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- will return”
Reviews.Author: Missbecca00
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many NYC hotel in different locations and this by far was the best for walking out your door into the heart of the "tourist" section of the city. Room was clean as was breakfast area and lobby, only negative was that our room and bathroom windown opened into the middle of the building. I would have been better off if I never opened the windown to see what was out there at all. Also, very nice bar on site, but the staff were very unfriendly and offered no local entertainment or food suggestions. Breakfast was standard cold cereal and bagels, but nothing I wasn't expecting. Overall, because of the how clean and updated the hotel was I would stay again for the cost. Also- we stayed here because it was near a subway that went directly to yankee stadium.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: TBay_Ker
Reviews.Content: After a very exhaustive internet search and months of planning this hotel was reccommended by a co-worker 1 week before our trip to NY. Great location, rooms were very clean, friendly/helpful staff, very quiet and comfy beds (so quiet and comfy we slept in and missed breakfast every morning!). We were surprised at the spacious rooms from what I read about the tiny rooms in NY hotels. We arrived at 1:00 and expected to store our luggage but our room was ready for us and storage on our day of departure was great so we didn't have to wheel our luggage around the streets. A nice surprise just across the street, a beautiful park and tribute to 9/11 victims (very touching) a quiet oasis to get away from the hustle and bustle of the streets. Very happy to have stumbled upon this hotel at the last minute. Glad to not have stayed right in Times Square as originally planned. Definately would reccomend to anyone! Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Old Reliable...”
Reviews.Author: melissab15
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel when it was the Super 8. The rooms are clean and the staff are very helpful. Despite the fact that there was a problem with the heater on the coldest day of January, I was supplied a space heater that worked just fine and within minutes. You can't beat the price and the location. I would definitely recommend and continue to stay in the future. In fact, I will be staying at the Hotel at Times Square next month.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: tMCL
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel which was in a great location just off Times Square. Free internet PC's in lobby. Room was quite small given the cost but sufficient. the only problem wass that the bed lonen appeared not to have been changed before I moved in. I only stayed one night so can't comment on longer stays. continental breakfast in mornings was mediocre. Overall too expensive for the quality of rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location and value, mediocre breakfast, slow elevator”
Reviews.Author: leskobear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Labor Day. Nice, well-maintained, fairly new hotel with a good location near Times Square. Great value at $153 a night, I thought, though the advertised queen beds were smaller than a full. Main drawback was very slow elevators and a mediocre breakfast (which was free, so it's hard to complain too much). Rooms were small but well decorated and maintained-very clean. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “No problems as usual”
Reviews.Author: floshel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times over the years. We kept going back since it is a solid hotel in NYC - clean rooms, good service, great location, breakfast and fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a decent price, good location”
Reviews.Author: Davegol
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 1 Y.O baby, initially we got a really small room, and between the suitcases, the baby stuff and everything else, we had to hop around and over things just to get to the bathroom or out... The next day we asked to switch room and we were immediately transferred to a substantially bigger room. The rooms are nice and clean, the service we got was quick and helpful. There are only 2 elevators and one of them worked only half the time, though this didn't usually seem to be a problem. They have two computers with free internet access in the lobby, not a lot of privacy but it's quick and free. The breakfast is very good, containing fruits (apples and Bananas) cereal, different kinds of buns, cheese jam etc, coffee, donuts, juice. The location is great, two minute walk(one block) from times square and very close to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for one minor glitch”
Reviews.Author: m0m0f3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel at Times Square for one night. We arrived very early in the morning, and "checked in" at about 9:00am. We were given our room assignment, put our bags in storage, but obviously not room keys. We returned to the hotel at about 9pm for the night. After retrieving our bags and getting our keys, we headed up to our room. We were on the 3rd floor in a section that was only serviced by an old-fashioned service style elevator, with an elevator operator and all. Our kids thought this was really fun. Our room was small but otherwise just fine. We were all in bed by around 10:30. At 10:45pm my husband heard someone trying to enter the room. He jumped out of bed. We had thrown the door lock/latch. He looked and it was a family. They apparently had been given this room too, complete with newly coded room keys. They were just as surprised as we were, I suppose. We called to the desk to let them know this family was on their way back. Obviously the next morning our room keys no longer worked. But other than the momentary panic/surprise of thinking someone is breaking into your room when you're in it, we had an excellent stay and it was a great value and location. The parking rates cannot be beat either.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Convenient and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: hcvb
Reviews.Content: After an exhaustive search (almost bordering on obsessive!), I found the Apple Core site and finally decided on the Hotel at Times Square. I am in the third day of my trip staying here, and I have to say I have been extremely pleased with the hotel. I think it's a tiny bit of a stretch to call it a boutique hotel, but it definitely lives up to its current reputation as a very pleasant, clean and extremely convenient hotel. My room on the 11th floor has been so nice and quiet, the beds are luxuriously comfortable (so comfortable in fact that I've missed each of the free breakfasts so far because I've slept in so late!), the rooms are perfectly cleaned up every day, and the free wi-fi is a real bonus. I had a small problem with my bathtub drain not working, and they were up within 10 minutes to fix it. Very efficient. The one downside (noted by a previous reviewer as well) is that they give you plastic and styrofoam cups in the room. I also read that the breakfasts are served all on disposable plates with plastic utensils as well. From andenvironmental standpoint, I think it's extremely wasteful and I hope management seriously looks into providing real cups, dishes, and cutlery as soon as possible. In addition, if they truly are trying to promote themselves as a boutique hotel, all the more reason to cut out the tacky and wasteful disposables. The only drawback in my mind to this otherwise pretty great and reasonably priced hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location and amenities make for great value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Dr_EdPineGrove_PA
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel from the Internet, and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Everything looks new and clean. Our party stayed in two rooms. Our room was slightly larger than the other, but both had all of the amenities (TV, wireless internet, an alarm clock with an IPod dock, desk and chair, and nice en suite facilities). The ordinary continental breakfast was a timesaver, and the location allowed us to walk to the theatre district, to shopping, and to restaurants. They give discounts to AARP or AAA members. We could not have been more pleased, and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: WNPK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the last 2 days of a trip to NYC. We had stayed at the Ramada Eastside hotel, which is also part of the Apple Core chain of hotels. We wanted to stay in the hustle and bustle of Times Square, so decided to give this hotel a try, since we'd had a good experience at the Ramada. Overall, the Apple Core hotels are all pretty much the same. The rooms have been renovated and offer the same amenities at each hotel. I wrote a detailed review for the Ramada Eastside, so you can read that if you want more information. There are a few specific things about this hotel that are different from the Ramada Eastside. The staff at the Ramada Eastside were more personable, whereas the ones at The Hotel are a little less interested in you as a guest. The breakfast room at this hotel is packed in the mornings...a lot more tourists stay here with their families...so you may have to wait to find a table or place to sit and eat. Also, it's louder at this hotel, because of the location. The free wifi was a lot slower, and the computers downstairs were always occupied. Overall, it's just a busier hotel, with the same amenities you'd find at another Apple Core hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!! - but service standards a bit low and terrible consierge service”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer0705
Reviews.Content: All who travelled and stayed at the hotel = Me: 29/female; Partner: 30/male; father 64/male My boyfriend and I took my father on one of our many trips to NYC. We chose this particular hotel because my father has some health problems and cannot walk far distances. In NYC, this is problematic of course because it is a pedestrian city. I promise that this hotel was the very best hotel to stay at with my Dad on the trip because it was the closet hotel to everything (most tourist sights) that tourists have heard of and want to see. We were a mere couple of blocks from Father Duffy Square in Times Square, and we were right in the middle of the theatre district (mere blocks from all the shows we went to see). Upon arrival, yes we also had the fellow who could not speak a word of english, but he was friendly enough. We were also provided little "welcome" packages of the small things you might need or have forgotton (toothbrush, toothpaste, tylenol, etc). It was a nice touch. There is also complimentary continental breakfast served every morning. Fitness centre and high speed interent included as well as boutiques on the main floor. The rooms themselves are standard sized (we stayed in a 2 bedroom double bed room). they are not incredibly small, but not overly large. They are comfortable enough. Our only issue was our television did not work when we arrived and we required extra pillow, so we called down to the front desk for service. It took a very long time for them to rectify the problem and to get more pillows to be honest, so we were a bit put off by their service standards. Clean rooms and it was nice to see that they had extra soap, shampoo and conditioner (knowing we were a party of three). The consierge looked to be a summer student who did not really care too much about her job. I asked her where I could get tickets for Billy Elliot, and she told me "the box office". Duh. I know that, but they are sold out and usually consierge helps out with this sort of thing. She was very hopeless and definitely NOT helpful. The Hotel is right beside a Dress Barn too, so ladies, lots of dress shopping too! We were staying there when the Pride Parade was going on and it was simply a block up the street, so it was convienient. A negative comment (besides the horrible consierge) would be that one of their two elevators was out of service, so we had to wait a LONG time for an elevator. A few times we took the stairs (we were on the 6th floor). In general, we would stay again just based on the location itself. Awesome location! Again, the rates my boyfriend found a decent rate of $160 for the first 3 nights and then $180 for the last two nights. Not too bad for such a great location. We would stay again....but do not suggest relying on the consierge for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing is the LOCATION! Easy to get everywhere”
Reviews.Author: ardmore32
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 days with our children ages 15 and 13. We booked a non-smoking suite--which had two bedrooms. One had a King bed and the other a Queen. Yes, the bathroom door was a bit see-thru. Haha We found this hotel to be a great choice. Located in Midtown, it is easy to get everywhere in NYC, yet the actual street it is on ("Little Brazil") is quite quiet. Our rooms were small, but clean. The beds and pillows were awesome. We didn't plan to spend much time in our rooms, so the size didn't bother us. And because the hotel is located in a charming, older building, it is built like a rock with thick walls. We heard NO noise at all even though our rooms were located near the elevators. The continental breakfasts are only moderate, but suitable: Cold cereals, toast, bagels, doughnuts, coffee, juices, fruit and yogurts. It is definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: phanya
Reviews.Content: Hi! I just wanted to contribute to good overviews of the place. After reading tons of reviews on Tripadvisor I finally booked the Hotel at Times Sq. and stayed there for 10 days in the beginning of May 2009. The key thing to share is that it is a great location for visitors, clean rooms and friendly staff. I would not say the place is luxury, it is just nice and clean with nothing disturbing or annoying. I have a very pleasant impression of the place and would definitely recommend it to people who came to see the city and not stay in the hotel for long. However, I should admit that very often one of two elevators does not work, one of two PCs with free Internet access in the lobby does not work, the breakfast is the same everyday. But believe me it is not that crucial for the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “...a little bit of heaven....”
Reviews.Author: arielcat777
Reviews.Content: It was sure nice to come home to The Hotel @Times Square every night, after our adventurous, shopping and sight seeing days in New York! Everything you have read in all the other reviews is pretty accurate, and we enjoyed everything about the hotel, even our bathroom door. As you may have already read, the bathroom door is pretty see through, with some clear and crystal striping in the middle. To remedy this, I took a hanger out of the closet, and took a bath towel and clipped it lengthwise and hung it on the hook on the door. Viola'....problem fixed! You will find other places to stay in New York, but nothing that compares to this little piece of heaven, with as great a location and price, as The Hotel@ Times Square!!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE, CLEAN, CLOSE TO EVERYTHING, QUIET AREA”
Reviews.Author: Spirit_of_Radio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Worked for my family. Rooms are not huge, but clean and bright. The morning breakfast is a great way to start your day. Staff was excellent. After looking at prices at other hotels, I thought that this place had to be a dump for what they were charging. I am happy to say I was wrong. The place is great. Just 1-1/2 blocks from times square. 1/2 block from 5th ave shopping. Worked great for wife, 2 kids 7 and 13 year olds. I really liked that you could get away from the mobs of crowds on times square. Right across from hotel is a nice plaza to relax in, and the best pizza slices are next to the plaza on 45th st. called Little Italy Pizza. Get the Calamari pizza slice, you will not regret it. We stayed 3 nights and were very happy with the hotel and its central location to sites, shopping, theaters, restaurants and subway right around the corner. I have stayed in nicer, larger hotel rooms that are true five star, but for the price to value you get, it is a five star stay in my book. I will be back to this place to stay again, I just hope that they do not get to popular, and raise the prices of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful NYC theatre district find.”
Reviews.Author: doctormike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel from Baltimore to NYC a few times a year for theatre and are always on the lookout for good deals on hotels in the theatre district. We book through the Quikbook website or by phone through their toll-free number. We recently spent three nights at The Hotel at Times Square and will certainly return. It has been recently renovated. The decor is upbeat. The rooms are adequate size, good beds and very clean. Buffet breakfast is included. Free phone calls from the room and free computer access in the lobby. It seems the owners have made a special effort to provide the cost-conscious visitor with all they really need for a good experience. The only downside was the concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, pleasant facility at a reasonable price in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: junecarol5
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel twice, certainly will go back again. Rooms are clean and well maintained, the continental breakfast (included in room price) is quite satisfactory and is offered in a newly remodeled, pleasant breakfast room. The staff is most welcoming and accommodating. The location, just a couple of blocks from Times Square and a very short walk (even with a suitcase!) from Grand Central Station, couldn't be better. We literally walked everywhere we went--museums, shopping, Circle Cruise, Central Park, theaters, and great restaurants. If you bring a car, discounted parking is available across the street. We're picky, and we highly recommend The Hotel at Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in NYC”
Reviews.Author: budman33647
Reviews.Content: Booked this property based on reviews read here. The price was great ! The price actually dropped after I made my online reservation, made a call and they adjusted it immediately. The room was new, clean and not huge but big enough. The staff was friendly, the lobby area was nice, the free computers were great (had to wait sometimes but not long) The free breakfast was sufficient and definately saved us some money. Were were a few blocks from TImes Square, Steps away from 5th avenue and Rockefeller Center. The Subway (BDF) was just around the corner. I lived in NY for 30 years and this was my first trip back in 15 years. I could find no better deal online for any other hotel. At 165.00 a night this was the best kept secret in NYC. Would highly recommend and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in NYC”
Reviews.Author: budman33647
Reviews.Content: Booked this property based on reviews read here. The price was great ! The price actually dropped after I made my online reservation, made a call and they adjusted it immediately. The room was new, clean and not huge but big enough. The staff was friendly, the lobby area was nice, the free computers were great (had to wait sometimes but not long) The free breakfast was sufficient and definately saved us some money. Were were a few blocks from TImes Square, Steps away from 5th avenue and Rockefeller Center. The Subway (BDF) was just around the corner. I lived in NY for 30 years and this was my first trip back in 15 years. I could find no better deal online for any other hotel. At 165.00 a night this was the best kept secret in NYC. Would highly recommend and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “The most pleasant SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: 09familyoffour
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of it's resonable price in it's location. I was most pleased when I arrived. The hotel looked as if it had been recently renovated and the location is awesome. One block from 5th Ave and about two blocks from Times Square! They served a continental breakfast every morning. The staff was very friendly and accomondating. AAA discount and they even gave us a discount on the long term parking. It will be the first place I book if ever I return to the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Great value at terrific location in The Heart og Midtown Manhattan !”
Reviews.Author: EdDenmark
Reviews.Content: We were 2 groups of 3 persons from Denmark visiting the highlights of The former New Amsterdam, and loved the hotel and location. Terrific value including free breakfast (OK but not great), fast WiFi internet in the room, in-room safes, coffee maker, good air conditioning, etc. The location can not be better if interested in seeing the major sights of The City. 5 minute walk to Times Square, just off of 6th Ave, and a 3 minute walk to the best part of 5th Avenue. We got a cheaper rate than originally booked y continually checking the hotel's web-site, and the price went down 30 dollars pr. room pr. night jujst days before our visit, so we re-booked at the lower rate. The beds were great, the rooms good-sized for New York, and the bathrooms large and very clean. LCD tv, etc. The hotel staff was genuinely interested in the guests having an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but only 1 elevator operates”
Reviews.Author: vegashomes
Reviews.Content: All in all it was a very nice stay. Clean rooms. Maid service was kind enough to leave plenty of shampoo and conditioner. Management was always warm and welcoming. Conceriege didn't have any stamps available for purchase for post cards. But most problematic was only one elevator in operation. When I inquired management informed us know they were just wrapping it up. However the very next day they started on the other elevator.....Elevator is used for handymen, maids and guests for all 12 floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: suziejo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Times Square is a great find for a reasonable priced hotel in NYC. My stay was for 6 nights and I had a large room on the 10th floor. i didnt expect a view as I wasnt in NYC to look out my hotel window. This hotel is close to everything you need for an exciting stay in this large city. The breakfast was an extra bonus and offered the perfect selection for an Aussie traveler, as we are fans of cereal and toast for breakfast. The only thing missing was Vegemite! The staff were all friendly and helpful, answering every query cheerfully and with great knowledge of their city. If I ever make it back to New York I will be booking a stay at The Hotel at Times Square again. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DarlisaJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel was GREAT!!!! The location, free breakfast, room size, and internet access made our stay a wonderful experience. My only complaint is only one of the elevators was working which lead to a sometimes long wait and my room was on the 9th floor. I would stay again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bosfly
Reviews.Content: Front Desk agent Donna was so nice Great hotel and excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and the concierge made it easy to plan our day!”
Reviews.Author: shopper0709
Reviews.Content: We came for a week of shows, shopping and sight seeing. We had a problem when we first arrived regarding our room, but the staff at the front desk resolved it quickly and very much to our satisfaction. We were happy with our room, and the shower was great. The continental breakfast was a great start to every day. The location of the Hotel at Times Square was perfect for all of our outings. The concierge was able to assist us with directions and best means of transportation, making it easy for us to plan our day. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Clean Hotel in Heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 7/4-7/7 and enjoyed it very much. The room although smaller was perfect for the two of us. Everything was modern and new and looked really nice. We arrived at LGA at 11:30am and the hotel was all set with a room for us for 12 noon, no wait whatsoever! The only issue was one elevator was broken so only using one had really long waits. Sometimes you would hit the buttom on the 9th floor and it would skip you twice! You just had to be patient, and sometimes just give up and take the stairs. The bed was extremly comfortable and the flat tv a very nice touch. The free wireless internet was great too! This property is close to everything, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave all minutes away! The rate was great too at only $125/night for 2 ppl, you can't be it! The breakfast was decent, we only ate it once. The line was kind of long at 9:30am but that was fine. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations and great price”
Reviews.Author: colinda2004
Reviews.Content: It may seem odd to write "great price" for a NYC hotel, but that description is accurate for The Hotel at Times Square. The location is about 2 blocks off Times Square and the price was great. It was over $100 less than the Holiday Inn Express and the rooms were much bigger. The morning breakfast was very good; nothing fancy but serviceable. The hotel has been remodeled recently so the rooms all look very modern. Parking was only $23/day, which is very good for downtown. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Location, Staff, and Value - TOP NOTCH!!”
Reviews.Author: Patti4
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed in this hotel - daughter and family in one room, husband and myself in another. We totally enjoyed everything about our stay! The continental breakfast (FREE!) was a great way to start our day, and provided a wide variety of foods for all. Hotel beds were extremely comfortable, staff very friendly and helpful, and location for all "tourist" attractions couldn't have been better. We felt very safe coming and going at all times. The hotel's cleanliness was evident, as the janitorial staff could be seen working throughout the day. Although not your fancy NY hotel, the value was fantastic, and served our purpose well. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I intend to book again this fall, when I return for a "girls only" trip! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “exceptional staff and total amenities”
Reviews.Author: Rick71143
Reviews.Content: I choose the hotel for it's location only, but was very surprised at how great the staff treated us. The amenities were also fantastic. I encountered a small problem with the parking facility and when I notified Sonny, the manager, my credit card was credited the overage immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: sunnysideSunnyside
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the staff at this hotel who really went the extra mile to return a lost wallet to us. This kind of honesty and responsibility is indeed a wonderful thing in a hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: thunderml
Reviews.Content: basically really loved this hotel. i grew up in NY but was not able to stay with family like we usually do and we were travelling with friends and teenagers. so, with tickets in hand to a broadway show and only a couple of days to explore the city, i wanted a place close to the heart of the city and close to transportation. we lucked out with this smallish hotel with a classic architecture on a street between fifth and sixth avenues - there are subways within a couple of blocks in 2 directions, the street is fairly quiet and the rooms are roomy, believe it or not (plus they are quiet and you can regulate the temperature well). Ask for a room on the east side - til they build the new building next door, you'll have large windows with a nice view (the west side rooms seem to have narrow windows facing a narrow alley). the bathrooms are small but very nicely outfitted and the variety of good breakfast offerings kept us satisfied all morning to give us more time to search for a great lunch (!). there's an easy to use safe in each room and altho the elevators are slow, we didn't mind. also, there is parking available for about $30/24hrs and the rooms are nicely decorated and thoughtful things like an iHome are there for your iPod to play music. i don't usually write reviews, but i thought i should pass on the news that you can stay close to the center of the city for a very good price (on the applecore web site we paid $175 for Sat nt and $145 for Sunday - plus tax) and be comfortable and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, lots of info. in review.”
Reviews.Author: mariess
Reviews.Content: Overall, for the money, this was a great value in Manhattan. We booked it directly though applecore.com and checked back frequently and got a lower rate by rebooking. We paid $130 a night. They had the best rate available from various websites. And it included a free continental breakfast and free wireless internet and computers/printer in the lobby. I will start with my problem issues: 1. Biggest complaint - elevator service. They have 2 elevators, but at almost every time we used them, one was out of service for some unknown reason. It varied and wasn't always the same one, so it clearly wasn't an "out of order" issue. Frequently had long waits for the elevator. 2. Bathroom window didn't lock, and it was accessible from the fire escape. 3. Breakfast lines were long and seating not available when we went each day. 4. Maid service questionable. They did not restock our coffee or cups on any day. We had to repeatedly call each day for coffee packets. 5. Trouble making calls to front desks - phones not working or busy, not sure. 6. We found a pair of flip flops in our room one day, presumably left by room service. We actually didn't figure this out until we were leaving, as I and my niece both thought they belonged to the other person. Didn't have time to complain at checkout, but it is bothersome in retrospect to have someone in our room and leaving things. Looked like a man's flip flops. 7. 2 computers in lobby always in use, though didn't have to wait long to use. 8. Beds were double beds, not queen beds, as I thought the website said. Now, the good things. 1. Great value for price. 2. Great tourist location - a couple blocks from Times Square and the Theatre district. Close to Rockefeller Center. Close to 5th Avenue shopping. Can walk to Empire State Bldg (about 1 mile) and south side of Central Park (about 1 mile). 3. Nice room decor, large rooms, clean. Recently remodeled. 4. Free wireless internet. 2 computers and printers in the lobby for printing out online tickets, etc. They could use more computers, as they were always in use though people seemed to get off quickly if you stood there and waited. 5. Breakfast had good variety for continental breakfast - O.J., apple juice, milk, several cold cereals, oatmeal packets, variety of doughnuts, variety of bagles, toasters (with line), yogurt, bananas, and apples. We went between 9:30 and 10 each day (it closes at 10), and they hadn't run out of anything. Not enough seating at breakfast. 6. Nice lobby. Highly recommend with caveats - the hotel could fix a few problems easily and make the experience better. I

Reviews.Title: “Look no Further! Best Value in Manhatten!”
Reviews.Author: orchid030
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, comfortable Hotel in Manhatten within walking distance of TKTS in Times Square, Broadway Theatres, good restaurants, a subway around the corner, look no further! The Manager, Sonny G., upgraded us from a double bedded to a queen bedded room, and when I told him I had medication that needed to be kept cold, he provided an in-room fridge at no charge. Our beds were supremely comfortable, bathroom was modern, my companions loved the breakfast (included), while I walked several blocks to Eight Avenue for fresh vegetable juice to maintain my glutenless diet,. There is a Kosher deli across the street, along with many other restaurants within walking distance, including the Edison Cafe, a few blocks away. The NY Public Library, Maceys, Lord and Taylor, Saks, Daffys, and lots of shopping possibilities are easily accessible by foot. Return trips to NYC will see us back at this Hotel! Thanks to the courteous, professional staff, especially Sonny G, from your Canadian fans!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: j75041h
Reviews.Content: this hotel was put in a great location, only 2 short blocks to broadway & 5th. the beds were so comfortable & shower had great pressure! the rooms were very small, but w/only 1 suitcase, everything fit very well, thankfully there was a closet too..we had FREE WIFI, tv was a nice flatscreen, but not many channels & not HD...we had 2 windows that opened up, (there was a sticker saying DO NOT OPEN, but i couldnt resist) alot of rooftops to look over, but w/a building torn down besides the hotel, we could see 46th st . i really liked it alot & would consider staying there again if thats the area i want to be in!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: chargerlover86
Reviews.Content: The hotel at times square was in the perfect location. Its not dead center of times square but just a short couple of blocks. The guy at the front desk was always very nice. They were renovating when we were there which is the only reason I rated the cleanliness lower then the others. Im sure it will look great when its all done! If you plan on taking the subway (which is very very convenient and buy the day pass) make sure you get a map which was provided to us by a girl at a desk in the loby. I went with a group of 4 girls and we all packed at least 3 bags and the room was a bit snug so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: jsh5100
Reviews.Content: newly remodeled, great continental breakfast, minutes from Times Square. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay there again. Paid under $200/night - great deal for the location

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASFGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: this was a great little hotel for my two night stay. Great location, comfortable bed, quiet, sleek modern furniture. Ella at the desk was helpful. The amenities are great and unexpected at this price - free breakfast, free internet, coffeemaker in the room, flat screen television. At first, I was disappointed that the hotel was not right on Times Square, but it's just a short two block walk and you're close to Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue, Grand Central. It's actually better. Nice Brazillian and spanish restaurants on the block. Don't miss the great juice cart and Indian food cart across the street. No complaints about this great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Find!”
Reviews.Author: meanderbug
Reviews.Content: We typically stay in name brand hotels, but took a chance and stayed at this hotel due to the great price and good reviews I read about on this site. I was not disappointed! This hotel is a true gem. The location is absolutely great! We were able to walk to Times Square, theaters, 5th Ave. shopping, subway stations and Rockefeller Center in a matter of minutes. The hotel is on a rather quiet, by New York standards, side street. The street is lined with interesting Brazilian restaurants. It is also in the heart of the Diamond District. Our room was ready when we arrived. The lobby is beautifully decorated and the entire hotel was very clean and comfortable. Our room on the tenth floor was large and featured a flat screen TV and other amenities. The front desk staff was very friendly. The breakfast each morning was basic bagels, toast, fruit, doughnuts, cereal, coffee and juice, but was always fresh and plentiful. The staff, who manned this area, made sure that everything was well stocked. The free breakfast alone saved us lots of money. Each night, after touring, we walked down to 8th, 9th and 10th Avenues, to eat at great little ethnic restaurants that gave us a local feel. They were much cheaper than the Times Square tourist traps and delicious. The Magnolia Bakery is only two blocks away from this hotel and we frequented it daily! The area was very safe and I would stay again at this hotel. I was very happy with everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: CurlyWhirly79
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I have stayed at in New York. It is also a great value. It was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. And the hotel was in a fantastic location! Patrica, our maid on the 8th floor, was incredible! So friendly and helpful. Also, everyone at the front desk and at the concierge desk was extremely conscientious and knowledgeable. We will certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and rate”
Reviews.Author: hamm5
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff was professional. Got in too early to get into room but staff stored our bags for us so we could start sightseeing. Easy walk to Broadway for shows

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, economical (for NYC) value.”
Reviews.Author: olsensreva
Reviews.Content: We rented 2 rooms for 4 adults for 5 nights. We chose this hotel for the location & the $ & it did not disappoint. Close to Grand Central, Times Sq, Rockefeller & subway. The rooms were spacious & very clean with good beds. The bathrooms were nice & the shower was great. Overall, the hotel personnel were helpful if not particularly friendly (seemed to be a NY attitude rather than anything else). The hotel needs to upgrade the sheets & the concierge needs to be better trained. And both of our room doors squealed terribly - invest in some WD40! If you want a dark room, stay away from the 3rd floor front. Skip the continental breakfast & go to the Dunhill on 45th & 6th or the deli on 6th around the corner for a geat price. Overall, we found it to be a good deal for the price we paid. We'll definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: LillyPickle
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 1-night stay with my sister and her 5 year old son. Nothing but good things to say about this place! Excellent location, spotless room, friendly staff and an amazing rate. The included breakfast was a nice extra, since I was traveling with a child. The breakfast dining room was large, bright and very clean, with a pretty good assortment to choose from. Our guestroom (2 double beds) was immaculate; our bathroom was stocked with plenty of extra towels and decent toiletries. We even received a little gift bag upon check in, which included additional toiletries...nice little extra. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money I saved”
Reviews.Author: travelgirls59
Reviews.Content: I planned a weekend trip to New York. I selected this hotel for its vicinity to Times Square, its affordable rate and positive reviews. Unfortunately, that is all this hotel offers. 1. My sink and toilet were not working. 2. The overall impression of the hotel is that it is not frequently cleaned or maintained. 3. The bed sheets were stained. 4. The batroom had ants and stains. 5. Breakfast room is icky. 6. Vending machines are empty. 7. Lobby bathroom is dirty. Like subway dirty. 8. One member of the check-in staff was rude. The woman checking me in was rude - abnormally rude for New York. She huffed and puffed when she realized there was a problem with my reservation and had to call the reservation department. Seriously, she said in a deep sigh, "Now I have to call reservations," and did so reluctantly. She couldn't even solve the problem or, in my opinion, she was unwilling to solve the problem and had me deal with their reservation department and Expedia. I guess she didn't realize I was the one on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chezis21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in May. The rooms were spotless, the free wif-fi was a great bonus, plus there is free use of the hotels business centre pcs complete with printer! The staff were very helpful and the location of this hotel is very central to midtown and close to subways . The rooms whilst being on the small side were more than adequate afterall when you visit NYC as a tourist you dont really expect to be spending much time in your hotel excep to sleep! We went for the free breakfast one day but in all honesty we preferred to seek out low-cost delis and have a different breakfast every day! All in all we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All work AND play!”
Reviews.Author: Gatekeeperroadhog
Reviews.Content: As a college recruiter I travel throughout NY state but mostly in the Five Borough Area. Whenever in NYC, I first try The Hotel at Times Square. I have stayed there many times in the past. The location is central to my schedule.
