There are numerous restaurants around the area and a parking lot kitty-corner across the street making this hotel very convenient. Often, my wife accompanies me on these trips. She plays while I work; shopping, theaters, museums are either within walking distance or just a bus ride away. After my work is done, we will take in a meal or go to some interesting tourist destination. The Hotel at Times Square staff is excellent. They are very friendly and efficient. they will seek to accommodate the guest as much as possible. there are both smoking and non-smoking rooms which are clean and comfortable. Recently, the Hotel was remodeled and is now very modern. We have traveled to Europe and find that the hotel has that European feel from the lobby to the decor in the rooms. In fact, many international tourists stay at this hotel. The continental breakfast is very good -- and free!

Reviews.Title: “For business or Broadway, a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Recoveringlawyer
Reviews.Content: Great value location for a mid-town business trip or a night at the theatre. Small, clean rooms with polite, if a bit cool staff. Close to Times Square, TKTS booth. Free breakfast is fine, if uninspired. Ask for a room on the lower floors facing south and you'll get no view, but you will get quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, would go back again.”
Reviews.Author: richgibbs
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for seeing the best bits of NYC - the hotel is 5mins from Times Square and the Rockafeller Centre, 3mins to the nearest Starbucks and 2mins from the nice end of 5th Avenue! After reading all the whinging about small rooms for NYC hotels I was pleasantly surprised with a decent sized double room and compact, but perfectly adequate bathroom (no bath, just shower). Rooms were well equipped - coffee maker, big plasma screen, air con unit, safe etc etc. The only minor downfall is the breakfasts - buffet of bagels, toast, sugary cereals or doughnuts all served on plastic disposals plates / bowls - good effort on helping the environment there. Would have been nice if there were a few more healthy things to eat, but for a holiday it's fine. Don't be misled by the "business centre" - this is only 2 computers in the lobby with free internet & printing, which is great, but more often than not you'll be waiting 30mins to get on them at all times of the day due to habitual facebook-checkers!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaCndgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very very clean and the rooms were very nice. The staff were very accomodating. The beds were very comfortable. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. The rates were very very good. The breakfast they proivided was great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Rooms; Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BobbyChristchurch
Reviews.Content: The hotel had no rooms when I arrived, and moved me to another hotel. I returned the next day - the staff were helpful, and friendly. The room was clean, tidy, and decent.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: jsutphin
Reviews.Content: I arranged for a group of 20 people to travel to the city from West Virginia during our spring break. We arrived late but were checked in quickly. We found our rooms freshly remodeled and very clean. I slept in my comfortable bed with very clean sheets and blankets. Everyone in the group enjoyed the breakfast and liked that they could eat and get started early. The staff is very nice, Shelly with group reservations was especially helpful to me. Several people in the group stated they would stay here again. I only wish it had been a little closer to the theatres but I didn't mind the walk, even at night. We used our internet daily and that was a big plus. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic, Brillient Hotel in a Great Postion.”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Boy_Malaga
Reviews.Content: Here i am on my last night in this great city of New York writing this review from my room at The Hotel at Times Square using the hotels FREE internet conection. First this hotel is in a great position just one block from Times Square and one block from the Rockerfella Centre and surrounded by restaurants, bars and irish pubs. There is plenty going on around here day and night and all the theatres within a short walk away. The rooms are on the small side but very clean and there is a work desk, 32" flat screen tv with games consul and we have one king bed which is comfy and soft. Coffee and tea machine, Iron and Ironing board, Nice bathroom with nice powerfull shower with plenty of hot water. The staff at the front desk are friendly and helpfull and sent us two extra pillows within minutes of asking for them. The breakfast is ample with plenty of juice, cerial, toast, fruit and tea and coffee e.t.c. to start the day with. There is allso a small Bar which serves a pint of draught beer for just $3.00 We are off down to Atlantic City tomorrow on the Gray Hound bus so look out for my review on the Bally's Atlantic City. Some i have read on Trip Advisor are not very good atall.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal for the money - would definitely use again”
Reviews.Author: Bagabargain
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been refurbished and offers good facilities for a small (by NY standards) hotel. The rooms were a reasonable size, well equipped and serviced efficiently each day. The staff were all helpful, and the location (between Times Sq and 5th Avenue) was ideal. Whilst only a few minues walk from Times Square the location was quiet, and city noise was no problem. The (inclusive) continental breakfast was a bonus. I would definitely use this hotel again if staying in central New York.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: suevindianapolis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hotel at Times Square for three nights and found rooms to be very clean, ample room, pleasant desk and concierge staff and housekeeping staff. Will definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square's best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: czechmate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter weekend/Passover and despite arriving in NYC at a very busy time, we couldn't find any fault with the service at this hotel. Location is great - 5 mins from Times sq, Rockefeller, St Patricks Cathedral and Radio City. Plenty of restaurants nearby, a Duane Reade drugstore just around the corner and Delis open late just along the street. Don't go expecting 5* luxury, but the rooms were clean, newly updated, bathrooms nice.Big plasma tvs in the rooms and an ipod dock too. Plenty of fresh towels everyday. The breakfast was a real bonus: tea, coffee, fruit juices, cereal, yoghurt, bagels, doughnuts and toast. Got a bit boring by the 5th day but who's complaining! Free wifi access in the rooms and 2 computers in the lobby with free internet access. The staff were very friendly and helpful and acted promptly if you had any problems. All in all we thought this hotel was excellent value and a fantastic location. We won't hesitate to return there nest time we're in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “quite a deal and good location”
Reviews.Author: stephgorski
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed April 13-15, 2009 and had a great stay. I was a bit nervous booking on the internet. There were old and new pictures posted, but everything has been renovated. The room was clean, spacious for a large city and the location was great. We had a two queen room and it was exactly like the pictures on the hotel site. We were only two blocks from Times Square and only a few blocks from many other NYC sights. The staff was nice. The wireless internet was a bit slow, but free so no complaints. The lobby hotel internet seemed to have a lot of problems, but I had enough luck printing our boarding passes for our flight back. We thought there was a Tapas restaurant on the second floor, but it turns out it's just a little bar (we didn't try it). The breakfast was great. We felt clean, safe, and like we got a deal. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Ash76
Reviews.Content: It has comfort of being in main area of the manhatten city and close to times square. It's small but neat room, free internet wireless facility with morning breakfast & gym. Little congested.but still good option for one who want to stay in the heart of the city and travelling for business or leisure. Location is just perfect. Jet Previlage Membership No. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spartan, quirky”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVirginian
Reviews.Content: Stayed April 8-10 in a "family suite" of two rooms with two beds and two TVs, no refrigerator. Very clean, quiet and comfortable. Others have noted the etched glass on the bathroom door. We solved that by taping some newspaper over it. The renovations others complained of seem to be done, at least in lobby and lower floors. Although clean and with new furnishings and carpet in rooms and lobby, it's an old building with oddities such as hallway doors separating adjoining elevators, some uneven stairsteps, and an unexplainable floodlight that goes on and off erratically in the airshaft (which was our only view). The bar on the second floor is little more than two small connecting hotel rooms. There are two free computers in the lobby but seemed to be a lot of competition for them. The free breakfast until 10 a.m. was well-stocked and convenient. The location is terrific, and the value is great (we paid $177 each night). Be sure to check out on time, though. We got a call at 12:25 p.m. warning us that we'd be charged another $25 if we didn't come down and check out immediately. Via Italiana and Ipanema on the same block were very good, modestly priced restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: STLATL
Reviews.Content: The Hotel at Times Square was in a great location (2 blocks from the heart of Times Square) yet was not as noisy as some of the Times Square hotels can be. The continental breakfast was ample and the hotel rate was very reasonable for a hotel in that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for the money!”
Reviews.Author: atourist2
Reviews.Content: Visited March 23 - March 28th. The price was right! The room with two double beds was large, quiet, well maintained and clean. No view, but wasn't in the room long enough to miss a view. The computers were up and running the day I needed to print boarding passes. The free wireless connection for our laptop was wonderful to have in our rooms to help plan our excursions. We leisurely made it down to breakfast, a little later each morning, but always found plenty of fresh pastries and fruit, coffee, cereal and yogurt and a table. I was impressed with how clean the breakfast room was no matter how late we arrived. Never waited for elevators because the stairs were next to the elevators, open and well lighted (in other words safe and not hidden away) and easy to take as well as a good way to work off extra calories. I was happy that the hotel was not in the middle of Times Squares (even though Times Square is in the name of the hotel). I felt very safe and comfortable in our location for this mother /daughter trip. Only needed to take subway for our Central Park stroll, Ellis Island visit, Century 21 shopping trip, and Greenwich Village stroll. It was so convenient to walk everywhere else. It was hard to believe this is a budget hotel. If pressed for concerns: There was one large high school group who were a bit loud the few times we ran into them (where were the chaperons?). I hope this lovely budget hotel does not become a haven for touring high school groups! Can't say that the concierge services were what I considered true concierge services, but didn't really care because we had a laptop in our room and with free wireless connections had trip advisor, hopstop.com, restaurant reviews etc. Everything we needed and no waiting. Overall the hotel was far better than what I expected for a budget hotel in NYC. I am sure the economy and time of year of our visit had a lot to do with the rates, but I did a lot of comparison shopping in preparation for this trip. Based on location, free wireless, free breakfast, room size, double beds and cleanliness, I know we got a great bargain. It really made it appear that our very budget conscious mother/daughter trip wasn't so budget conscious. Much gratitude for all of the advice and suggestions I found on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “was a bit dusty but great”
Reviews.Author: munchyDublin
Reviews.Content: yes there was work going on in the lobby but in our rooms or in the cute tiny bar you couldnt hear a thing, we had 2 rooms booked no problem with either, bathrooms we had had a warpped design in the glass so you could not see straight through, location was brilliant, some nice little delis and bars up the road near the comfort inn and left of the hotel you are a minute to 5 ave, i always stay in 4 or 5 star hotels but as there was so many i had to go for somewhere cheaper, glad i did i really like this hotel and will def be back

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: NYCher
Reviews.Content: Problems with the heating that never were resolved. Flood lights directed right into our room, kept the room very bright all night. Still not quite sure if I understand why the hotel would put see-through glass on the bathroom doors, kind of creepy. Was told a week before we stayed that the renovations would be done in about a week. When we got there, we were told the renovations would be done in about a week. Must be the standard response. The staff did seem very friendly. The breakfast was very nice and fresh. Rooms were very clean except the dirty windows. Nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good: location, cleannes, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Ana_Ramos.Brazil
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. We paid an excelent price, around 140 dollars per night. The location is excellent, near Times Square, Rockfeller Center and close to almost every subway line you can think of. The room is very nice, quite comfortable, everything new and very clean. The breakfast has doughnuts, bagels, juice, coffe, etc. It's very crowded and since there are so many places to eat nearby we often end up eating out. Service was good. The hotel was going through some renovations and sometimes there was only one elevator functioning which was a little bit disturbing, but it seems that these renovations will be very good for the hotel. I recommend it to anyone looking for a good budget hotel in a excelent location.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, friendly staff, good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: mavfans
Reviews.Content: Beds were very comfortable, very clean room with good quality sundries, walking distance to Times Square, restaurants, and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, clean, great service and value!”
Reviews.Author: bflojim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run by Applecore hotels. We stayed at the Comfort Inn Times Square last time. This hotel is spotless, great value, location etc etc. The breakfast is a bonus. Staff are fantastic. In reality it's closer to Rockefeller Center then it is to Times Square but it's definatly walkable distance to both as well as almost any midtown venue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Trinidad, Feb 24th to 26th Check in/Check out was quick and easy, no problems with our reservation. The room looked fresh, not run down, bathroom was very clean. Location was superb, just a short walk away from Times Square, Broadway and all the other hot spots. It was so easy to pop back in for a rest after walking and shopping all day and before going out for a show. We actually dropped packages off a few times during the day rather than walking around with them. Heating was great, was actually a bit warm sometimes but much welcomed after being out in the cold, and there was always a good supply of hot water for showers. What was commendable was that when we got to the room the sink was not draining properly, we did not report it that day as we were eager to get out on the town, however, it seems that when the maids came to clean the following day, they got it fixed without us asking. That was nice. The ongoing renovations were a bit inconvenient as they often closed off one of the lifts, but we never had to wait too long for the one that was working. Breakfast was decent, loved the coffee maker in the room as I must have a cup as soon as I wake up. Overall I would definitely stay here again, as it provided a safe, clean, convenient and comfortable place to sleep after a day/night in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Forgetting the basics”
Reviews.Author: RAScottDotCom
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a decent size and comfortable enough. Good value for the location. But the website forgets to mention that the whole ground floor (1st floor to some readers!) is under renovation and it is a noisy building site. Reception is neither friendly or welcoming. Maybe they are fed up with the noise and dust. The single elevator is dirty; probably from the building. To get to breakfast you have to walk through the buidling site and the workers. I think a single female guest would be a little concerned; not unsafe just the subject of unnecessary attention. I think the failure to mention the renovations reflects the attitude towards the hotel's guests. Complacent.. I will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful place to stay .”
Reviews.Author: IrelandSissy
Reviews.Content: we stayed here from 18th Feb, checked out 22nd Feb , would highly reccomend it , even though renovations were in progress they did not disturb us, another aspect for me was the way you had a choice of a smoking room, very central to all , pleasant staff and a more than ample breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Clean Rooms, Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: LKL73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from Feb 15-19, and checked out on Feb 20. Got a room (with one Queen size bed) on the 11th floor. Experience was generally pleasant. The location was great - near Times Square and many places to eat nearby. Room was comfortable and clean. However, the heater in the room worked on and off. Internet access was also very choppy, and went down very regularly. I was there for a business trip and therefore used the room for just basic accommodation, nothing more. Just one incident upon checkout that the management should work to address with the staff: I checked out at 8am plus and asked the front desk staff if she can help me call a taxi. She said that the concierge usually does it but the concierge staff had not arrived yet. Therefore, I had to flag the cab outside myself. Surely, the front desk staff there can dial for a cab using any phone line and not have to re-direct me to the absent concierge desk? I thought that this was very basic service, even for a budget hotel. Flagging a taxi is really no big deal for me but bear in mind that I am a foreigner who was hoping to get some help and it was also freezing cold outside. For the price range, I'd say it is very good value for money, but visitors must manage their expectations and should not expect 5 star comfort and service. I would have given a '4' rating if not for the checkout incident. Otherwise, it's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fine accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Dav3
Reviews.Content: Stayed between the 11 and 18 of Feb. We had a room on 12 floor, and it was great. Clean, comfy, lots of hot water and clean towels every day. The room had an ipod player and a very large flat screen TV. Wireless didn't work over the weekend. Reported it but took untill mon/tue to be fixed The lobby is undergoing renovations - at times it was very noisy and dusty which is something to keep in mind if you're planning on staying there in the next month. But not too much trouble as you are only passing through the lobby. Breakfast was fine the one occasion I had it - but I didn't come to the US to eat Continental breakfast ;-) On offer was bagels, toast, porridge/flakes, donuts, juice, fruit and yoghurt. Only let down was that I had arranged to have a parcel shipped to the hotel to save me international shipping charges. The front desk staff knew I was expecting it, yet by 1800H Weds when I left the hotel I was assured it hadn't arrived. Yet upon returning home I find out the parcel had been delivered at 1521H that day and it had been refused by the hotel. Not very good at all, now I'll have to pay an awfull lot in shipping and import tax beacuse of someones incompetance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the best location!”
Reviews.Author: travelandread
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lucky suprise. After splurging on 5 star hotels, we wanted a cheap hotel for our last stop - and boy was this place worth the money. The location alone was worth the price! 5-10mins walk to 5th ave, times sq, bryant park, and the subway station, rockefeller center, and the public library. It was awesome! There are some great Irish pubs within 2 blocks, and all the fast food you could need surrounding you, plus great shopping up the rd on 5th, and the TKTS theatre booth on the same street at times sq. The hotel itself is cozy, and the rooms are small, but thats to be expected with NYC hotel rooms. The lobby staff were very friendly, and there are 2 computers in the lobby with internet, but they were horrible to use. Very slow, and riddled with viruses. The room was clean, but the bathroom was average. Nothing grose, but passable. The toilet had flushing problems, but the staff came up and fixed that within 10 mins. The same maintenence guy was lovely enough to fix our damaged suitcase, going so far as to go downstairs and get the right tools and come back up to fix it. The compliemntary breakfast was ok. You cant really complain because its free, but there was no place to sit, so we just took the food back upstairs to our room. A tip would be to use the tray in your room and take that downstairs to load, because its tricky carrying everything up. The lifts were fine for such an old building, and you never had to wait long for them. The construction work was going on next door, but didnt bother me at all. I slept right through it. For the amount of money we paid for the room, it was well worth it. Id stay here again because of the location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: DCTH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in January 2009. Had a two double bedded room on 10th floor looking out sort of sideways onto a rather large hole in the ground building site next door. The room was clean and comfortable, although a bit on the small size, but I wasn't in New York to spend hours in my room. There was noise from the building site or maybe from the refurbishment at 11 pm one night. but mostly it was daytime and not too early in the morning. Breakfast is included in the rate and makes this hotel good value for money and includes - bread rolls, toast (make your own), bagels, iced donuts, jam, three types of cereal, butter, cream cheese, apples, bananas, orange juice, apple juice, tea, coffee and milk. The downside of all this lovely food is that the breakfast area is being refurbished and if you are lucky enough to get one of the few tables and chairs it is great - we managed this twice, otherwise you just take what you want and eat it sitting on the sofas at the other end of reception, which when we were there was a bit cold (outside temperatures were 15 degrees F or if you are a Brit then it was in the minuses) and the automatic doors keep opening and shutting. If you have your own computer or other wireless device, then you can use the free wireless internet anywhere in the hotel, including your room, otherwise there are two computers in the reception area with free internet access, although they weren't the most new or reliable, usually there was at least one of them working so you weren't cut off from the internet. The location is great, just over a block from the centre of Times Square. 46th Street comes out just by the TKS booth. I'd probably call it The Hotel near Times Square and not at.

Reviews.Title: “So perfect”
Reviews.Author: FredFinland
Reviews.Content: We changed to The hotel at times square, after a horrible night at The Pod-hotel. I spent the whole night surfing for a good price and a good hotel. I decided to try this, and got really good rates from their own website. I reserved a King- room, for a little compensation of the horrible last night. We arrived at the hotel before check-in time, and a nice piccolo came and took our bags to the storage room. The lobby was simple but classy. The check-in went well, and we were directed to our room at the 4th floor. The room was really clean and tidy, the toilet had been sanitized and had a seal on it. The whole room had a really clean scent on it. Our bed was huge, and pretty soft. The room was equipped with a coffe maker, and all sorts of nice stuff. The street was silent, but on a great location, just a few blocks away from Times Square. I needed to print a car rent voucher, they didn't have a printer at the hotel, but I got directed to the comfort inn, just half a block away. There I got to print my paperwork. It was a bit cold in the room at first, but after contacting the reception, a maintaince guy came up and made his tricks on the warmer. After that, the temperature was great. So we really loved it, clean, silent and classy. No screaming youngsters in the corridor, or other distractions. There were two things we were a little bit confused about. The houskeeper, seemed to be a bit too enthusiastic about cleaning our room, she came into the room two times without knocking, and on the other time we had the "do not disturb"-sign hanging on our door. It was a bit annoying. The other thing concerned phone calls from the room. We are from Finland, and I tought I'll call the reception for prices. They told me, that the price would be around 70snt per minute. And I tought it much cheaper than with my cell, so I used the phone to call my family. After check-out I took a better look at the receipt, and noticed that we had been charged around 2usd per minute. I asked from the receptionist, but he had some bad excuse. I agreed on it, as we were in a hurry to the airport. Summasumarum, I would, and propably will stay here again in the summer. Great pleace!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, shame about the smoking room.”
Reviews.Author: Haylz77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located for Times Square and Fifth Avenue. Lots of things right on the doorstep so cannot fault anything there. On arrival in our room it didn't take long to realise we were in a smoking corridor. We were so shattered we just went to bed but all the bed linen etc had a stale smokey smell. We should've have asked to move but weren't really planning to be in the hotel that much. The hotel staff were mostly friendly until we didn't have any hot water. The front desk first of all told us to leave it running for 5 minutes or so and after 10 mins I called back, only be told to leave it running for 15-20 mins! Not very convenient when there was so much shopping to be done!! This happened three times during our stay so did become a little tiresome and the staff were not very helpful. The breakfast was plentiful but as a previous reviewer said, not many places to eat it due to the current refurb. All in all, good value for money but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here is so stress free”
Reviews.Author: JeanDoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about 3 years ago and it was a pleasant experience. So we went back last year and it was better. This year our stay was delightful again. Very clean, quiet room and comfortable beds. Hot, multi-head shower. Nice common areas, and perhaps most important, incredibly pleasant and helpful staff. The area is very safe and there's a lovely park right across the street. The complimentary breakfast includes fresh fruit, delicious coffee, juice, yogurt, bagels, and more. I wish we could visit NYC more often so we could stay here more often! We think this is the nicest hotel for an unbelievably reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “A + ...Location,Clean, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: DonnaandRick
Reviews.Content: Celebrated our 40th anniversary with a very fun trip to NYC. The location was perfect for walking all Midtown..(check out charming Bryant Park and the NYC Library),and subway was right there for farther trips...including to and from LGA ! Our room was large and clean,bed very comfy and staff regularly asked us if everything was OK......a very generous continental BKFST started us every AM. We walked to Del Frisco's for a great steak dinner with an awesome view! It is obvious this hotel tries to please...Thank you for a great visit to this wonderful city!!!

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, great price”
Reviews.Author: exploringaussie
Reviews.Content: A fellow friend and I stayed here booking a room with 2 double beds. The room was fantastic, kept very clean by housekeeping and the free breakfast was ample, the only downside to a fantastic stay was the front desk whom we likened to Fawlty Towers. It seemed that no one had a clue. We did however only find this amusing and added to the charm. Our rooms were thoroughly modern, very comfortable beds and yes as in other reviews the breakfast room is small but they are in the process of updating and they provide a great service and at no time did we see it as an inconvenience. Location was excellent and so handy to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Family on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: Fishenbabe
Reviews.Content: We needed an affordable place close to Times Square to take our family of eight (almost all teenagers). This hotel was incredibly convenient, clean, newly remodeled, and they were very accomodating. We needed to pull in an extra rollaway bed and it was much nicer than we expected. The room we stayed in was large, and the beds very comfortable. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. With only a 5 minute walk you are in the heart of the city. Don't be scared by the outside..the inside is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NFTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel at Times Square for a week from November 15 to the 22. My husband was travelling on business, and I accompanied him. The location was great, just a couple of blocks from Times Square, and within walking distance of everything I wanted to do in Midtown. I even walked to the Metropolitan Museum of Art in about 35-40 minutes (I am a fast walker). The room was completely acceptable, and although small, it was well laid out. We unpacked, put our suitcases in the closet, and the room was not cluttered at all for the entire week. When I made the reservation, I told the clerk we would be staying a week and he said he would note that and try to give us a bigger room, but I don't know if that was actually the case. We arrived at the hotel before noon and were able to check in right away. I would say the room was recently renovated and given a facelift, and it looked very modern. It had wireless Internet access which we had no problems with, and was necessary as this was a business trip. The only problem we had was the window was a bit drafty, and I thought there were too many long black hairs on the towels. This is a bit of a pet peeve of mine as I have a hair aversion, but I thought thick, coarse, black hairs were visible enough to be removed. The bathroom floor was heated, but we are not sure if that was by design or chance, in any case it was a nice touch. I think we stayed in room 604 (?) and the pipes were really noisy at times. It seemed like when the heat was on it was a bit less noticiable, but if you are a light sleeper it will definately wake you. I told the front desk about it and they offered to move us to another room, and had someone look at it (so maybe they fixed it). We chose not to move for our own convenience, and it was absolutely no reflection on the hotel staff, but it did seem less noticable for the last few days of the stay. The continental breakfast was a very nice touch, and had more than I needed for breakfast, yogurt, toast, cereal, doughnuts, all the usuals. It was clean and tidy and had an attendant at all times. We paid about $160 plus taxes for the room per night, which I thought was well worth it, especially for NYC. This is my third trip to NYC, and I would definately return to this hotel. If you are not looking for luxury, but a clean, standard hotel to base your days activities, this is it. The staff were extremely pleasant and we had no issues with the hotel at all. The bed was really comfortable, which is a big plus in my books!!!! Plus it has an ipod docking station which I thought was a really nice touch. It had some amenties of a higher end hotel at a budget hotel price. I am Canadian and usually stay at Delta hotels, I would put this more in the Comfort Inn line, but certainly at the higher end of this. We ate at a great Brazillian restaurant nearby, plus Burger Joint in the Parker Meridian, Keen's and Joe's Shanghai, all great spots. Definately stay at the Hotel at Times Square. Great hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: futbolnut1989
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel at Times Square the weekend before Christmas (when most hotels in NYC were mad expensive) for a great rate. Booking on the hotel's website was easy. We arrived at Grand Central Station and took a 5 minute taxi ride to the hotel - the location is GREAT. 5 minutes walk to Rockefeller Plaza, a little more to Times Square, and central park is not far off either. There are subway stops close by, and getting a taxi is no problem (the staff were helpful and they gladly got us a cab). The hotel itself is also great. The lobby looks to be newly renovated. Everything is quite classy, especially for a lower priced hotel. The rooms are well designed - pretty modern, something you don't find often in cheaper hotels - and all the furniture seemed to be new. The flat screen TV was hot, and an iHome ipod dock/radio sat on the dresser. Pretty nice for $150 a night! The room was spotless and in perfect order. Everything was clean, looked like we were the first people to stay in the room, something I can not say for some other hotels I've stayed in for similar prices. Nothing about the hotel could have been better. The room was smaller than I'd expected, but only by a little, and was no problem at all. I'd recommend the Hotel at Times Square to a couple on a weekend trip, to a family of four, and anyone in between. Definitely a good find.

HotelInfo.Name: The Hotel at Times Square
HotelInfo.Address: 59 West 46th Street, New York City, NY 10036
